loans.name: Hachem

texts.en:
Hachem is a 54-year-old divorced man, who has spent his whole life taking care of his three children. He was father, mother and friend all at the same time.

Hachem is a hardworking man, sacrificing himself for his children's best interests. He has owned a specialty home products and gift shop since 1995. It's his only source of income and that's why he invests a lot in it to give him back what he's seeking.

Hachem's shop needs some necessary maintenance to be done, in addition to expanding his product range with a new released collection, and that's why he applied for a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua to obtain requested needs.

It's his fourth cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, and he describes his experience as a smart step taken to move forward. He hopes to keep on improving his business as much as he can.

loans.use: To do necessary maintenance to his shop, and to expand his product range with a new collection.

loans.name: Ada Nohemy

texts.es:
La señora Ada Nohemy esta casada y es madre de tres hijos, su esposo le apoya economicamente para cubrir los gastos de su hogar, Ada Nohemy se dedica desde hace 2 años a la venta de calzado y cosmeticos, sus ventas son de manera ambulante, hace los pedidos del producto y luego los distribuye en las casas de sus clientes.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de calzado para dama. 
su meta es hacer crecer su negocio para tener mayores ganancias.
desea darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ada Nohemy is married and the mother of three children.  Her husband helps her financially to cover the household expenses.  Ada Nohemy has worked for two years selling shoes and cosmetics on foot.  She takes requests for the products and later delivers them to her customers' homes.

She will use the loan to buy women's shoes.

Her goal is to make her business grow so she will have bigger profits.  She wants to give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy women's shoes.

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty, de 57 años es una mujer alegre. Vive en compañía de Camilo, su esposo desde hace 36 años. Ambos tienen 10 hijos, pero solo viven con 5 de ellos en su Casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Ancala. La actividad a la que se dedica está esmerada mujer es el bordado de hojas para las faldas y fustanes típicos que usan las personas en festividades del valle, principalmente para el baile del huaylas. Su trabajo consiste en el bordado, que se tarde un promedio de 2 meses, pero si realiza con constancia y ayuda lo termina en un mes. Cada bordado lo comercializa a buen precio, pues requiere de paciencia, tiempo y creatividad. Cuenta que sus hijas le ayudan, pues de esa manera ayudan a su mana en vender más bordados y obtener más ganancias y también en enseñar la tradición familiar. Mientras que su esposo trabaja como albañil construyendo casa, su ganancias se base en contratos, mientras más rápido termine más ganancias tiene. Ahora desea mejorar sus bordados y ser reconocida en su localidad. Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “mollecito” y este es el decimosegundo crédito con MFP, donde esta muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de su cuota. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Betty, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de hilos, telas y adornos para su bordado.
texts.en: Betty is 57 years old. She is a cheerful woman. She lives with Camilo, her husband of 36 years. They have 10 children, but only 5 of them live with them in their own home, located in the community of Ancala. This dedicated woman's activity is embroidering leaves on traditional skirts and slips people use in the valley festivals, mainly for the Huaylas dance. Her job is the embroidery, which takes an average of 2 months, but if she works constantly and gets help she can finish in a month.  She sells each piece of embroidery at a good price, because it requires patience, time and creativity. She remarks that her daughters help her, and this helps their mother to sell more embroidery and make more profit, as well as teach the family tradition. While her husband works as a bricklayer building houses, her work is by contract. The faster she finishes, the more she makes. Now she wants to improve her embroidery and become well known in her community. She belongs to the "Mollecito" communal bank and this is her twelfth loan with MFP. She is very happy there knowing she has financial support, since it makes her feel safe going forward in her work. She promises to make her payments and is happy to be apart of the association because all of the members are responsible and hardworking. If Betty receives your support, she will invest the money she has asked for in buying thread, fabric and decorations for her embroidery.

loans.use: to buy thread and decorations to do embroidery.

loans.name: Shadi

texts.en:
Shadi is a 31-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two school-aged children. He strives to work hard in order to pay his children’s study fees. 

In 2006, he opened his own restaurant where people can meet and have a good time. His business has grown fast and he is looking forward to further expanding his business. 

Today, he’s requesting to borrow $1700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase products such as soft drinks, food and many other items. He notes that this will help him attract more customers and therefore increase his revenue. In the future, he plans to diversify his products by adding seafood to his menu.

loans.use: to purchase products such as soft drinks, food and many other items.

loans.name: Iman

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. She is 43 years old, married and has three children.

Iman has been a tailor since 2000. She makes, repairs, or alters clothing professionally, things such as suits, coats and trousers for women and kids. She has sufficient experience in this field, a deep understanding of local customers, and knows about their needs. She has a good reputation and she is well known in the surrounding areas.

She is requesting a $2,000 loan to rent a boutique store to display the clothing. She is aiming to gain more profits to offer her the opportunity to provide a better life for her family as a whole.

loans.use: to rent a boutique store to display clothing

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en:
Damaris is 32 years old. She is a married mother of two children aged eight and six years old. She has a mobile boutique and has been in the business for the past two years. She gets a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

This is her first loan from KADET Ltd. She will use the loan to add to the stock of clothes for her business.

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by KADET Ltd. staff. She hopes to venture into a farming business in future.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Saddam

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 38 years old, married and has three children.

Saddam has been an owner of a bakery since 2008. He produces and sells flour-based foods baked in oven such as bread, cakes, pastries and pies. He has sufficient experience in this field and a good reputation. His bakery is situated in a crowded area where there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $1800 loan in order to purchase a large dough mixer. He is aiming to earn more profit to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to purchase a large dough mixer.

loans.name: Nyankuany

texts.en:
Nyankuany is a 25-year-old married woman with three children; all of them are in school. She has had a business selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for four years.

Nyankuany is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. she will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne Wanjiru is a 33-year-old business lady in Mombasa. She makes yoghurts and fresh juices to sell. She is married. She has been doing this business for the last three years with success. 

This is Anne’s first business loan from KADET to finance her business. She plans to purchase sugar, food coloring, milk, fresh fruit  and  a refrigerator.

She will use the anticipated profits to  repay her loan and to open another business. She hopes to have a well-established business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, food coloring, milk  and a refrigerator.

loans.name: Abduhakim

texts.ru: Абдухаким проживает в городе Вахдат. Возраст, 53 года. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. Абдухаким занимается скотоводством. Он разводит крупнорогатый скот у себя дома. Этим видом деятельности занимается 14 лет. Кредит берет для закупа крупнорогатого скота.
texts.en: Abduhakim lives in the city of Vahdat.  He is 53 years old, married and has two children.  Abduhakim is involved in animal husbandry.  He breeds cattle at home.  He has been in this business for 14 years.  Abduhakim is requesting this loan to purchase cattle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Ghassan

texts.en: Ghassan is a 38-year-old Lebanese man living with his wife and two children, who are still attending school. He has owned a juice shop in his town for the past eight years. He spends most of his time working, but in the end he knows that he’s offering a fair way of living for his family, and this is what he cares about most. Today, he’s asking for a loan of $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase the needed quantity of fresh fruits for his business. He notes that this will improve his business and thus his economic situation. In the future, he plans to expand his business and open a coffee shop.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fruits for his business.

loans.name: Conrada

texts.en:
Conrada is 63-year-old married woman with 6 children. Her husband works as a farmer.

Conrada has had a sari-sari store for 10 years. She sells items like coffee, shampoo, soap, vinegar, cooking oil, and canned goods. Conrada earns about 4500 PHP per month with her business, which enables her to help provide for her family's daily needs.

Conrada has requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, sugar, and noodles. She hopes her business will grow bigger.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, sugar, and noodles.

loans.name: Mahmatkhon

texts.ru: Махматхон проживает в районе Фархор. Ему 42 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Он уже четыре года занимается торговлей. У него имеется продуктовый магазин. Он привозит продукты с города Душанбе. Кредит берет для покупки вафель, кондитерских и колбасных изделий.
texts.en: Mahmatkhon lives in the Farkhor district.  He is 42 years old, married and has four children.  He has been involved in sales for four years.  He owns a food market.  Mahmatkhon delivers his products from the city of Dushanbe.  He is requesting this loan to purchase waffles, confectionery and sausage goods.

loans.use: to buy waffles, confectionery and sausage goods

loans.name: Namozboy

texts.ru: Намозбой проживает в районе Фархор. Ему 53 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Он зарабатывает путем разведения крупнорогатого скота. Кредит берет для закупа телят.
texts.en: Namozboy lives in the Farkhor district.  He is 53 years old, married and has four children.  He earns a living by breeding cattle.  Namozboy is requesting this loan to purchase calves.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Sunatullo

texts.ru: Сунатулло житель города Вахдат. Ему 24 года. Он женат. У него один ребенок. Сунатулло предоставляет услугу, такси. В этой области он три года. Целью получения кредита является установка оборудования для природного газа.
texts.en: Sunatullo is a resident of the city of Vahdat.  He is 24 years old, married and has one child.  Sunatullo provides a taxi service and has been in this business for three years.  The goal of obtaining this loan is to install natural gas equipment.

loans.use: to install natural gas equipment

loans.name: Habibullo

texts.ru: Хабибулло проживает в городе Вахдат. Он женат. Ему 29 лет. У него один ребенок. Он занимается скотоводством. Этим видом деятельности занимается семь лет. Кредит берет для закупа коровы.
texts.en: Habibullo lives in the city of Vahdat.  He is 29 years old, married and has one child.  He is involved in animal husbandry and has been in this business for seven years.  Habibullo is requesting this loan to purchase a cow.

loans.use: to purchase a cow

loans.name: Eva Julia

texts.es:
la sra. Eva tiene 66 años de edad, es madre de 4 hijos pero ninguno de ellos dependen de ella, es viuda y su actividad principal es la renta de cuartos, actividad que tiene más de 16 años de realizarla,  su cuartería se ubica en su casa de habitación,  Doña Eva a sabido aprovechar cada uno de los créditos que a solicitado, a construido nuevos cuartos, a ido haciendo reparaciones en su casa, es notorio los arreglos efectuados lo que le ha permitido cambiar la estética de su cuartería y que le facilita subirle a la renta a sus inquilinos.
Nos esta solicitando el credito para seguir haciendo mejoras en su cuartería.
texts.en:
Eva, 66, is the mother of four children, but none of them are dependent on her.  She is a widow and her principal work is renting rooms, a job she has been doing for more than 16 years.  Her housing is located in her home.

Eva knew how to make the most of each one of the loans she has requested.  She built new rooms and made repairs to her house.  It's obvious that the repairs made have allowed her to change the aesthetic of her rooming house and that they facilitate raising her tenants' rent.

She is requesting the loan from us to continue making improvements to her housing.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Luvuno

texts.en:
Luvuno is a 38-year-old farmer in Voi. She is a married mother of four. She has been selling farm produce successfully for the past four years. 

This marks Luvuno's third loan from KADET LTD. She plans to purchase a bigger plot of land to do her farming. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children. She hopes a have a happier, well-cared-for family.

loans.use: to purchase a bigger plot of land.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es: Carlos, de 27 años de edad, es un joven padre de familia. Vive en compañía de Ani, su esposa, ambos tienen una hija pequeña, Maricielo a la que quieren en una casa alquilada ubicada en la ciudad de Chilca. Él nació en la ciudad de Huancayo, pero sus padres son del campo, por ello se siente orgulloso de ellos. Le enseñaron a trabajar muy duro, su principal objetivo es construir su casita en un terreno que heredó de su madre en la ciudad. Por ello comenzó a trabajar en el trasporte, cubriendo las rutas de Huancayo hacia la ciudad de Huancavelica, cuenta que realiza de uno a dos viajes, ganando muy bien por cada uno de ellos. Pero como su esposa es una mujer trabajadora y le ayuda en lo que puede, realiza pequeñas artesanías, que consiste en la realización hombres pequeños a base de alambres e hilos, al día realiza un millar de ellos, recibiendo buen pago por su trabajo. Ahora desea manejar ómnibus más grande para eso necesita una nueva licencia de conducir, obteniéndola, podría ganar mucho más y de esa manera cumplir con su objetivo. Él pertenece al grupo solidario “chila” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde esta muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su trabajo. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de su cuota. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Carlos de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en el pago de los trámites para su licencia en el manejo de carros mucho más grandes.
texts.en: Carlos, 27, is a young father.  He lives with his wife, Ani, and their daughter, Maricielo--who they dearly love--in a rented house in Chilca.  Carlos was born in the city of Huancayo, but his parents are from the country and he’s proud of them for that.  Carlos has always worked hard.  His plan is to build a small house on a plot of land in the city, left to him by his mother.  He started his taxi business to raise the money he needs.  He drives the route between Huancayo and the city of Huancavelica, a trip that he makes once or twice [a day, a week?—not clear] and he’s happy with his earnings from the business.  His wife has a crafts business, turning wire and thread into human figures.  She makes around a thousand of the figures a day and is well paid for her work.  Carlos wants to drive larger buses, but he needs a new set of licensing and it’s expensive to get.  He could earn a lot more with it, though, and that’s why he’s applying for this loan.   He belongs to the Chila community bank and this is his first MFP loan.  He was pleased to learn about this means of financing because the money will allow him to grow his business.  He, in turn, agrees to repay the loan in the agreed-upon time.  He likes his community bank because the members are responsible and supportive.  Carlos, upon receiving your loan, will pay for the licensing he needs to grow his taxi business.

loans.use: to get required licensing for his taxi business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 45-year-old lady from Kisumu City, situated along the shores of Lake Victoria. She is married to Dicken, and they have five children between the ages of 18 and 30 years.

Alice operates a business renting out chairs and tents in Nyalenda. She has been in this business for the last 10 years, making a monthly income of KES 30,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more chairs and tents. She will use her profits to expand her business. Her dream is to have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy tents and chairs for her rental business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a modest 40-year-old lady from the Nyalenda area of Kisumu City. She is married to a businessman, Victor, and they have two young children.

Judith operates a food stall in Nyalenda. She has been in this business for the past year. In a month, she makes a profit of KES 6,000. She is in her first loan cycle with KADET LTD, and she will use the loan to buy foodstuffs like maize and beans.

Her profits will be used to educate her children. Her dream is to open a hotel [restaurant].

loans.use: to buy maize and beans.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain his moto-taxi.

loans.name: Marleny

texts.es: Marleny, de 35 años es una joven responsable. Vive en compañía de sus padres y hermanos a los que cuida en su casa propia, ubicada en la ciudad de Chilca. Su única responsabilidad es mantener a sus padres tranquilos. Por ello trabaja sin descanso en la compra y venta de ovejas pequeñas, que es su especialidad. Su trabajo consiste en viajar a la altura donde crían los animales, para comprar a los ganaderos por cantidad, ella misma los traslada a la ciudad donde los comercializa a las diferentes ferias del valle. Le va muy bien en su trabajo por ello se siente realizada, ya que desde muy joven comenzó este trabajo cada año obtiene mejores clientes y por ende mejores ganancias. Los meses que tiene más ingresos son desde marzo a septiembre, que los pobladores se alistan para la época festiva en conmemoración de los animales. Ahora desea consolidarse en su negocio.  Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “chilca” y este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, donde esta muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de su cuota. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias.  Marleny, de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de ovejas para su negocio.
texts.en:
Marleny, 35, is a responsible young woman.  She lives with her parents and siblings, whom she cares for in her own home, located in the city of Chilca.  Her only responsibility is to keep her parents calm, for which she works without rest buying and selling young sheep, which is her specialty.

Her job consists of traveling to the altitude at which they raise the animals, to buy large quantities from the ranchers.  She herself transports them to the city where she sells them at the various markets in the valley.  Her job is going very well for her, for which she feels fulfilled because she started this job when she was very young.  Every year she gets better customers and, as a result, better profits.  The months from March to September are when she has the most income, since the residents are getting ready for the holiday season in commemoration of the animals.  Now she wants to grow in her business.

She belongs to the Chilca solidarity group, and this is her fourth loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she will have some financial help because in this way she feels secure about making progress with her business.  On the other hand, she promises to make the payments on time.  Also, it pleases her to be part of her communal bank because all the members are responsible and supportive people.

If she receives your support, Marleny will invest the requested money in buying sheep for her business.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Primitivo

texts.es:
Primitivo, de 60 años de edad, es un hombre trabajador y empeñoso con muchas ganas de progresar. Está separado de la madre de sus hijos, pero vive en compañía de ellos en su propia casa.
La actividad que realiza Primitivo es el cultivo de yucas y plátanos, productos que los vende vende en los mercados de su localidad, asimismo tiene para su consumo personal. Además de tener sembríos de palma aceitera contando para eso con un terreno de 20 hectáreas que lo adquirió hace 50 años, tiempo que viene ejerciendo este oficio. Por otro lado sus hijos lo apoyan en la cosecha,  compartiendo las ganancias. Le gusta su negocio pues lo conoce muy bien ya que lleva muchos años dedicándose a éste trabajo y dicha experiencia la está pasando a sus hijos. Las ganancias que le deja, ha sabido administrarlo para procurar que no les falte nada a sus hijos. Por lo contario, lo que no le gusta es que la lejanía de su ubicación ha demorado en llegar los servicio básico como la luz eléctrica, pero con los nuevos programas eso se está logrando mejorar. Ahora tiene los deseos de ampliar su negocio y dejar a sus hijos con algo seguro para sus futuro. Este será el préstamo número 01 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Ademas de estar bien con su banco comunal pues conoce a la mayoría de sus integrantes y los considera buenas personas.
Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de abono para la producción de palma así como el pago de personal para la cosecha de sus productos.
texts.en:
Primitivo, 60, is a diligent, hard-working man with a strong drive to get ahead.  He is separated from the mother of his children, but they still live together in a house that he owns.
Primitivo has a farming business.  He grows yucca and platanos and sells what he doesn’t need for his own use at a local market.  He also produces palm oil on 20 hectares of land that he bought 50 years ago, when he first began farming.  His children help him harvest his crop and he shares his earnings with them.  He likes the business and knows it well because he’s worked at it for many years, and he’s now passing what he knows along to his children.  He has learned to manage any money that he has left to better provide for his children.  He lives too far out, he says, to receive basic services like electricity, but there are new programs in place that he hopes will deliver better services in the future.  Primitivo is a new borrower and this is his first MFP loan.  He is counting on your support to help him continue his business.  He likes his community bank because he knows most of the members and considers them to be good people.  
He will use this 800 new soles loan to buy organic manure to produce palm and to pay day laborers to help him harvest his crop.

loans.use: to pay for day laborers and buy supplies for his farming business.

loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en: Gantulga is 50 years old and lives with his wife, Otgon, and 2 sons in western Mongolia. His wife works as a decorator in a construction business during the summer. His sons study at the local secondary school. He has been running a welding business from his home since 2000. Over the years, he has established a well-known service in the area and has gained regular customers. Based on his experience, he decided to expand his equipment so that he can supply more services and save for his sons' college fees.  He is a really intelligent guy who says, "I would like to extend my business by getting some necessary tools with help from you." The total amount he is requesting is 3,000,000 MNT to purchase welding materials.

loans.use: to purchase materials for welding

loans.name: Ding

texts.en:
Ding is a 37-year-old married woman with four children, three of whom are in school. For two years, she has had a business selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan.

Ding is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ajak

texts.en:
Ajak is a 30-year-old married woman with five children, two of whom are in school. For three years, she has had a business selling fish in Bor, South Sudan.

Ajak is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Armanda

texts.es:
En la parroquia Charapoto del cantón Sucre en la Provincia de Manabí se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Virgen De Guadalupe. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 31 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco hijos de 16, 12, 11, 7 y 2 años de edad, los dos  mayores estudian en colegio y los dos siguientes en escuela. El marido es comerciante. 

Ella junto a su esposo se dedican a la venta  de frutas y legumbres en su casa donde tienen  un pequeño local, su esposo se levanta bien de mañana para ir al mercado de mayoristas y comprar a los agricultores que llegan con sus productos desde el campo,   luego lleva los productos a su local para venderles a sus clientes.  Con lo poco que tenían empezaron este negocio y así lo han mantenido ya por  9 años y gracias a esto ellos  han podido sacar adelante a su familia.

Este crédito lo van a emplear en comprar frutas y legumbres  para la  venta, está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta por la ayuda que les brinda la institución. 

Sus sueños seguir adelante por el bienestar de  sus hijos.
texts.en:
Virgen de Guadalupe Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the parish of Carapoto in the canton of Sucre in the province of Manabí.  This area is known for its traditional culture as well as for being a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Rosa lives in this location.  She is 31 years old and maintains a common-law relationship in which she has five children, ages 16, 12, 11, 7, and 2.  The two oldest are studying in high school and the next two in elementary school.  Her husband is a storekeeper.

She and her husband work selling fruits and vegetables in their home, where they have a small store.  Her husband gets up very early to go to the wholesale market to buy from the farmers who come from the country with their products.  Then he takes the products to his place to sell to their customers.  They began this business with the little they had, and in this way they have supported it for nine years already.  Thanks to this they have been able to get their family ahead.

She is going to use this loan to buy fruits and vegetables to sell.

She has been with the communal bank since the beginning, and she likes it because of the help the institution offers her.  Her dream is to get ahead for the well-being of her children.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.es: Jacinta, de 42 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y emprendedora con muchas ganas de progresar. Está separada del padre de sus hijos, pero vive en compañía de ellos, habitando en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Jacinta es la venta de pollos, para eso pone todos los días una mesa en el frontis de su casa, donde prepara los pollos para la venta. Estos animales los compra vivos de la granja de su hermano, quien le vende a precio preferencial, para luego beneficiarlos para su venta. Lleva en este negocio cerca de 06 años, y y hasta el momento le ha ido muy bien, además cuetna con el apoyo de sus hijos. Le gusta su negocio pues le ha traído muchas satisfacciones, tanto personales como económicas ya que le ha permito pagar los estudios de su hijos quienes son su mayor orgullo. Las ganancias económicas que le deja, los ahorra pues tiene plan abrir una bodega de abarrotes en su casa, de esa manera se generará más ingresos económicos. Este será el préstamo número 03 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Por otro lado, se siente bien con su banco comunal pues los conspira un grupo unido. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 nuevos soles los invertirá en la compra pollos para la venta en su negocio, y con el saldo comprará abarrotes para iniciar su negocio de bodega.
texts.en:
Jacinta, 42, is a diligent, hard-working woman with a strong drive to get ahead.  She is separated from the father of her children, but they all still live together in a shared house.  
Jacinta has a poultry business.  She sets up a table in front of her house where she prepares chickens for sale.  Her brother raises the chickens on his farm and sells them to her at a discounted price.  She has operated the business for almost 6 years and she’s happy with her progress.  She says, too, that she can rely on her children to help her with the business.  She likes owning her own business, not only because she can pay to send her children—her pride and joy—to school, but also because the business has brought her great personal satisfaction.  She saves everything that she can because she wants to open a corner grocery in her house, a business that she thinks will significantly increase her earnings.  This will be her third MFP loan and she is counting on your support to meet her goals.  She likes her community bank, she says, because the members support one another.  
Jacinta will use part of this 2000 new soles loan to buy chickens for her poultry business and the rest to stock her new grocery business.

loans.use: to buy more chickens for her poultry business and to stock her new grocery business.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia, de 35 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y decidida con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es conviviente con Francisco quien es empleado, fruto de esa unión tienen 05 hijos y juntos habitan en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Lidia es la venta de comida rápida como salchipapas, juanes, y otros, es así que todos los días instala en un esquina de su localidad, su freidora, mesas y sillas, y atiende amablemente  a sus clientes. Contando con el apoyo de sus hijos, quienes le apoyan en la preparación y atención al cliente. Le gusta su negocio pues le genera ingresos económicos para solventar los gastos de su hogar y apoyar a su pareja. Por lo contario agota guerzas el instalar y desinstalar su puesto de venta, por eso quisiera alquilar un local donde tendría todo listo para la atención a sus clientes. Ahora ve que las ganancias son buenas y cotando con el apoyo de su pareja tiene planes de alquilar un local y colocar más mesas y sillas. Por tanto éste sería el préstamo número 01 con la institución MFP, por lo que espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con sus objetivos. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de mesas y sillas, así como ingredientes para la preparación de su comida.
texts.en:
Lidia, age 35, is a hard-working and determined woman with a great desire to get ahead.  She lives with Franscisco, who is employed.  They have five children, and they live together in their own house.

Lidia sells fast food like “salchipapas” (fried potatoes and fried sausages), “juanes”  (a traditional chicken and rice meal), and others.  Every day she sets herself up on her corner with her fryer, tables, and chairs, and she kindly waits on her customers.  She has help from her children; they help with the preparation and with waiting on the customers.

She likes her business; it generates income to cover the household expenses and helps her life partner.  On the contrary, it exhausts her to set up and take down her stall.  That is why she would like to rent a place where everything would be ready to take care of her customers.

Now, seeing that her income is good, and counting on the support of her life partner, she has plans to rent a place and set up more tables and chairs.  

This would be her first loan with MFP.  She is hoping for a small loan in order to be able to reach her objectives.  She will use the requested 1,500 soles to buy tables, chairs, and ingredients to prepare her food.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and ingredients to prepare her food.

loans.name: Imperial Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “IMPERIAL” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Santiago II, está compuesta por siete integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Eulalia es la Tesorera. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: costura de enaguas y polleras, venta de comida, venta de tejidos, venta de golosinas, tejidos de chompas, taller de tejido, fabrica de pipocas, tejido de mantas.

La señora Eulalia,  indica que es la primera vez que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución voluntariamente. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de costura de polleras e enaguas que viene trabajando hace algún tiempo, aprendiendo este oficio en un instituto de formación.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de telas y centros) que adquirirá de la Ceja y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio comercial. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella es soltera y tiene dos hijos.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y los ahorros.

El la fotografía no esta presente la señora rebeca por razones culturales.
texts.en:
The communal association 'Imperial' is starting their first cycle with 'Pro Mujer', as a part of the larger group 'Santiago II'. The group is made up of seven members and is lead by a board of directors, in which Eulalia is the treasurer. The businesses that the members of the communal association are involved with are varied and include: sewing skirts and petticoats, selling food, selling woven products, selling snacks, weaving sweaters, a weaving shop, making popcorn and weaving cloth.

Eulalia told us that it is the first time that she has worked with 'Pro Mujer' and that she joined the organization voluntarily. She has a business where she sews skirts and petticoats. She has been working in this for some time now. She learned how to do this work in a training institute.  

The loan that she is taking out now is to increase her capital to buy fabrics and ribbons. She will buy her supplies and later after making her products will sell them in her commercial space. This small business allows her to make income to help support her family. She is a single mother of two children. 
 
When we asked her what she likes most about 'Pro Mujer', she said she likes the trainings about savings. 

In the picture Rebeca is not present for cultural reasons.

loans.use: to buy cloth and ribbons.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 31 years old, married and has two children.

Haydar has been an owner of a sweet shop since 1993, making a number of types of regional specialties sweets. He has sufficient experience in this field and has a good reputation. His shop is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He is requesting a $3,000 loan to purchase a sweet-making machine and to add more tables to his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: To purchase a sweet-making machine and to add more tables to his shop.

loans.name: Deivis

texts.es: Deivis de 20 años de edad es un joven negociante, que se dedica a la venta de celulares y accesorios y al mantenimiento  y reparación de estos. Su experiencia data desde hace 2 años, cuando   su tío le enseñó el oficio, al que posteriormente se dedicó por su propia cuenta y con su esfuerzo propio en una terraza de una vecina. En la actualidad tiene la  meta de tener un local estructurado con mayor amplitud, en el que sus clientes encuentren un ambiente confortable y esto es lo que está planeando muy pronto con su familia. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el   comprará celulares modernos, carcazas y baterías, para ofrecer una venta más actualizada a sus clientes y lograr aumentar sus inventarios y atraer su potencial clientela. En la actualidad sus indicadores financieros muestran una rentabilidad promedia de un 55,58%, mientras sus inventarios rotan cada 38 días; desde este panorama financiero inicia Deivis su ascenso, en su crecimiento empresarial.
texts.en: Deivis is a young businessman, only 20 years old, and already has his own cell phone business.  He sells cell phones and cell phone accessories and also maintains and repairs them.  He learned the business from his uncle 2 years ago and then set up his own business on a neighbor’s terrace.  His goal, now, is to open a shop where he can display more products and attract more customers, a goal that he hopes to meet soon with help from his family.  This Kiva loan is the first that Deivis will receive from Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo.  He will use it to buy the latest cell phones and cell phone accessories he needs to stock his business.  He knows that expanding the range of products he sells will help him attract more customers.  His business plan indicates an average profit of 55.58% and an inventory turnover of 38 days.  Deivis is off to a good start toward his goal of becoming a successful entrepreneur and now he wants to grow and grow.

loans.use: to stock her cell phone business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fish for sale.

loans.name: G.s Manantial Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario está conformado por tres emprendedoras que son de la misma localidad donde habitan, cada una de las emprendedoras tienen su propio negocio, su objetivo de ellas al formar parte de este grupo es para motivarse entre ellas y salir adelante cada una con los  negocios. Este grupo solidario está solicitando financiamiento para invertir en los negocios. Martha Elena es una emprendedora que tiene su negocio de la venta de cosméticos y variedad de mercadería en general, ella está solicitando financiamiento para comprar variedad de ropa, cosméticos como pinturas, polvo, lápiz labial, crema, lápiz de ojo entre otros cosméticos.
texts.en: This community bank has three members.  They're enterprising young women from the same town, each of whom has her own business.  They started the community bank because they wanted a means of supporting one another and growing their different businesses.  They're applying for a loan now to invest in their businesses.  Martha Elena is an entrepreneur.  She operates a business selling cosmetics and general merchandise.  She will use this loan to buy clothing and cosmetics--lipstick, powder, creams, eye shadow, etc.--that she will resell.

loans.use: to stock her cosmetics business.

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: Justina, de 33 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora con muchas ganas de salir adelante y progresar. Esta separada del padre de sus hijos, pero eso no la desanima. Vive en compañía de sus 04 hijos, 01 nuera y su nieto a quienes quiere mucho. juntos habitan en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Justina es la agricultura específicamente al sembrío de palma aceitera, pues lo considera como un negocio sumamente rentable. Para eso cuenta con un terreno de 20 hectáreas de las cuales 06 hectáreas las tiene en producción. Tiene más de 03 años dedicándose a esta actividad y esto es gracias al incentivo del gobierno regional quien les proporcionó las semillas, además del apoyo de sus hijos quienes l apoyaron en el mantenimiento de las parcelas. Le gusta esta actividad por ha ganancias que recibe, de esa manera paga el personal que emplea para la cosecha, además de sus gastos familiares. Viendo los buenos resultados, tiene planes de ampliar su negocio, construyendo una piscigranja o una establos para criar cerdos, así logrará generarse más ingresos económicos. Este será el préstamo número 01 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles lo invertirá en el pago de personal para la temporada de cosecha de palma aceitera.
texts.en:
Justina, 33, is a hardworking woman who very much wants to get ahead and make progress.  She is separated from the father of her children, but this does not discourage her.  She lives with her four children, one daughter-in-law, and her grandson, all of whom she loves very much.  Together they live in her own house.

The work Justina does is agriculture, specifically growing oil palm trees.  She considers it a very profitable business for which she has a 20-hectare plot of land, six of which are in production.  She has been doing this work for more than three years, and this is thanks to a regional government incentive that provided the seeds.  She also has the support of her children, who helped her maintain the plots.

She likes this work because of the profits she earns.  In this way she pays for the personnel she hires for the harvest as well as for her family expenses.  Seeing the good results, she is planning to expand her business by building a fish farm or stables to raise pigs.  In this way she will manage to generate more income for herself.

This will be her first loan with the MFP institution.  She hopes for your collaboration so she can realize her plans.

With the requested loan of 800 PEN, she will invest in paying for staff for the oil palm tree harvest season.

loans.use: to hire day laborers.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es: Alejandrina, de 47 años de edad, es una mujer empeñosa  y trabajadora, además de amable y solidaria. Convive  con Máximo, quien es agricultor, y juntos habitan en su propia casa a lado de su hijo de 11 años. La actividad que realiza Alejandrina es la venta de abarrotes de primera necesidad para esto cuenta con una bodega instalada en su propia casa, que lo abrió por la necesidad económica que atravesaban, ya que con los ingresos de su pareja no les alcanzaba. Ahora cuenta con un ingreso adicional que le da un alivio. Tiene 8 meses incursionando dicho negocio y la ayuda de su pareja le ha ido muy bien. Le gusta lo que hace, pues le permite tener un ingreso adicional con el cual pueda apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, asimismo tiene tiempo de estar en casa y cuidar de su pequeño hijo al que quiere mucho y que ahora está cursando sus estudios. Por lo contario no le agrada cuando algunos de sus clientes le solicitan crédito por sus compras a lo que ella se niega ya que considera que su negocio está en crecimiento y no le conviene este tipo de venta. Tiene planes de progresar su negocio comprando más productos. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Además de sentirse cómoda con su banco comunal, considera que es un grupo responsable y solidario. Con el monto solicitado de 1000 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de productos de primera necesidad y al por mayor para abastecer su bodega.
texts.en:
Alejandrina, 47, is a determined, hardworking woman who is also kind and supportive.  She lives in their own house with Máximo who is a farmer and with their 11-year-old son.  Alejandrina’s activity is selling basic staple groceries from a home-based store that she opened because of economic need they were going through because her spouse’s income was insufficient.  Now, she can count on an additional source of income which is a comfort.  She’s been in this business now for 8 months and with help from her spouse has done well.

She likes what she does because it produces extra income to help her spouse with household expenses while allowing her to remain at home and care for her young son who she loves very much and is currently attending school.  On the other hand, she isn’t too happy when customers come by and ask her for credit because her business is in the growing stage and she does not believe that this type of sale is beneficial to her.  She has plans to make progress with her store buying more products.

This will be MFP loan #2 so she’s hopeful of your collaboration to make her plans a reality.  She feels comfortable in her communal bank; she considers her group to be responsible and supportive.  She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy basic staple items at wholesale to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy basic staple items to stock her store.

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es: Amalia, de 37 años, es una mujer trabajadora, empeñosa y decidida con muchas ganas de sobresalir. Convive con Carlos quien es chofer de autos, fruto de esa unión tienen 05 hijos y juntos habitan en su casa propia. La actividad que inició es la venta de abarrotes para abrió una bodega en su casa, ya que ha visto la experiencia de sus amistades que tiene el mismo negocio y viendo que les resulta rentable. Ahroa lo que más desea es poner todo de su parte para progresar. Le gusta lo que hace, pues es mas tranquilo, y sin mucho esfuerzo tiene ganancias, además le permite tener tiempo para dedicarlos a sus hijos. Este será el préstamo número 01 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además de estar a gusto con su banco comunal, pues ha observado que es un grupo unido y colaborador logrando tener bastante apoyo entre ellos. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles lo piensa invertir en su nuevo negocio comprando productos al por mayor para abastecer su tienda.
texts.en:
Amalia, 37, is a hardworking, dedicated, determined woman who very much wants to get ahead.  She lives with Carlos who is car driver.  They have five children and they all live together in their own house. 

The activity she started is grocery sales; she opened a store at home because she saw the experience friends in the same business had and she noticed that it was profitable.  Now, what she most wants is to put everything she has into it to make progress.  

She enjoys what she does because it’s more tranquil and without much effort is profitable.  Besides, it allows her to have time to dedicate to her children.

This will be MFP loan #1 and she’s hoping for your collaboration to continue with her objectives.  She’s comfortable in her communal bank because she’s observed that it’s a united, cooperative group that has accomplished quite a bit among themselves.  She will use the requested 800 new soles to invest in the business buying products at wholesale to stock her store.

loans.use: to buy basic staple items to stock her store.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

En este lugar conocimos a Rosa, tiene 40 años de edad, está soltera  y vive con su mamá. Es socia del Banco Comunal hace ya 9 años, es la presidenta del Banco y le gusta porque sus compañeras son muy responsables y además por los beneficios que recibe de la institución.
 
Ella tiene un pequeño local en casa de la mamá en el cual vende dulces, helados y golosinas, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 19h00, en las noches prepara sus deliciosos helados de distintos sabores que hace varios años aprendió a elaborar  y que le quedan deliciosos y son el deleite de sus clientes que en la gran mayoría son de un colegio que está justo al frente de su casa. Tiene más de seis años en este negocio y  le va muy bien, ahora está a la espera de que llegue la temporada ya que en esta época es cuando más vende sus productos ya que  llegan muchos turistas a este precioso lugar.

Este crédito es para comprar dulces, golosinas, frutas, leche y azúcar necesarios para preparar sus deliciosos helados.
 
Sus sueños son tener un negocio más grande y una casa propia.
texts.en:
In Crucita Parish in Portoviejo Canton meet the members of the “Crucita” communal bank.  This location is noted for the beautiful beaches that surround it that are visited by national and international tourists; it’s knows as “Crucita la Bella” [Crucita the Beautiful].

We met Rosa, 40, here.  She’s single and lives with her mother.  She’s been in the communal bank for 9 years and is the bank President.  She likes it because her fellow members are very responsible and also because of the benefits she gets from the institution.

She has a small locale at her mother’s house where she sells candy, ice-cream and snacks.  She works every day from 8am until 7pm and in the evening she makes delicious ice-cream of various flavors that she learned how to make years ago; they turn out delicious and her customers love them.  Most of her customers are from a school that’s across from her house.  She’s been in business over six years and does very well.  Now, she’s waiting for the season to arrive which is when her products sell the most since many tourists come to this beautiful place.

This loan is to buy candy, snacks, fruit, milk and sugar that she needs to make her delicious ice-cream.  Her dream is to have a bigger business and a house of her own.

loans.use: to buy candies, snacks, fruit, milk and sugar.

loans.name: Andrea Alexandra

texts.es:
En la parroquia Charapoto del cantón Sucre en la Provincia de Manabí se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Virgen De Guadalupe. Esta localidad se conoce por su cultura tradicional y además por estar a pocos minutos de dos de las  mejores playas de la provincia como son San Jacinto y San Clemente.

En este lugar conocimos a Andrea, tiene 21 años de edad, está soltera y vive en casa de sus padres junto a sus hermanos menores.  Estudio en la Universidad y obtuvo el título de Tecnóloga en computación.

Ella es una chica luchadora que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudar a sus padres en los gastos se dedica a la venta productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja cuatro días de la semana unas tres horas por dia, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana.  Gracias a lo que estudio también realiza ciertos trabajos en computadoras así como arreglos e instalaciones de programas por lo cual recibe un pago y esto es un ingreso extra que tiene. Lleva más  de tres años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos y bisutería. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos se ha podido ayudar para sacar su negocio adelante.
 
Su sueño es tener un trabajo estable en lo que se especializo.
texts.en:
Virgen de Guadalupe Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the parish of Carapoto in the canton of Sucre in the province of Manabí. This area is known for its traditional culture as well as for being a few minutes from two of the best beaches in the province, San Jacinto and San Clemente.

Here we met Andrea.  She is 21 years old and single, and lives in her parents' house with her younger brothers.  She studied in the university and obtained a degree in computer technology.

She is a fighter who works selling Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories) to get her own resources with which to help her parents with the expenses.  She works some three hours a day, four days a week.  She leaves her products on credit and collects payment weekly.  Thanks to what she studied, she also does certain computer jobs such as fixing and installing programs, for which she receives payment, and this is an extra income she has.  She has been doing this work for more than three years and it is going very well for her.

This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, and costume jewelry.  She has been with the communal bank since the beginning, and she likes it because she has been able to help herself get her business ahead with the loans.

Her dream is to have a stable job in what she specialized in.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Zoila Eliomar

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

En este lugar vive la señora Zoila, ella tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos de 21, 19 y 15 años de edad, dos de ellos viven con ella y estudian en universidad y colegio.  El marido es chofer.
 
Ella tiene una tienda general en su casa, allí vende de todo un poco desde arroz, azúcar, detergentes enlatados, entre otras muchas cosas, allí  también vende carne, pescado camarón, legumbres y  ciertos remedios y artículos de bazar como ropa zapatos y bisutería, trabaja todos los días desde las 06h00 hasta las 20h00 con la ayuda de su esposo y de sus hijos. La mercadería la compra en la ciudad de Portoviejo y otros de los productos los recibe en su local. Lleva más de 8 años con su negocio y que le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para surtir su tienda, para comprar arroz, azúcar, atún, detergentes,  artículos de bazar y de primera necesidad.  Ella es socia del Banco Comunal hace tres años y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe de la institución.
 
Sus sueños son tener un carro y un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
In Crucita Parish in Portoviejo Canton meet the members of the “Crucita” communal bank.  This location is noted for the beautiful beaches that surround it that are visited by national and international tourists; it’s knows as “Crucita la Bella” [Crucita the Beautiful].

Zoila, 40, lives here.  She’s married and has three children who are 21, 19 and 15 years old.  Two of them still live with her and are attending University and secondary school.  Her husband is a driver.

She has a general store at home where she sells a little bit of everything from rice, sugar, detergent and canned goods to many other things.  She also sells meat, fish, shrimp, vegetables and certain remedies and household items like shoes and costume jewelry.  She works every day from 6am until 8pm with help from her husband and children.  She buys her merchandise in the city of Portoviejo and some of the products are delivered to her at her store.  She’s been in business more than 8 years and she does very well.

This loan is to stock her store, to buy rice, sugar, tuna, detergents, household items and basic staples.  She’s been a member of the communal bank for three years and likes it because of the benefits she gets from the institution.  Her dream is to own a car and a larger store.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, tuna, detergent, kitchen items and basic staples.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 26 years old, single and lives with five family members, one of whom works.

Haydar has been an owner of an internet coffee shop since 2009. He offers internet services and different types of hot and cold drinks. He has sufficient experience in this field, a good reputation and a deep understanding of local consumer needs. He is well known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a loan of $1800 in order to pay the annual rent for his shop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his shop.

loans.name: Odixa Margarita

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Odixa, tiene 40 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 21 y 12 años de edad que estudian en Universidad y colegio. Su esposo tiene una granja de pollos.

Ella junto a su esposo se dedican a la cría de pollos y chanchos, tienen hasta 200 pollos por mes, los mismos que los tienen de dos a tres  meses para luego faenarlos y llevarlos a entregar a las tiendas de la localidad y de Portoviejo, de igual manera realizan lo mismo con los chanchos aunque estos la mayoría de las veces los entregan por libras a ciertos restaurantes de la zona, trabajan todos los días en la alimentación y cuidados de estos animalitos. Tiene más de 8 años con su granja y siempre les ha ido bien.

Este crédito es para comprar pollos, alimento y medicinas tanto para pollos y chanchos. Es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque con los  créditos han podido salir de muchas situaciones difíciles en su vida. 

Su sueño es tener un carro para transportar sus productos a otras ciudades.
texts.en:
In Crucita Parish in Portoviejo Canton meet the members of the “Crucita” communal bank.  This location is noted for the beautiful beaches that surround it that are visited by national and international tourists; it’s knows as “Crucita la Bella” [Crucita the Beautiful].

We met Odixa, 40, here.  She’s married and has two children who are 21 and 12 years old and who attend University and secondary school.  Her husband has a chicken farm.

She and her husband raise chickens and pigs.  They have up to 200 chickens per month which they keep from two to three months to then butcher and sell to local stores and stores in Portoviejo.  They do the same with the pigs although these they usually sell by the pound to certain restaurants in the zone.  They work every day feeding and caring for their little animals.  She’s had the farm for over 8 years and has always done well.

This loan is to buy chicks, feed and medicine both for the chicks and for the pigs.  She’s a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because with the loans they’ve been able to overcome many difficult situations in their lives.  Her dream is to own a car to transport her products to other cities.

loans.use: to buy chicks and piglets as well as feed and medicine for them.

loans.name: María Carmita

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

En este lugar vive la señora María. Tiene 52 años de edad, está soltera pero de una relación que tuvo hace muchos años tiene un hijo el cual ya está casado y vive con ella junto a su esposa y a dos hijos menores de edad que son la alegría de nuestra amiga.

Ella tiene una heladería en su casa  donde vende helados de la marca Pingüino,  trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 20h00, lleva en este negocio 20 años y  fue una de las primeras personas que puso este tipo de negocio en su localidad y gracias a Dios se ha mantenido y es así como pudo salir y sacar adelante a su hijo, ahora él tiene su trabajo y puede valerse por sí mismo.
 
Este crédito es para comprar helados ya que se avecina la temporada playera y el negocio mejora considerablemente en esta temporada. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan con los créditos y es por eso se ha mantenido por tantos años en la institución.
 
Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y que la temporada sea muy buena.
texts.en:
In Crucita Parish in Portoviejo Canton meet the members of the “Crucita” communal bank.  This location is noted for the beautiful beaches that surround it that are visited by national and international tourists; it’s knows as “Crucita la Bella” [Crucita the Beautiful].

María, 52, lives here.  She’s single but from a relationship she had many years ago she has a son who is now married.  He, his wife and two minor children who are our friend’s joy, live with her.

She has an ice-cream shop at home where she sells Pingüino brand ice-cream.  She works every day from 8am until 8pm and has been in business 20 years.  She was one of the first people to open this type of business in her locality and thanks to God has remained; this is how she was able to support her son.  Now, he has his own job and can support himself.

This loan is to buy ice-cream since the beach season is approaching and business improves considerably during this season.  She’s been in the communal bank since the beginning and likes it because of the help they always give her with the loans and this is why she’s stayed in the institution for so many years.  Her dream is to continue working and that the season is a very good one.

loans.use: to buy ice-cream.

loans.name: Amuor

texts.en: Amuor is 28 years old and married with one child who is not in school. She has had a business selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for one year. Amuor is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a concrete house in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Aileen

texts.en:
Aileen is 37 years old and married with one child.

Aileen works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her sari-sari store.

Aileen has borrowed and paid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 10 years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane and buying and selling rice.

Aileen aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: María Delia

texts.es:
La Señora María es socia del banco comunal Las Gaviotas, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia Baños en Cuenca, esta  parroquia es la atracción debido a sus aguas termales que han sido aprovechadas con la construcción de piscinas y centros hoteleros a los que acuden miles de turistas nacionales y extranjeros. De diferentes sitios de la parroquia se puede admirar bellos paisajes y lugares paradisíacos con una riqueza agrícola y ganadera, su gente es cálida y de un corazón amable y gentil.

La Señora María tiene 39 años, está  separada de su esposo pero en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 21, 19, 18, y 16 años de edad, sus tres primeros hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente y su último hijo está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Doña María es artesana y se dedica a la elaboración de canastas, esta actividad aprendió  trabajando y ahora su trabajo lo realiza bajo pedido, se dedica a las artesanías desde  que tenía 15 años de edad.
 
Se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos y cerdos para iniciar con esta actividad.
 
Su meta es  construir su casa propia.
texts.en:
María is a member of the communal bank “Las Gaviotas”. She lives in the outskirts of the parish Baños en Cuenca. This parish is an attraction due to its thermal waters that are being taken advantage of through the construction of pools and hotels that welcome thousands of domestic and foreign tourists. In different places in the parish, one can admire beautiful landscapes and paradise-like places rich in agriculture and livestock. The people are warm with friendly and gentle hearts.
María is 39 years old and separated from her husband, though in this union she had 4 children who are 21, 19, 18 and 16 years old. Her first three children work and help her financially, and her last child is studying in the city’s school. She does not have her own home, so she rents. 
María is an artisan and makes baskets. She learned this activity working and now undertakes this work on order. She has been working in craftwork since she was 15 years old.
This is her third loan with the communal bank, and she will invest the loan in the purchase of chickens and pigs to start this business.
Her goal is to construct her own home.

loans.use: to buy chickens and pigs.

loans.name: Maryuri

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Maryuri, ella tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 16 y 10 años  edad los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa.

Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo y productos de Esika (artículos de belleza, cosméticos perfumería y accesorios para damas), su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y también vende en su casa hasta donde llegan sus clientes cuando necesitan alguna prenda. Trabaja todos los días unas tres horas por dia, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería  la va a comprar a   Guayaquil cada vez que necesita.

Este crédito es para comprar la  ropa de mujer como pantalones, blusas, camisetas cremas, perfumes y  bisutería. Lleva más de 13 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque fue con uno de estos créditos que pudo iniciar su negocio.
 
Su sueño es seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
In Crucita Parish in Portoviejo Canton meet the members of the “Crucita” communal bank.  This location is noted for the beautiful beaches that surround it that are visited by national and international tourists; it’s knows as “Crucita la Bella” [Crucita the Beautiful].

We met Maryuri, 47, here.  She’s married and has two children who are 16 and 10 years old and are attending secondary and elementary school.  Her husband is employed in a firm.

She sells all sorts of clothes and Esika brand products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumery and women’s accessories).  She sells door to door and also from home where she tends to customers who come by there when they need some item.  She works every day about three hours per day.  She sells on credit and collects every two weeks.  She goes to Guayaquil to buy merchandise each time she needs to.

This loan is to buy women’s clothes like pants, blouses, t-shirts, creams, perfume and costume jewelry.  She’s been in the communal bank more than 13 years and likes it because it was with one of these loans that she was able to start her business.  Her dream is to continue moving forward with her business.

loans.use: to buy pants, blouses, t-shirts, creams, perfumes and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Celia Monserrate

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

En este lugar vive la señora Celia, tiene 52 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cinco  hijos  mayores de edad,  dos de ellos viven con ella. El marido es pescador.

Ella es un ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo realiza los créditos para que él lo emplee en su trabajo, él se dedica a la pesca y venta de los frutos que el mar les da. Ella por su parte asiste a las reuniones del banco porque su esposo la mayor parte del tiempo se la pasa ocupado en las faenas de la pesca, él trabaja todos los días, su esposo y sus hijos que lo acompañan se van a la mar desde la tarde y regresan al otro dia por la mañana para entregar sus productos a comerciantes que llegan  hasta sus lanchas para llevarlos a los mercados de otras ciudades.
 
Este crédito es para comprar combustibles, redes, piolas, víveres y otros materiales necesarios para la pesca. Lleva más de 6 años en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe con los créditos.
 
Su sueño es tener un barco más grande ya que el que tienen es pequeño.
texts.en:
In Crucita Parish in Portoviejo Canton meet the members of the “Crucita” communal bank.  This location is noted for the beautiful beaches that surround it that are visited by national and international tourists; it’s knows as “Crucita la Bella” [Crucita the Beautiful].

Celia, 52, lives in this place.  She’s in a common law relationship and has five adult children; two of them still live with her.  Her husband’s a fisherman.

She is a housewife who in order to help her husband takes out the loans so that he can use them in his work.  He’s a fisherman and sells the fruits that the sea provides.  On her part, she attends the communal bank meetings because her husband spends most of his time doing tasks associated with fishing.  He works every day.  Her husband and their children who accompany him head out to sea in the afternoon and return the next day in the morning to deliver their products to merchants who come up to their boats to take the merchandise to market in other cities.

This loan is to buy fuel, nets, twine, foodstuffs and other supplies needed for fishing.  She’s been in the communal bank more than 6 years and likes it because of the help she gets with the loans.  Her dream is to have a larger boat because the one they have is small.

loans.use: to buy fuel, nets, twine, foodstuffs and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: María Narciza

texts.es:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Banco Comunal Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.

En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 55 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene siete hijos,  seis de ellos ya son mayores de edad y la ultima de  16 años que  estudia en colegio, tres de sus hijos aun viven con ella. El marido se dedica a la pesca.

Ella es un ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo realiza los créditos para el trabajo de él, el mismo que se dedica a las faenas de pesca, su esposo junto con otras personas de la localidad se embarcan y salen a alta mar de dos a tres días seguidos para luego llegar hasta las costas trayendo  los productos del duro trabajo, es allí cuando ella realiza trabajos de limpieza del pescado para luego llevarlos a vender por toda la zona aunque la mayor parte la entregan a comerciantes que distribuyen en otras ciudades.  Ellos llevan más de 30 años en este negocio el cual le ha servido de sustento a la familia.
  
Ella está repitiendo el crédito ya que necesita el dinero para darle a su esposo para que siga adelante en su trabajo, él necesita pagar algunos arreglos de su lancha para realizar un mejor trabajo y más seguro. Los créditos le han ayudado mucho ya que por ellos sus hijos han podido terminar sus estudios, en la actualidad han tenido muchos gastos con los estudios de su hija menor que pudieron solventar gracias a las ganancias que les ha dejado el trabajo duro y ls créditos.

Su sueño es tener un carro para entregar en otras ciudades sus productos.
texts.en:
In Crucita Parish in Portoviejo Canton meet the members of the “Crucita” communal bank.  This location is noted for the beautiful beaches that surround it that are visited by national and international tourists; it’s knows as “Crucita la Bella” [Crucita the Beautiful].

María, 55, lives in this place.  She’s in a common law relationship and has seven children; six of them are adults and the youngest, a 16-year-old daughter, attends secondary school.  Three of her sons still live with her and her husband is a fisherman.

She is a housewife who in order to help her husband takes out the loans for his work.  He is a fisherman.  Her husband together with other locals head out into the high seas for two to three days at a time to then return to the coast bringing the fruits of their hard work.  This is when the work of cleaning the fish begins to then take it to be sold throughout the zone although most of it is handed over to merchants who sell it in other cities.  They’ve been in this business for more than 30 years and it has sufficed to support their family.

She is repeating the loan because she needs the money to give to her husband so he can continue doing his work.  He needs to pay for some repairs on his boat so that work can be done better and more safely.  The loans have helped much because thanks to them their children have been able to complete their schooling.  They currently have had a lot of expenses related to their youngest daughter’s schooling that they were able to cover thanks to profits generated by the hard work and the loans.  Her dream is to have a car so that she can sell her products in other cities.

loans.use: to repair the boat.

loans.name: Clara Inela

texts.es:
La Señora Clara es socia del banco comunal Las Gaviotas, vive por los alrededores de la parroquia Baños en Cuenca, esta parroquia es la atracción debido a sus aguas termales que han sido aprovechadas con la construcción de piscinas y centros hoteleros a los que acuden miles de turistas nacionales y extranjeros. De diferentes sitios de la parroquia se puede admirar bellos paisajes y lugares paradisíacos con una riqueza agrícola y ganadera, su gente es cálida y de un corazón amable y gentil.

La Señora. Clara tiene 49 años, es madre soltera de 5 hijos, sus tres primeros hijos son mayores de edad, casados y viven independientes, sus dos hijos solteros tienen 17 y 12 años y estudian en colegio y escuela. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

Ella labora como empleada privada actividad que la desempeña hace 7 años, trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 6 hasta las 3 de la tarde.
 
Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su hogar. 

Su meta es de tener un local de venta de comida.
texts.en:
Clara is a member of the “Las Gaviotas” (The Seagulls) communal bank.  She lives around Baños Parish in Cuenca.  This parish is attractive because of its thermal springs which have been used in swimming pools and hotel sites that thousands of national and foreign tourists visit.  From various parts of the parish one can admire beautiful scenery and paradisiacal places rich in farming and animal husbandry; its residents are warm, kindhearted and nice.

Clara is 49 years old and a single mother of five children.  Her oldest three children are adults now, married and living on their own.  Her two single children  are 17 and 12 and attending secondary and elementary school.  She does not have a house of her own, she’s a renter.

She has been working as a private employee for 7 years Monday through Saturday from 6am until 3pm.

She’s in her second loan with the communal bank and will use it to buy foodstuffs for her home.  Her goal is to have a food stand.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Ayor

texts.en:
Ayor is 20 years old. She is a married woman with two children; one is in school. She has had a business of selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Ayor is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for sale.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: La socia continua con su negocio de compra y venta de productos naturales, las personas usan como alernativa medica estos productos, la socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de productos de esta linea para almacenar y repartir a sus clientes habituales, ella esta prosperando y por ello requiere invertir un monto mas alto para abastecer a sus clientes.
texts.en: Veronica is continuing with her business buying and selling natural health products.  These products are used by people as an alternative to traditional medicines.  She wants to invest this loan in the purchase of products in this line to distribute and sell to her regular customers.  Veronica's business is prospering, so she needs to invest a bigger sum of money so that she can have enough supply for her customers.

loans.use: to invest in natural health products to sell

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es: La socia Georgina; continua con su negocio de venta de granos secos,  como trigo, papa, cebada y moraya,entre otros y sigue trabajando arduamente para apoyar los estudios de sus hijos y darles mejor calidad de vida, la socia desea poder ahorrar para incrementar sus ventas y poder implementar su negocio. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en la compra de granos secos al por mayor.
texts.en: Georgina is continuing with her business selling dried grains, such as wheat, varieties of dried potatoes and barley.  She is continuing to work hard, in order to provide her children with a better quality of life and pay for their education.  Georgina wants to be able to save so that she can better equip her business and increase her sales.  She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of dried grains at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy dried grains at wholesale

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase spare parts for maintenance of her motorcycle.

Cecelia has been in this business for five years. Cecelia earns more income from fishing.

Cecelia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for maintenance.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
