texts.en: Esi  operates a chop bar (where a variety of African dishes are sold), she has done this for 10 years.   The food she serves are rice and meat soup,   banku and fish soup,  and rice balls. She is married to a farmer and has 6 dependents.   Esi uses her income to support the husband to pay their children’s  school fees. She will use her loan to purchase bags of rice, meat and other ingredient to prepare food for sale. With the new profit, Esi plans to operate a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase bags of rice, meat and other ingredient to prepare food for sale

loans.name: Mardy

texts.en:
Mardy is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 
Mardy has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Mardy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Mardy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 44 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Josephine has a shop that sells beauty products & food supplements. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 to buy stocks from AVON & MOREISHI to sell.
Josephine has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Josephine hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks from AVON & MOREISHI to sell

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 40 years old and is married with three children who are all in Primary School.

Joseph is a farmer and has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD, to enable him do some farming. He is optimistic that the loan will help boost his business, by buying plowing materials.
 
He hopes to expand his business and improve his living standard through the profits made.

loans.use: to buy plowing materials.

loans.name: Santos Gilberto

texts.es:
Santos, se dedica a la venta de mariscos, vive con su familia, tiene una hija de 8 años de edad, desde hace 15 años esta en este negocio, dedicándose a la compra y venta de productos del mar.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de mariscos frescos, pescado en distintas especies, camarones, con esta compra mantendrá producto fresco y con la ayuda del préstamo tambien podrá tener mayor facilidad para realizar la compra.
El objetivo de Santos es que con la compra pueda tener mayores ventas y ganancias para solventar algunas necesidades en su familia, así como pagar las cuotas del préstamo.
texts.en:
Santos sells seafood. He lives with his family and he has a 8-year-old daughter. He has been working in this field for 15 years, buying and selling seafood products.
He is requesting a loan to buy fresh seafood such as different species of fish and shrimps. Thanks to this purchase he will keep on selling fresh products, and with the loan it will be also easier for him to purchase the products.
Santo’s goal is for his products to sell more, so that he will earn more money to pay for some necessities of his family, as well as to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy fresh seafood such as different species of fish and shrimps.

loans.name: Kathya

texts.es: Kathya tiene 30 años, es una mujer amable y buena. Convive con su pareja David de 30 años, y juntos tienen un hijo de tres años, y es por él que trabajan mucho para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Kathya consiste en la venta de bebidas, es así que a diario el camión repartidor visita su puesto para saber cuantas cajas o packs de bebidas desea para vender durante el día. Ella como todo negociante, pide lo principal con el fin de no tener su inversión estancada por mucho tiempo. De esa manera, desde que empezó hace dos años y hasta el día de hoy, realiza ésta actividad. Asimismo le gusta por que la convierte en una mujer independiete y aporta en la econmía de su hogar. Recuerdo que cuando se inició solo vendía un par de cajas, ahora se abastecw de variedad de sabores y tamaños de bebidas. Su meta ahora es seguir creciendo hasta lograr tener su mini distribuidora. Este será el crédito número 2 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas como en el crédito anterior. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará bebidas en mayor cantidad ya que por la época de calor en la zona tiene mas ventas y desea estar preparada para poder abastecerse.
texts.en: Kathya is 30 years old.  She is a kind, good woman.  She lives with her partner David, who is 30 years old, and together they have a three-year-old son who is the reason they work so much: to offer him a better quality of life.  Kathya's work consists of selling drinks.  As such, the delivery truck comes to her stand daily to find out how many cases or packs of drinks she wants to sell throughout the day.  Like all business people, she orders the essential so that her investment won't be held up for a long time.  Thus, since she started two years ago up until today, she does this for a living.  She also likes the work because it has made her an independent woman and it contributes to her home finances.  She remembers that when she started on her own she would only sell a couple of cases and now she stocks a variety of flavors and sizes of drinks.  Her goal now is to keep growing until she is able to have a mini distribution company.  This will be her second loan with MFP and she counts on their collaboration to continue with her objectives.  She also promises to make her payments on time again, as she did with her previous loan.  With the requested 1,000 nuevos soles, she will buy larger quantities of drinks because during the hot season in her area she will make more sales and she wants to be prepared to be able to stock up.

loans.use: to buy more cases of drinks

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 
Victoria has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Victoria has been a member of HSPFI since 2008.  In the future, Victoria hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 41 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Jocelyn has a shop that makes and sells rags. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for 8,000 Philippines pesos to buy cloth needed for making rags.

Jocelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy cloth needed for making rags.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en:
Gabriel is 31 years old and married to Pauline; they have four children aged from 8 months to 9 years.

Gabriel is a mechanic and has been there for the past 10 years. He is applying for his first loan to enable him to buy spare parts to enable him to give better services to his customers.

He hopes to own a car garage in the near future.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Daisy has a shop that makes & sells rugs . She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy used clothing needed for making rugs.
Daisy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011 .  In the future, Daisy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy used clothing needed for making rugs

loans.name: Ashuku

texts.en:
Ashuku is 39 years old from Nakuru and is married to Catherine. They have two sons who are in Primary School.

Ashuku has a business of selling different accessories like belts, mirrors,combs etc. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD to enable him add stock to his business. 

Ashuku hopes to be able to open a shop where he can sell his products instead of going door to door to sell them.

loans.use: To buy mirrors,combs,belts etc

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Corazon has a shop that sells clothing, food supplements like Vitamin-C, & cosmetics . She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for 14,000 to buy stocks of beauty & food supplement products.
Corazon has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Corazon hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of beauty & food supplement products

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
María, es ama de casa, vive con su esposo y tres hijos de 6, 7 y 9 años de edad, el esposo de María es agricultor y ella le ayuda en algunas ocupaciones, trabajando juntos para la siembra de maíz, tiene 10 años de estar en este oficio.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para el alquiler del terreno donde se disponen a sembrar, con este dinero podrán tener la seguridad de contar con un sitio seguro donde puedan realizar el cultivo.
El objetivo de María es trabajar bien con este préstamo, mantener un buen record, que el proceso de la siembra sea el correcto para obtener buena cosecha.
texts.en:
María is a housewife. She lives with her husband and three children 6, 7, and 9 years old. 

Her husband is a farmer and she helps him in some of the chores, working together in order to plant corn. She has been doing this work for 10 years. 

She is asking for a loan in order to rent land which is ready to plant. With this money she could have the security of having a secure place to grow the crop. 

María’s objectives are to work well with the loan, to maintain a good record, and make the growing process conducive to obtaining a good harvest.

loans.use: to rent land

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 1 child. 
Leah has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Leah has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Leah hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for sale

loans.name: Karla Vanesa

texts.es: Karla Vanesa tiene 29 años de edad, su actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de mercadería en general, esta actividad la realiza de manera ambulante, ya tiene a sus clientes a quien le ofrece su productos, ella tiene experiencia en el negocio lo cual sus clientes la visitan por la calidad que le ofrece y el servicio. Karla Vanesa está solicitando financiamiento para comprar pantalones, camisa, faldas, sandalias y cosméticos entre otros que es lo que piden sus clientes.
texts.en: Karla Vanesa is 29 years old.  The work she does for a living is selling general merchandise.  She does this work on foot and she now has customers to whom she offers her products.  She has experience in this business, which is why her customers go to her:  for the quality she offers and the service.  Karla Vanesa is asking for financing to buy pants, tops, skirts, sandals, and cosmetics, among other things, which are what her customers ask for.

loans.use: to buy pants, tops, skirts, sandals, and cosmetics, among other things

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a polisher

loans.name: Brenda Rocio

texts.es:
Brenda, es comerciante de ropa americana, tiene 20 años de edad, vive con su madre y su abuela, este negocio lo aprendió  de su tía, lo realiza de forma ambulante, recorriendo varias calles.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra ropa americana, más que todo en blusas, faldas, pantalones, con este préstamo lograra surtir el negocio, mejorando la disponibilidad y variedad para ofrecer a los clientes.
El objetivo de Brenda es por medio del préstamo fortalecer el negocio y mejorar la atención  a los clientes con el fin de generar más ingresos.
texts.en:
Brenda is a retailer selling American clothing. She is 20 years old and she lives with her mother and her grandmother. Her aunt taught her how to do this job, and she sells door to door, walking along different streets.
She is requesting a long to buy American clothing, especially blouses, skirts and trousers. Thanks to this loan she will be able to supply her stock, improving the availability and the variety of products to sell to her customers.
Brenda’s goal is to strengthen her activity thanks to the loan, and to improve the service to her customers in order to increase her earnings.

loans.use: To buy blouses, skirts and trousers.

loans.name: Merlibeth

texts.en:
Merlibeth is 24 years old, married and lives in the Philippines.  
Merlibeth has a retail shop that buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Merlibeth has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Merlibeth hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for sale

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is 35 years old from Ndunyu Njeru and is married with five children who are all in primary school.

Jacob has had a grocery business for the past three years. He has applied for a loan from KADET LTD to enable to him to buy assorted vegetables from farmers for sale to boost his grocery business. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend.

Jacob hopes to expand his business and make enough profit to enable him take care of his family.

loans.use: To buy assorted vegetables from farmers for sale

loans.name: Emelinda

texts.en:
Emelinda is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Emelinda has a retail shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.
Emelinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Emelinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for sale

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 30 years old from Ndunyu Njeru and is a single man.

John has a motorcycle transport business that he runs and has applied for a loan from KADET LTD, to enable him be able to cater for the service charges of his bike. 

He is optimistic that the motorbike will function well and enable him to carry his customers with ease. He hopes to expand his business and buy mini- buses.

loans.use: To service his motorbike.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Aheistra

texts.en:
Aheistra is 23 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 
Aheistra has a shop that sells electronic loads of different networks. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 8,000 to buy electronic loads for sell.
Aheistra has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Aheistra hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy electronic loads for sell

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina  lives in Kampala, Uganda .She is widowed with four children and all her children go to school. She has two additional family members (sister). She is a tailor at the market. She has been in business for over 10 years. She works six days a week. She has requested for loan of 1000,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy new clothes and materials. Her major business challenge are defaulters, transportation and seasonality. Her aspirations and goals are to buy a plot of land and build a house and also to build tailoring school. She lives in a rented house and the family does not have access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy new clothes and clothing materials

loans.name: Juamonie

texts.en:
Juamonie is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 
Juamonie has a shop that sells clothing & beauty products from AVON & NATASHA. She has had this business for 4 years. She requested a loan for 11,000 to buy stocks from AVON & NATASHA to sell.
Juamonie has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Juamonie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks from AVON & NATASHA to sell

loans.name: G.s Don Tino Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Don tino, está conformado por emprendedores que se unieron para salir adelante con sus negocios y además se motivan uno a otro. Este grupo ya ha tenido financiamiento con Fundación León 2000, han demostrado ser unas personas responsables y con ganas de seguir adelante. Constantino que es miembro de este grupo están solicitando financiamiento para invertir en su negocio de sastrería en la compra de capital trabajo como hilos, tijeras, telas entre otros.
texts.en: The Don Tino Solidarity Group is made up of enterprising people who joined together to get ahead with their business and who also motivate each other.  This group has already had financing with Fundación León 2000 and they have proven to be responsible people who want to get ahead.  Constantino, who is a member of this group, is asking for financing to invest in his tailoring business by buying working capital, such as thread, scissors, and fabrics, among other things.

loans.use: to buy working capital such as thread, scissors, and fabric, among other things

loans.name: Sylvia

texts.en:
Sylvia is 25 years old and single.She sells second hand clothes and has been in the business for the past four years. She gets a monthly income of KES 15,000 from the business.

This is Sylvia's first term loan in KADET LTD. She will use the loan amount to purchase more stock of clothes for resale. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a client who is already registered.

Sylvia's hope is to increase her income by selling  clothes in a wholesale business.

loans.use: Purchase stock of used clothes for sale .

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 
Jennifer has a shop that makes & sells snacks like rice cakes & bibingka, a specialty rice cake. She has had this business for 6 years. She has requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making snacks.
Jennifer has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Jennifer hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks

loans.name: Carmela

texts.en:
Carmela is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 
Carmela has a shop that makes & sells chicken & pork barbecue during the afternoon. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for 10,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for making barbecue.
Carmela has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future,Carmela hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients needed for making barbecue

loans.name: Nena

texts.es: Nena tiene 56 años, es una valiente y emprendedora mujer, tiene seis hijos a quienes le dio educación y ahora son independientes. Actualmente habita en su propia casa en compañía de su esposo Emilio de 56 años,  y con quien tiene la fuerza para poder trabajar mucho y así tener una mejor calidad de vida. El trabajo de Nena consiste en dos actividades, la primera es de la venta de comida que lo realiza en la vereda de sus casa, y el otro es la venta de productos por catálogos, así como cosmético, perfume o cremas que ofrece a sus clientes. Ella trabaja sola y lo lleva haciendo por más dos años, aunque en ocasiones le resulta pesado, pero sabe que debe continuar para tener mejores ganancias. Ahora su plan es trabajar y progresar. Éste será el crédito número 11 con MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración para continuar con sus objetivos, ella por su parte se compromete una vez mas a cumplir con sus cuotas como en créditos anteriores. Con el monto solicitado de 1,200 soles, comprará ingredientes e insumos, además de productos para tener en stock.
texts.en:
Nena is 56 years old. She is a brave and enterprising woman. She has six children to whom she gave an education and now they are independent.

Currently she lives in her own house with her husband of 56 years of age Emilio, and with whom she has the strength to be able to work hard and thus to have a better quality of life.

Nena’s work consists of two activities. The first is selling food that she sells on the footpath of her house, and the other is selling products through catalogs, such as cosmetics, perfumes or creams that she offers to her clients.

She works alone and she has been doing this work for more than 2 years, although sometimes it is heavy work, but she knows that she should continue in order to earn more income. Now her plan is to work and progress.

This will be her 11th loan through MFP, and so she is waiting for its assistance in order to continue with her objectives. She agrees, on her part, once again to complete her payments as in previous loans. With the 1200 soles from the loan she will buy ingredients and supplies, as well as products to have in inventory.

loans.use: to buy raw materials in order to prepare more food, and to buy more cosmetics

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es: Nilda, de 39 años, es una buena mujer, madre de dos hijos, Yemilet de 12 y el menor Frank de 6 años, son su razón para seguir trabajando. Está casada con Edson de 47 años con quien vive a lado de sus dos hijos en su casa propia. El trabajo de Nilda es muy divertido, ella se encarga de realizar múltiples cosas en su tienda ubicada en su casa, ahí espera a sus clientes con quienes conversa y brinda algunas alternativas para las piñatas, gorros, tarjetas y más accesorios que se usan en la fiesta de cumpleaños. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 3 años, antes de esto trabajaba para otras personas lo cual no le permitía tener buenos ingresos como ella deseaba, ahora le va mucho mejor ya que percibe sus ingresos netos para ella y no tiene que compartir con nadie ya que realiza su trabajo sola. Le esta yendo muy bien y como toda mujer emprendedora tiene metas y sueños que en algún momento le gustaría realizar, pero por ahora solo desea mantener su negocio para seguir juntando el capital suficiente para poder empezar a expandirlo. Este será el crédito número 3 con MFP, por ello espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con el pago de cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Con el monto solicitado 1500 soles, comprará mercadería y materiales para poder continuar con su negocio ya que desea aumentar su producción y así tener listo para cumplir la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en: Thirty-nine-year-old Nilda is a good woman and the mother of two children, 12-year-old Yemilet and they youngest, 6-year-old Frank.  They are her reason for getting ahead.  She is married to 47-year-old Edson, whom she lives with along with her two children in their own home.  Nilda's work is very fun; she is in charge of doing many things in the store located in her home.  That is where she sees her customers, whom she talks to and offers some options for piñatas, hats, cards, and other accessories for birthday parties.  She has been doing this work for three years.  Before this she worked for other people, which didn't allow her to make as much as she wanted to.  Now things are much better as she receives her net earnings and she doesn't have to share them with anyone because she works on her own.  It's going very well for her and, like all enterprising women, she has goals and dreams that she would eventually like to achieve, but for the moment she only wants to maintain her business to keep saving up enough money to be able to expand it.  This will be her third loan with MFP and she counts on their collaboration to be able to carry out her plans.  She also promises to make her payments on time again, as she did with her previous loans.  With the requested 1,500 nuevos soles, she will buy merchandise and materials to be able to continue with her business, as she wants to increase her production to have everything ready to meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: to buy more party items, such as piñatas

loans.name: Seke Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “SEKE” iniciará su decimo séptimo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del centro focal Collpani, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva encabezada por la señora Silveria. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: trenzado de mantas, comidera, comerciante de api, elaboración de zapatos, venta de camas, venta de fresco, artesanías.

La señora Silveria,  indica que hace ocho años que trabaja en Pro Mujer y que integro la institución por invitación de la asesora. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida que viene trabajando hace años.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para aumentar su capital (compra de conservas) que comprará la Ceja  y posteriormente lo venderá en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, pues ella tiene tres hijos y esta casada.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones y el área de salud.
texts.en:
The SEKE Communal Bank will start their 17th loan cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Regional Hub.  It is made up of nine members and it is managed by a board of directors headed by Silveria.  The communal bank's members do various kinds of work, such as weaving blankets, selling food, selling the traditional drink, api, shoemaking, selling beds, selling soft drinks, and craftwork.

Silveria tells us that she's been working with Pro Mujer for eight years and that she joined the institution after being invited by their adviser.  She currently has a business selling food that she's had for years.

The loan she is taking out now is to increase her capital to buy canned food in la Ceja that she will later sell at her stand.  This way of working allows her to generate income to support her family, as she is married with three children.

When asked what it is she likes about Pro Mujer, she told us that she likes the training sessions and the health area.

loans.use: to buy provisions

loans.name: Erika Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Erika esta solicitando un crédito para comprar mas ropa, ya que se le termino casi toda y le están solicitando ya ropa de verano, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión es por eso que solicita su cooperación para este crédito. 
Doña Erika tiene dos años con este pequeño negocio, que le permite solventar algunos gastos y así poder ayudar a su esposo con los gastos, ya que el se dedica a la construcción y entre los dos ingresos le están dando una mejor vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Erika is applying for a loan to buy more clothing, as she has run out of almost everything. They are already asking her for summer clothing, but she doesn't have the money necessary for the investment. That's why she is asking for your contribution towards this loan.

Erika has had her small business for two years, which has allowed her to pay some bills, and so be able to help her husband with expenses. He works in construction, and between the two incomes, they are giving their children a better life.

loans.use: To buy clothing merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
El señor Reynaldo desea terminar los acabados del exterior de su vivienda pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el material que es cemento, arena y pintura. Solicita el préstamo para poder realizar la mejora ya que con los acabados le dará mas protección  as su bienvenida y ya que el cambio de clima le puede afectar en la salud de su pequeño hijo.
Don Reynaldo trabaja como guardia de seguridad en una compañía de transportes y su esposa es empleada de una compañía como auxiliar de contable. Entre los dos han logrado formar un patrimonio, y tenerlos en muy buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
Reynaldo wants to complete the final touches of the exterior of his house but does not have the necessary money in order to buy the materials such as cement, sand and paint. 

He is asking for a loan in order to be able to make the improvements and do the final work in order to give more protection and be welcoming, and because the change of weather can affect the health of his little child. 

Reynaldo works as a security guard in a transport company and his wife is employed in a company as an assistant accountant. Between them they have managed to create assets, and have them in very good condition.

loans.use: to finish the exterior plastering of the walls of the house

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, es comerciante de zapatos, vive con sus tres hijos, es madre soltera, vive en casa alquilada, el negocio lo comenzó por iniciativa propia, lo tiene en la casa donde vive y sale a vender ambulantemente, tiene ya experiencia en  el manejo de las ventas.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de calzado en variedad de estilos y colores, la compra le permitirá mejorar el negocio, ya que ofrecerá más variedad a la clientela, para que sus ventas tambien sean mayores.
Su objetivo es crecer en clientes, ya que asi la demanda será mayor y sus ingresos, esto le permitirá prosperar junto a sus hijos, ya que tiene el propósito de apoyarles en los estudios.
texts.en:
María is a shoe dealer. She lives with her three children, is a single mother, and lives in a rented house. She began the business through her own initiative. She has it in the house where she lives and she sells on the street, having experience in working in sales.

She is asking for a loan in order to buy shoes in a variety of styles and colors. The purchase will allow her to improve the business, and offer more variety to her customers, in order that her sales also will be better.

Her object is to grow her client base, as the demand and her income would be higher, and this would permit her to prosper together with her children, as she has as her purpose to support them in their studies.

loans.use: to buy shoes in a variety of styles and colors

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en:
Bernard is 37 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married . 
Bernard has a shop that buys & sells tungsten & gold dust. He has had this business for 6 years. He requested a loan of 8,000 to buy tungsten & other metallic dust with high value .
Bernard has been a member of HSPFI for since 2011.  In the future, Bernard hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy tungsten & other metallic dust with high value

loans.name: Mary Wanjiru

texts.en:
Mary is still married and a mother of four school-age children. Her farming business greatly improved and she is applying for her third loan to enable her to buy farm inputs; fertilizer and seedlings, and to pay for labor.

She hopes to expand her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To rent a piece of land and plant potatoes

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. Rosie has a shop that sells bananas, coconuts & firewood. She has had this business for 3 years.
She requested a loan for 13,000 to buy bananas, coconuts & firewood to sell.
Rosie has been a member of HSPFI since 2008.  In the future, Rosie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas, coconuts & firewood to sell

loans.name: Julie

texts.en: Julie is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married. Julie has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks, and beverages. Julie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Julie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en: Oliver lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with eight children, and all her children go to school. She has two additional family members (a brother and sister). She sells fresh fruits and vegetables at the market. She has been in this business for the last 10 years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of UGX 1,300,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy fruits and vegetables like mangoes, paw-paws, cabbages, and pineapples. Her major business challenges are perishability, transportation, and seasonality. Her aspirations and goals are to buy a plot of land and build a house and also to start selling wholesale only. She lives in a rented house, and the family does not have access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more boxes of fruits and vegetables like mangoes, pawpaws , cabbages, and pineapples

loans.name: Norma

texts.es: Norma, de 55 años, es una mujer buena y trabajadora, es madre soltera de una hija de 24 años llamada Paola, viven juntas en su casa propia junto a sus padres. Ella trabaja mucho para así ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida. Norma, tiene un trabajo muy bueno, ella tiene la tarea de diseñar, coser y remendar prendas de vestir. En su casa tiene un pequeño taller en donde realiza todo este trabajo, al mismo tiempo tiene un negocio de venta de golosinas al cual se dedica de manera paralela. Lleva 20 años realizando éste negocio y trabaja sola ya que durante todo este tiempo se acostumbró a realizarlo así. Le gusta mucho lo que hace, ya que le permite disponer de tiempo para poder dedicar a su hogar y hacer algunas tareas que necesita. Al principio tenía muchas dificultades pues conocer todo relacionado al negocio, además que le faltaba capital para invertir. Con el tiempo fue formándose y poco a poco fue aprendiendo, es así que ahora le va mucho mejor y puede seguir con sus sueños de crecer y ampliar su taller. Este será el crédito número 12 con MFP, está muy contenta de saber que todos estos años pudo trabajar a lado de personas muy responsables y que no permitieron que se desintegre. Con el monto solicitado de 2000 soles, comprará materiales y accesorios de costura para seguir con su trabajo, además implementará su puesto comprando más golosinas, pues sus clientes le piden variedad.
texts.en: Norma, who is 55 years old, is a good woman and very hard working. She is a single mother of one 24 year old daughter named Paola. They live together in their own house next to her parents. She works a lot to provide a better quality of life for her family. Norma has a very good job, doing the designing, sewing and mending of clothes. She works out of a small workshop in her house. At the same time, she also maintains a candy store. She has been running these businesses for twenty years. She has been working by herself this whole time and is now accustomed to working that way. She really likes what she does, as it provides her time to to care for her household and take care of some tasks that she needs to attend to while running her businesses. At the beginning, she had many difficulties learning everything related to the business. Moreover, she was lacking capital to invest in her business. With time, she was able to teach herself and kept learning. Because of this, now it is going much better and she can follow her dreams of growing and expanding her workshop. This will be her twelfth loan with MFP. Norma is very happy to know that all these years she could work with very responsible people and they didn't allow her to fall by the wayside. With a loan of 2000 soles, she will buy sewing materials and accessories to continue with her work. She will also buy more sweets for her candy business because her clients ask for variety.

loans.use: buy sewing materials, as well as sweets.

loans.name: Expedita

texts.en:
Expedita is 59 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with two children. 

Expedita has a shop that sells snacks and homemade sausage. She has been in business for six years. 

She is requesting a loan for 11,000 to buy raw ingredients for making snacks and sausage.

Expedita has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Expedita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making snacks & home made sausage.

Gina has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Gina hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Merrylou

texts.en:
Merrylou is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. 

Merrylou has a shop that sells fish, like sardines, trout and milk fish.  She has had this business for 2 years.  She requests a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy fish for sell.

Merrylou has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Merrylou hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish for sell.

loans.name: Jingy

texts.en:
Jingy is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Jingy provides manicure and pedicure services. She has had this business for 5 years.  She requests a loan of 7,000 PHP to buy materials needed to perform manicures and pedicures.

Jingy has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Jingy hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for manicure & pedicure.

loans.name: Fausta

texts.en:
Fausta lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is widowed with five children, and all go to school. 

She sells second hand clothes at the market and has been in this business for the last 10 years.  She works six days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of second hand clothes.  Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality.  Her aspirations and goals are to start importing second hand clothes, buy a plot of land and build a house.  She lives in her own house and her family does not have access to electricity nor piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with 5 children. 

Eva has a shop that sells used clothing, like shirts & blouses. She has had this business for 1 year.  She requests a loan for 4,000 PHP to buy stocks of used clothing for sell.

Eva has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Eva hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of used clothing for sell.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza is 50 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is separated with 3 children. 

Esperanza has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.  She has had this business for 5 years. She requests a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Esperanza has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Esperanza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

loans.name: Noche

texts.en:
Noche is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Noche provides motorcycle transport services.  He has had this business for 5 years.  He requests a loan for 9,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for the gasoline for the services.

Noche has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Noche hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline for the service.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Fe has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.  She has had this business for 4 years. She requests a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Fe has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Fe hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is single with no children.  

She operates a bakery in a shop that she rents. She also gets some extra income from teaching.  She has been in this business for the last 2 years. She works seven days a week. 

Mary has requested a loan of 800,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy sugar, flour and cooking oil.  Her major business challenges are transportation and on and off electricity.  

Her aspirations and goals are to build a house and own a big bakery.  She lives in a rented house and her family has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, baking flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

Angeles has a shop that sells green and yellow bananas. She has had this business for 6 years.  Angeles requests a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy bananas to sell.

Angeles has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Angeles hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy bananas to sell.

Elvira is 56 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children.

Elvira has been a member of HSPFI since 2009.  In the future, Elvira hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for sell.

texts.en:
Ines is 61 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

Ines has a shop that sells home appliances and furniture.  She has had this business for 10 years.  She requests a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy home appliances and furniture for sell.

Ines has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Ines hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of home appliances & furniture for sell.

loans.name: Annielou

texts.en:
Annielou is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Annielou has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.  She has had this business for 14 years.  She requesta a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Annielou has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Annielou hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for sell.

loans.name: Majorie

texts.en:
Majorie is 21 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Majorie has a shop that sells fish, like sardines and trout.  She has had this business for 2 years.  She requests a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy fish to sell.

Majorie has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Majorie hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 42 ears old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. 

Jocelyn has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.  She has had this business for 2 years.  She requests a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Jocelyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Jocelyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for sell.

loans.name: Abu Bakarr S.

texts.en:
Abu Bakarr, 57, is a primary school teacher in Makeni.  Abu was born in Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone.  He is married and has five children who attend primary, secondary and tertiary institutions. 

Abu Bakarr has served in the teaching profession for forty years.  He requests this loan in order to pay school fees for his children. 

Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org base in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleases to present Abu Bakarr to you.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 34 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 5 children. 

Helen has a shop that sells vegetables like Chinese cabbage.  She has had this business for 2 years.  She requests a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy vegetables to sell.

Helen has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future,Helen hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables for sell.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
Ruben is 18 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is single. 

Ruben is provides motorcycle transport services. He has had this business for 2 years. He requests a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy tools and pay for gasoline.

Ruben has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Ruben hopes to improve his services.

loans.use: to buy tools & pay for the gasoline.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 6 children. 

Erlinda has a retail shop that buys and sells canned goods, snacks and beverages.  She has had this business for 12 years.  She requests a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Erlinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Erlinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages for sell.

loans.name: Jose Reynaldo

texts.es:
José, es agricultor, vive con su familia, tiene casa propia, lleva 10 años de estar dedicado a la agricultura, lo aprendió de su familia, y hoy en día se defiende con esta ocupación, para mantenerse ocupado y de la cosecha poder comercializarla y generar ingresos económicos.
Él solicita un préstamo para utilizarlo para el pago de alquiler del terreno, compra de abono, para iniciar la siembra, este préstamo le ayudara para tener seguridad del terreno y además comprarse los insumos necesarios para aplicarlos al cultivo.
Él tiene su objetivo y es que quiere tener una cosecha abundante, mejorando la producción, para poder tener la oportunidad de vender, ya que así es como obtiene las ganancias, de lo poco que le queda.
texts.en:
José is a farmer.  He lives with his family and has his own house.  He has worked in agriculture for ten years.  He learned it from his family, and today he takes care of himself with this job, to keep himself busy and to sell the harvest and generate income.

He is requesting a loan to pay the rent on his land and to buy fertilizer to start the planting.  This loan will help him to have confidence about the land and also to buy himself the necessary supplies to apply to the crop.

His goal is to have an abundant harvest, improving the production, to be able to have the opportunity to sell it.  That is how he gets his profit from the little that remains for him.

loans.use: to pay the rent on his land.

loans.name: Hawa U.

texts.en:
Presented to you in the photo above is Hawa, a primary school teacher in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone.  Hawa has been a professional teacher for twenty-seven years.  

A native of Rokulan village near Makeni, Hawa  is 51 years old.  She is married to a civil servant and the couple has two children.  

Hawa has requested a loan to buy house building materials, like iron corrugated zinc, sand, nails, cements, etc. for the construction of a house.  At the end of each month, Hawa will repay the loan, using her monthly salary.

loans.use: to buy house building materials for the construction of a house.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married with three children, and all go to school.  She takes care of additional family members (sister).  

She sells charcoal from home on a retail basis.  Rose has been in this business for the last 1.5 years.  She works seven days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 500,000 from MCDT SACCO to more bags of charcoal.  Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. 

Her aspirations and goals are to become a wholesaler and to build rental houses.  She lives in her own house and the family does not have access to piped water nor electricity.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Rosaline T.

texts.en:
Presented to you in the photo above is Rosaline, a primary school teacher in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone.  Rosaline has been a professional teacher for thirty-two years.  A native of Bombali district, in northern Sierra Leone, Rosaline is a widow with three children; two are in college.  

Rosaline has requested this loan to pay her children’s college fees and to buy house building materials for the completion of a house she is building.  At the end of each month, Rosaline will repay the loan, using her monthly salary.

loans.use: to pay her children’s college fees and to buy house building materials for the completion of a house she is building.

loans.name: Abass I.

texts.en:
In the photo above is Abass. Abass is a primary school teacher in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone.  The fifty-seven year old has served in the teaching profession for twenty-seven years.

A native of Pet-Banna village, in northern Sierra Leone, Abass is married, and the couple has four children: three attend primary school and one is in college.  

Abass has requested this loan from SMT/Kiva lenders to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married with three children who attend school. 

She sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis.  She has been in this business for the last 8 years. She works seven days a week. 

Maureen has requested a loan of 500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas.  Her major business challenges are transportation of bananas from the Ntinda market to her stall, in Kigowa,  and thieves. 

Her aspirations and goals are to become a wholesaler and to buy a plot of land.  She lives in rented house and family has access to piped water but no electricity.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Albert D.

texts.en:
Albert is a primary school teacher in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone.  Albert is thirty-two years old, single with two primary school going children. 

Albert has been a teacher for eight years.  He has requested this loan to pay his college fees.  Albert will repay his Kiva loan, using his monthly salary.

loans.use: to pay his college fees.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un señor de 61 años de edad, el cual vive con su familia, en la comunidad de Canalette, en la región de Upala, San Carlos en la provincia de Alajuela. Esta provincia ocupa el primer lugar nacional en la producción de café y azúcar de caña. Produce además granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, maíz), frutas, legumbres, tubérculos y hortalizas, una de las principales zonas ganaderas del país especialmente a través de la producción del cantón de San Carlos. Además en la provincia se asientan las plantas procesadoras de leche de la Cooperativa de Productores de Leche Dos Pinos, propiedad de miles de productores de leche. 
Además en la zona alrededor de la ciudad de Alajuela se ha asentado gran cantidad de empresas manufactureras de exportación. En Alajuela operan las zonas francas de El Coyol, Saret, Montecillos y Bet. 

Desde hace ocho años que Juan se dedica a la agricultura, para continuar su negocio, le hace falta lo principal para que su negocio surja y para que los vecinos de su comunidad se vean beneficiados.  

Actualmente Juan está solicitando un micro crédito de ¢600.000 (seiscientos mil colones) para la compra de insumos varios para darle mantenimiento a su finca y pagar unos gramos de semilla de maíz que había solicitado. Con esto el espera hacer crecer su negocio, ya que su meta es poder continuar con su trabajo donde pueda mejorar tanto su calidad de vida como la de su familia. 

Juan es socio de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Canalette, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su primer préstamo y con él espera continuar creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
Juan is 61, and lives with his family in the community of Canalette, in the Upala region, in San Carlos canton, Alajuela province. This province is first in the nation in the production of coffee and sugar cane. In addition, it produces staple grains (rice, beans, corn), fruit, legumes, tubers, and vegetables. It is one of the main cattle-producing areas of the country, especially with the production of San Carlos canton. 

As well, the milk-processing plants of the Dos Pinos Milk Producers Cooperative, which belongs to thousands of milk producers, are located here. Also, a large number of export manufacturing companies have been established in the area around the city of Alajuela. The duty-free zones of El Coyol, Saret, Montecillos, and Bet, operate in Alajuela. 

Juan has been farming for eight years. To continue his business, he needs working capital so that his business can grow, and members of his community benefit.

Now Juan is applying for a loan of 600,000 colones to buy various agricultural supplies, in order to maintain his small farm, and pay for a few kilos of seed corn that he had ordered.  With this, he hopes to make his business grow, as his goal is to be able to continue his work, through which he can greatly improve his quality of life and that of his family.

Juan is a member of the Canalette communal bank, one of the 150 member organizations of EDESA in Costa Rica. This will be his first loan, and with it he hopes to continue growing in financial terms, and as a person, and also participate actively in his community's communal bank.

loans.use: To grow corn.

loans.name: Fatmata J.

texts.en:
Pictured above is Fatmata, a primary school teacher in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. She has served in the teaching profession for nine years now. Fatmata is single with four children: one in primary school, two in secondary and one in college.  

She has requested this loan in order to pay school fees and other school-related charges for her children. And at the end of each month, she will repay the loan, using her monthly salary.

loans.use: to pay school fees and other school-related charges for her children.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con su hijo, es madre soltera, es comerciante de ropa, este negocio surgió por iniciativa propia, con el apoyo de su hijo, ya que siempre está a su lado, no tiene un horario establecido ya que vende en distintas zonas.
Actualmente solicita un préstamo para la compra de ropa, blusas, faldas, ropa interior, entre otras que son demandadas, esta inversión le ayudara para mejorar el negocio, ampliando y atrayendo a más clientes.
La aspiración de Rosa es montar el negocio en un lugar accesible, fijo, con un local que le sirva de atracción para mejorar sus ventas, además quiere que su hijo sea su apoyo y tambien se vea beneficiado con el crecimiento del negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with her son and is a single mother. She is a shopkeeper and established this business of her own initiative, with the support of her son who is always by her side. She does not have a fixed schedule as she sells clothing in different areas.

At present, she requests a loan to purchase clothing: blouses, skirts and undergarments, among other things that have been requested by her customers. This investment will help her improve her business, expanding and attracting more customers. 

Rosa's aspiration is to set up the business in an accessible and permanent location that will attract more customers and improve her sales. Moreover, she wants her son to assist her and benefit from the growth of the business.

loans.use: purchase clothing: blouses, skirts and undergarments.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Presented to you in the photo above is Mariatu, a primary school teacher in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone.  Mariatu has been a professional teacher for nine years.  A native of Makeni city, Mariatu is 35 years old.  She is married to a teacher and the couple has two children.  Her children attend primary and secondary schools. 

Mariatu has requested this loan to pay her college fees. At the end of each month, she will repay the loan, using her monthly salary.

loans.use: to pay her college fees.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet  lives in Kampala, Uganda.  She is married with four children and none of her children goes to school.  

She sells second hand clothes at the market.  She has been in this business for the last 10 years.  She works six days a week. 

She has requested a loan of 500,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of second hand clothes.  Her major challenge are increasing prices of used clothes and seasonality. 

Her aspirations and goals are to become a wholesaler and to buy a plot of land.  She lives in a rented house and her family has access electricity but no piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Gibrilla

texts.en:
Gibrilla is a primary school teacher in Makeni.  Thirty-three year old, Gibrilla was born in Makeni.  He is single and has two children who attend secondary school.  

Gibrilla has served in the teaching profession for eight years.  He has requested this loan to pay his college fees.

Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org base in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleases to present Gibrilla to you.

loans.use: to pay his college fees.

loans.name: Rosa Hilda

texts.es:
Rosa, vive con sus hijos, todos están adultos, su ocupación es una granja de pollos, que la administra desde hace 15 años, este oficio es de su agrado y no tiene un horario fijo para atenderlo, pues como esta en la casa, atiende las ocupación del hogar al mismo tiempo que la granja.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de concentrado y compra de materiales para reparación de la granja, como maya, madera, clavos, para darle mas fuerza, que este más segura para los pollo, este préstamo le ayudara a cubrir el gasto, mejorando el negocio.
Su objetivo es tener más ganancias y por eso recurre al préstamo, para encontrar la manera de ser más productivos.
texts.en:
Rosa lives with her children, all of whom are adults.  Her job is a chicken farm she has run for 15 years.  This job is to her liking, and she does not have a fixed schedule to take care of it.  Since she is at home, she takes care of the household at the same time as the farm.

She is requesting a loan to buy concentrated feed and materials to repair the farm, such as mesh, wood, and nails, to make it stronger and more secure for the chickens.  This loan will help her cover the expense, improving the business.

Her goal is to have more profit, so she is turning to the loan, to find the way to be more productive.

loans.use: to buy concentrated feed and materials: mesh, wood, and nails.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
Pictured above is Isatu, a primary school teacher in Makeni city, in northern Sierra Leone. 

The twenty-eight year old has served in the teaching profession for seven years.  Isatu is married to a teacher and the couple has three children: one attends secondary school and the others are not of school going age. 

Isatu has requested this loan to pay school fees for her child and to buy house building materials like zinc, sand, nails, cements, etc. for the construction of a house.  At the end of each month, Isatu will repay the loan, using her monthly salary.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her child and to buy house building materials for the construction of a house.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

Florence sells green bananas at the market on a retail basis. She has been in this business for the last four years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 500,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bunches of bananas. Her major business challenges are defaulters and thieves. 

Florence’s aspirations and goals are to sell wholesale only, to start going to the villages of Masaka for green bananas, and also to buy a plot of land. She lives in a rented house and the family has access to piped water but does not have access to electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas.

loans.name: Clara Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Clara Isabel tiene un negocio de ventas y reparaciones de  tóner e impresoras, desea un préstamo para surtir su negocio de material para el rellenar los tóner  y comprar piezas para la reparación de la impresoras, ya que cuando le solicitan una de estos servíos tener todo en existencia en su negocio y poder atender a los clientes inmediato.
El propósito de la señora Clara Isabel es brindar un mejor servicio, y así su negocio podrá tener un mejor ingreso para sus hijos quienes el apoyan y ayudan en el negocio que es familiar.
texts.en:
Clara Isabel has a business selling toner, and repairing printers. She wishes a loan to supply her business with material for refilling toner cartridges, and to buy parts for repairing printers. This is so that when they ask her for one of these services, she has everything in stock in her business, and can serve customers right away.

Clara Isabel's aim is to offer better service. This way, her business will be able to provide better income for her children. They support her, and help in the business, which is a family business.

loans.use: To buy raw material for her business selling printer inks and repairing printers.

loans.name: José Fernando

texts.es:
El señor José Fernando esta adquiriendo este préstamo ya que su hijo esta por entrar a la universidad y tiene que pagar la inscripción y la compra de libros y material y desea apoyar a su hijo con el pago para que empieza su carrera profesional. 
Don José Fernando es mecánico y su esposa realiza trabajos de belleza en su domicilio, entre los dos ingresos desean darle los mejor a sus hijos y que tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
José Fernando is taking out this loan, as his son is about to enter university, and has to pay enrollment fees and also buy books and supplies. He wants to support his son in paying for this, so that he can start his degree program.

José Fernando  is a mechanic, and his wife has a beauty salon in their home. Between the two incomes, they wish to provide the best for their children, so that they have a better future.

loans.use: To pay education expenses for his son's university enrollment.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, and all of her children go to school. She has two additional family members (mother and father). 

She sells Cavendish bananas at the market. She has been in the business for the last 10 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more clusters and bunches of Cavendish bananas. 

Her major business challenges are defaulters, transportation and seasonality. Her aspirations and goals are to buy a plot of land and build a house. She lives in a rented house, and the family has access to electricity but doesn’t have piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of Cavendish bananas.

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed with three children, and all of her children go to school. She has two additional family members (her old parents). 

She sells charcoal at the market. She has been in this business for the last five years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. 

Her major business challenges are thieves and seasonality. Her aspirations and goals are to become a wholesaler and to build a house. She lives in a  rented house, and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Edwin Eleaquin

texts.es:
Edwin, es empleado de una panadería, vive con su familia, está soltero, su familia le apoya, lleva 7 años en la panadería, como panificador, tiene ya mucha experiencia, fabricando el pan de calidad.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de repuestos para una motocicleta, ya que en ella se trasporta desde su casa hacia el trabajo y viceversa, con esto pagara el mecánico que le revise la moto, además comprara arena, cemento y piedras, para hacer unas reparaciones en el corredor de la casa de sus padres.
El objetivo de Edwin es seguir trabajando en la panadería, y en un futuro con su experiencia poder instalar su propia panadería.
texts.en:
Edwin is an employee in a bakery.  He lives with his family and is single.  His family supports him.  He has been working in the bakery as a baker for seven years.  He already has a lot of experience making quality bread.

He is requesting a loan to buy spare parts for a motorcycle that he uses for transportation to and from his job.  With the loan he will pay the mechanic to check the motorcycle for him.  He also will buy sand, cement, and stones to make some repairs in the corridor of his parents' house.

Edwin's objective is to continue working in the bakery, and in the future, with his experience be able to set up his own bakery.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and pay for labor.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with two children, and both of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members. 

She operates a retail business in a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for the last seven years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy sugar, rice, flour and cooking oil. Her major business challenges are the increasing prices of commodities, transportation and on-and-off electricity. 

Her aspirations and goals are to own a wholesale shop and to build a house. She lives in a rented house, and the family does not have access to piped water or electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more sugar, cooking oil, rice and flour.

loans.name: Jalia

texts.en:
Jalia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children, and all of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.

She sells second-hand clothes at the market. She has been in this business for the last eight years. She works six days a week. She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy bales of second-hand clothes. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her aspirations and goals are to become a wholesaler and to buy a plot of land to build her own house. 

She lives in a rented house and the family does not have access to electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes.

loans.name: Endanilla

texts.en:
Endanilla is married with 4 children. Endanilla is 63 years old and lives in Sinian, Baliangao.
Endanilla sells "Hypo", a stain remover, to earn a living and has had this business for 4 years. Each month, she earns PHP 3,200 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 12,000 PHP to purchase stain remover called Hypo for her retail business.
Endanilla has been a member of PMPC for 11 years.

loans.use: To purchase Hypo stain remover her retail business

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is married with 3 children. She is 47 years old and lives in Sepac, Sapang Dalaga.
Erlinda sells grocery items to earn a living and has had this business for 3 years. Each month, she earns PHP 5,300 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for 20,000 to purchase five sheets of plywood and nails for the grocery store building expansion.
Erlinda has been a member of PMPC for a month.

loans.use: To purchase five sheets of plywood and nails for grocery store building expansion

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 51 years old and lives in Sipaloc, Sibutad. She is married with three children. 

Evelyn has a mini gold processing business and earns approximately 6,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 14,900 PHP to purchase chemicals needed for gold processing. 

Evelyn has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loans.use: To purchase chemicals needed for gold processing.

loans.name: Gerly

texts.en:
Gerly is a widow with 5 children. She is 42 years old and lives in the Philippines.
Gerly is a farmer and raises pigs to earn a living. She has been doing this for a year. She has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase ten sacks of feed for her pigs. 
Gerly has been a member of PMPC for a year.

loans.use: To purchase ten sacks of feed for her pigs

loans.name: Rosas De Rosas Pampa Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ROSAS DE ROSAS PAMPA” iniciará su primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por seis integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rufina es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: ayudante de construcción, costura de polleras, venta de comida, artesanía en perlas, venta de fruta, venta de helado. 

La señora Rufina indica que hace tres años que integra en Pro Mujer  ingresando por invitación de amigas. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de helados que viene trabajando hace años, aprendiendo el mismo de su hermana.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el crecimiento de su negocio (compra de leche y esencias) que adquirirá de la Ceja y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializa a en su puesto de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella es casada y tiene seis hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta todo de nuestra institución.
texts.en:
The "Rosas de Rosas Pampa" communal bank will start its first loan cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Exaltación Center. It is made up of six members, and led by a board of directors, of which Rufina is the president. 

The businesses carried on the members of the communal bank are varied, and among them we have: construction helper, sewing skirts, selling food, handicrafts with pearls, selling fruit, and selling ice cream. 

Rufina says she joined Pro Mujer three years ago, at the invitation of friends. At the present time, she has a business selling ice cream, which she has been working at for years, having learned it from her sister. The loan she will take out now is for helping her business grow, by buying milk and flavor essences that she will acquire in La Ceja. After making her product, she sells it at her stand. 

This form of work allows her to generate income for supporting her family as much as she can; as she is married, and has six children. When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes everything about our institution.

loans.use: To buy milk and flavor essences.

loans.name: Luis Eduardo

texts.es: Luis de 34 años vive con su cónyuge y sus hijos de 6 y 4 años de edad, familia con la cual ha salido adelante a partir de un negocio, en el cual vende artículos de piñatería y cerámica, así como tarjetas y accesorios para decorar las fiestas. Cuando Luis dejó de ser empleado de un granero, decidió emprender una actividad independiente, mediante la cual pudiera lograr generar bienestar para su familia. Acudiendo a la experiencia de su cónyuge, quien por tradición conocía este tipo de negocio,  fue así como  identificó un local, invirtió en productos de piñatería, tarjetería y empezó a vender en un punto muy comercial, Su negocio ha crecido gradualmente y se ha especializado en todo lo referente a fiestas: tarjetas, piñatas, recordatorios, en cartón, icopor y porcelanicron especialmente. En la actualidad su  sueño de incrementar su capital de trabajo se hace cada vez mayor, porque sus clientes aumentan diariamente; esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, mediante el que comprará biscochos en cerámica, y en cartonería, lo mismo que artículos de piñatería, en mayor volumen para lograr disminuir sus precios de venta e incrementar  su capital de trabajo. Su mayor desafío fue adquirir créditos a particulares, que le resultaron muy onerosos y no lo dejaban avanzar. Pero esto es cosa del pasado y ahora quiere lograr ampliarlo con mucha disciplina de trabajo, responsabilidad y dedicación de él y de su cónyuge, para lograr aumentar el bienestar de sus hijos que crecen y a los que quieren brindarle un futuro exitoso.
texts.en:
Luis, 34, lives with his wife and his children, aged 6 and 4. He has moved his family ahead with a business selling party decorations such as piñatas and ceramic items, as well as cards and accessories. 

When Luis left his job in a granary, he decided to start his own business in order to be able to improve his family’s well-being. Drawing on his wife’s experience with this kind of business, he found a shop, invested in piñatas and cards and began selling in a very commercial area. His business has gradually grown and he has specialized in everything pertaining to parties: cards, piñatas, mementos in cardboard, styrofoam and especially cold porcelain.

Currently his dream of increasing his working capital is growing because his customer base is expanding daily. That is why he came to KIVA for a loan, which he will use to buy ceramic and cardboard items, as well as piñatas, in greater volume in order to lower his sales price and increase his working capital. His greatest challenge was when he acquired private loans, which were very onerous and did not allow him to get ahead. But that is in the past and now, with his and his wife’s dedication, work discipline and sense of responsibility, he wants to expand his business in order to increase his children’s well-being so they can grow and have a successful future.

loans.use: to buy ceramic and cardboard items, as well as piñatas, in greater quantities so that he can lower his sales price.

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El socio se sigue dedicando al negocio de ganaderia,el socio los ganados los hace engordar y crecer y luego los vende en las diferentes ferias que existe en el distrito de Anta y tambien el socio sigue siendo albañil,el socio pinta y hace refacciones de casas,el sueño del socio es ampliar el negocio de ganaderia.El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar alimentos para los ganados y tambien para comprar herramientas como pinturas y yeso.
 El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues in the livestock business. He fattens and raises cattle and then later sells them at different fairs in the District of Anta. He also continues in his job as a bricklayer, in addition to painting and repairing houses. His dream is to expand his livestock business.

The member is requesting a loan to buy feed for his cattle and also acquire tools, such as paint and plaster. He is happy with this loan and promises to complete the payments.

loans.use: to buy feed for his cattle and tools (paint and plaster) for his home repair jobs.

loans.name: Jenet

texts.en: Jenet is 21 years old and lives in Jacob Town. She is married and has a 1-year-old child. For  the  past 10 years, she has been frying plantain in the community. She makes more profit and has more customers since she is the only one who sells fried plantain in her community. She is requesting a loan to purchase more plantains for her business, and her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more plantains for her business.

loans.name: Armando

texts.en:
Since he was 10 years old, Armando knew he wanted to be a mechanic at his own shop. Watching his father work on cars influenced him to attend school in Chihuahua, Mexico to complete his education.  For 13 years now, Armando has worked on and inspected cars in his El Paso shop, Auto C. Electric. 

Armando will purchase a car lift and more tools with the money from an ACCION Texas loan. Auto C. Electric has been using a car jack in lieu of a lift. Through the ACCION Texas loan, he and the other two mechanics will complete work faster, he said, thus allowing him to grow his business.

loans.use: To purchase a car lift and more equipment.

loans.name: Adrian

texts.es: El señor Adrián nació en  Santa Cruz,  vive en la localidad de  Santa Rita - el Torno, el trabaja como  albañil  por mas de un año,  su esposa  es la señora Gabriela,  tienen una  hija.  Viven en la casa de  su tío ellos tiene su lotecito pero les falta todavía terminar de construir,   precisamente el destino del crédito es para  la compra de material de construcción para terminar la construcción de un cuarto en su domicilio y así brindar comodidad a su familia,  el se encuentra en su  secta secuencia siempre a cancelado puntual,  por tal motivo se siente feliz y  muy  agradecido por el apoyo económico brindado por la institución ya que es bastante eficaz, ágil,  y ligero no le ponen trabas como en otros lugares. El es un cliente fiel  ha nosotros ya que solo trabaja con emprender.
texts.en:
Sr. Adrián was born in Santa Cruz, but lives in the town of Santa Rita – El Torno. He has worked as a bricklayer for more than a year. His wife is Sra. Gabriela and they have a daughter. They live at his uncle’s house. Adrián and his family have a small lot, but the construction of their home is still not finished.

The exact use of this loan will be used to buy building materials in order to finish the construction of a room in his home. This will provide comfort for his family. He has always demonstrated punctuality with his loans. Adrián is happy and appreciative of the financial support provided by the organization, which has demonstrated more efficiency, flexibility, and speed than other institutions. He is a loyal client and has only worked with Emprender.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for finishing a room.

loans.name: Almostagbal /abeer Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-mostgbal /Abeer and consists of four members who are all female: Ghalia, Noura, Safiah and Mahbah. All of them are friends  from Aden, Yemen. They primarily work together in small businesses like sewing. The group took a loan of 200,000 YER.

Mahbah is the leader of their group. (She is the second lady standing on the left covered by a purple, green and white Islamic veil outfit.) She is 40 years old, widowed with eight children and lives in Aden.
\
Her main business is sewing, which is used to stitch patterns of fabric. She has been in business for several years and she employed two women to help her in her business. With several years of experience to her credit, she now has a good command of her activity. She is taking a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB and intends to use her loan to better develop her business to purchase fabrics and textiles to increase her savings. Her profits will allow her to help her family’s needs.

In the future, Mahbah would like to have a big center to sell other products such as incense, perfumes and different clothes.
