They live in their own home and share the happiness of raising their young son who gives them with the drive to work hard to provide him a better quality of life. Cinthia’s job is to sell food; she wakes up early every morning and goes to the market in search of the best ingredients. She also buys the food necessary for daily food and once at home she begins to prepare her delicious dishes that have made her very well known in her block. She has worked in this field for 4 years; she works alone since her partner works another job. Cinthia enjoys her work very much since it allows her time to take care of her young child who is at an age that requires a lot of care, besides, her job allows her the opportunity to have a good income since before they had a lot of financial problems and there wasn’t enough money to meet the household expenses. Cinthia’s goal is to keep her business growing and to have her own restaurant. This will be her second loan with MFP and hopes for your support to keep her dreams alive and is very committed to meeting all of her payment quotas on time as she has done in the past. With the 1200 soles, she will buy ingredients and supplies to keep working, as well as fixing some chairs and tables to take better care of her customers.

loans.use: buy raw materials to prepare food, as well as fixing some chairs and tables.

loans.name: Alassane

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un jeune célibataire qui a arrété ses études, faute de moyens pour continuer, et qui s'est lancé dans le commerce de téléphones portables et de crédits téléphone prépayés.Il est l'ainé d'une famille de sept personnes dont les deux parents et leurs cinq enfants.Les revenus générés par son activité lui permettent d'appuyer ses parents dans la prise en charge des besoins alimentaires, sanitaires, vestimentaires ainsi que des charges locatives, de factures d'eau et d'électricité de la famille.Pour renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 150000f de l'UIMCEC afin d'acheter des cartes de recharge de crédit téléphone.Son ambition est d'ouvrir une cantine au marché central pour élargir sa clientèle.
texts.en: This borrower is a young single man who abandoned his studies as he did not have the means to continue them. He launched himself into the portable telephone and prepaid telephone credit business; He is the eldest of a family of seven: two parents and five children. The income he generates from his business allows him to help his parents to cover the cost of the family's nutritional, sanitary and clothing needs, as well as its rent, water and electricity bills. In order to strengthen his business, he is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs from UIMCEC so that he can buy telephone credit recharge cards. His ambition is to open a stall in the central market to expand his customer base.

loans.use: to buy telephone credit recharge cards

loans.name: Birama

texts.fr:
Monsieur  Birama est âgé d’environ 49 ans, polygame et père de huit enfants, il réside avec ses femmes et leurs enfants à Niena, village situé à environ 75 km de la ville de Sikasso.
 Monsieur Birama fait le commerce de matériaux de construction il y’a plus de 15 ans. Il jouit d’une forte réputation et accueille beaucoup de commandes, mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins fait défaut. Ainsi, il intégra Soro Yiriwaso cette année, dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante. Birama sollicite ce prêt, pour acheter : 50 barres de fer 8, 40 barres de fer 6, et 30 planches. Il s’approvisionne à Sikasso et Bamako. Ses ventes se font généralement sur commande.    
 Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 125 000 FCFA par mois. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Birama is around 49 years old, polygamous and father to eight children. He lives with his wives and their children in Niena, a village which lies around 75 km from the town of Sikasso.

Birama has been trading in building materials for more than 15 years. He enjoys a good reputation and gets a lot of orders, but he does not have the necessary resources to meet this demand. He thus joined Soro Yiriwaso this year with a view to being able to satisfy his ever-increasing customer demand more easily. Birama is requesting this loan to buy: 50 size 8 iron bars, 40 size 6 iron bars and 30 planks. He gets his supplies in Sikasso and Bamako. He generally sells to order.

With this loan he is expecting to make a monthly profit of 125,000FCFA. With the profits he makes, he is planning to cover the majority of his expenses, as well as those of his family, and pay the interest on his loan; the rest will be reinvested in his business.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée qui exerce dans le commerce de tissus. Elle est mère de quatre enfants dont les deux sont à l'école. Elle s'approvisionne en gros dans un pays frontalier chez des confectionneurs artisananux et revend ses tissus à crédit à ses clients. Au bout de deux mois, elle encaisse des reccettes assez consistants qui lui permettent de se prendre en charge et de subvenir aux besoins alimentaires et sanitaires de ses enfants. Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, elle sollicite un pret de 100000f pour acheter quatres douzaines de tissus.Elle ambitionne d'élargir son commerce à des produits alimentaire qui font l'objet d'une forte demande au plan local.
texts.en: This borrower is a married woman who trades in fabrics. She is mother to four children two of whom are at school. She gets her supplies wholesale from artisan manufacturers in a bordering country and resells her fabrics on credit to her customers. After two months she cashes in her relatively consistent income, which allows her to take care of and provide for her children's nutritional and health needs. In order to strengthen her business, she is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to buy four dozen fabrics. Her ambition is to extend her business to food products which are in great demand locally.

loans.use: to buy four dozen fabrics

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana lives in Barnesville. She is thirty-two years old, single, and has an eighteen-year-old child. She is a high-school graduate. For the past thirteen years she has been running a shop where she sells cement and bags of rice. Some of the challenges she has faced include the location of her shop as sometimes business is slow. 

Christiana started this business with her savings. She learnt how to run it from her mother. She enjoys the business because at the end of each month, she has profit which she can save and use to feed her child.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more cement and rice to expand her business and to enable her to educate her child.

loans.use: to purchase more cement and rice to expand her business.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 39 years old and married with seven children.

She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Judith is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Judith has been farming sugarcane for 10 years and also earns additional income from raising livestock and tailoring.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for her rope-making business.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita, age 55, is married with four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Clarita has a repair shop business in the Philippines. Clarita has requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy materials for her repair shop business.

Clarita has been in this business for four years. In the future, Clarita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her repair shop business.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 51 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Zenaida is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

Zenaida has been farming rice for 20 years, and she also earns additional income from raising pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and farm supplies.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.en:
Noemi is 43 years old and married with four children.

Noemi works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

Noemi has borrowed and paid 16 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for four years now, and she also earns an income from food vending.

Noemi aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Gregoria Catalina

texts.es: La señora Gregoria y su familia su esposo que es chofer  y su hijo que se encuentra en la universidad,   viven en la zona Chijini ubicada a veinte minutos del centro de la ciudad. Ella trabaja vendiendo diferentes electrodomésticos a crédito como ser televisores plasma,  equipo de sonido. Tienen un promedio de 20 a 50 clientes en diferentes zonas e inclusive en oficinas públicas y privadas. Ella habla con sus futuros clientes y ellos hacen diferentes pedidos que ella paga y luego va cobrando de manera semanal o mensual con un incremento por el tiempo que tarden en pagar. Lo mas resaltante de esta actividad es que ella hace que sus clientes elijan los productos que desean y no así como hacen otras personas que primero compran los productos antes de ofrecerlos. Además esto asegura que sus clientes estén satisfechos ya que son ellos los que elijen de manera directa lo que van a adquirir. La Sra. Gregoria En esta oportunidad solicita el préstamo de dinero para la compra de televisores plasma por cantidad para entregar  pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gregoria lives with her husband, a driver, and her son, who is a university student, in the Chijini area located twenty minutes from the city center.  She sells domestic appliances such as plasma television sets and sound equipment.  She has between 20 to 50 customers in different areas, including those working in public and private offices.  She takes orders from her customers, which she pays for up front and later collects weekly or monthly, increasing the price depending on the time taken to collect payment.

The interesting part of her business is that she asks the customers to choose their product instead of doing what other people do, which is buy the products first then try to sell them.  Her way of doing things ensures the customers are always satisfied since they are the ones who directly choose what they want to buy.  Gregoria is requesting a loan to buy plasma TVs wholesale so she can deliver the orders to her customers.

loans.use: To buy plasma TVs wholesale.

loans.name: Niza

texts.en:
Niza is 28 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with three children. 

Niza has a shop that sells vegetables like cabbages, eggplants and string-beans. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy vegetables to sell.

Niza has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Niza hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Theresa  M.

texts.en:
Theresa lives in Barnesville. She is forty years old, single, and has a twenty-two year old who goes to school and lives at home. 

For the past year, Theresa has been running a grocery shop where she sells tooth paste, bath and washing soap, rice and many other items. She started this business with money that she earned and saved. She learnt how to run the business from her friends. One of the challenges she faces is the exchange rate with the US dollar as she buys goods in dollars. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods including toothpaste, rice, bath and washing soap, as well as many other items to sell in her business. Her plan is to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more goods including toothpaste, rice, bath and washing soap for her business.

loans.name: Deddeh

texts.en:
Deddeh lives in Barnesville. She is forty-one years old, single, and has two children aged eighteen and twenty-three years old. Both of them are in school and live at home. 

For the past five years now she has been operating a grocery shop where she sells tooth paste, bath and washing soap, rice, sardines and many other items. She started this business with money that she received from her mother and she learned how to run it from her friends. One of the challenges she faces is transporting goods to her shop. She is requesting a loan to purchase more goods including toothpaste, rice, bath and washing soap, rice, sardines, mayonnaise and many other items for her business. Her plan is to expand her business and to obtain a university degree.

loans.use: to purchase more goods including toothpaste, rice, bath and washing soap, rice, sardines and mayonnaise for her business.

loans.name: Genelyn

texts.en:
Genelyn is 39 years old and married with one child who is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Genelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell.

Genelyn has been in this business for seven years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, cream, sugar, etc.

In the future Genelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Alvaro

texts.es: Álvaro, de 51 años, es un hombre amable y muy dinámico. Está casado con Dulcila de 46 años con quien tiene dos hijos, quienes ya son mayores e independientes. Durante mucho tiempo él ha trabajado mucho para así poder brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos, ahora que ya son mayores él solo desea tener un respaldo para tener una vejez tranquila a lado de su esposa. Actualmente en Pucallpa hay crecimiento de viviendas, y en estos tiempo las personas están en proceso de construcción y refacción de las mismas, es por ello que van en busca de un buen albañil que tenga conocimientos amplios en el rubro y sobre todo que cobre un precio justo, es ahí que Álvaro trabaja dando estos servicios. Él es un gran albañil, ofrece un buen acabado y seguridad en sus obras, por lo general trabaja por recomendaciones y siempre está con algun trabajo. Tiene más de 10 años realizando está actividad y contrata a tres personas mas que le brindan la ayuda necesaria para poder entregar una obra en el tiempo ofrecido. Le esta yendo muy bien ya que tiene obras en construcción y próximamente serán entregados, desea poder seguir trabajando y poder tener más herramientas para poder contratar a mas personas y seguir progresando con lo que hace. Este será el crédito número 14 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos, además está muy decidido en cumplir con sus pagos como lo hizo hasta hora en sus créditos anteriores. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 soles, comprará herramientas y algunos materiales que le hacen falta para poder cubrir con la demanda de obras que tienen por cumplir.
texts.en:
Álvaro, 51, is a kind, dynamic man who is married to Dulcila, 46, and they have two children who are independent adults.  For many years he has worked hard to give his children a better lifestyle and now that they are grown he wants to have a quiet retirement at his wife's side.  Currently there is a boom in residential construction in Pucallpa and people are building or refurbishing their homes.  Therefore they seek out a good bricklayer who has vast experience in the industry and reasonable prices, and that is where Álvaro comes in.  He is a great bricklayer and offers a good finish and safety during his work.  In general he works by recommendation and is always busy.

For over ten years he has been in this business, hiring three workers who help out when necessary in order to finish projects on time.  It is going well for him since he has construction works in progress that will be delivered shortly.  He hopes to continue working and having more tools so he can hire more people and continue progressing in his business.  This is his 14th loan through MFP and he is counting on your support to carry out his goals.  He is committed to paying back the loan on time as with his previous loans.  He plans to use the 1,500 PEN to buy tools and materials he needs for the projects he is working on.

loans.use: To buy construction tools.

loans.name: Bethsy

texts.es: Bethsy, de 35 años, es una mujer amable y trabajadora, esta casada con Emerson de 32 años con quien tiene dos lindos niños, Emerson de 6 y Renzo de 3, ellos son su motor para seguir trabajando día a día y así lograr brindarles lo mejor. Ella vive a lado de su familia en una casa propia. El trabajo de Bethsy consiste en la venta de abarrotes, tiene una tienda en su casa en donde a diario van sus clientes a buscar los productos de primera necesidad. Acuden muchas personas pues ella abre desde muy temprano y tiene de todo para ofrecer, lleva cinco años en este negocio y trabaja con la ayuda de una sobrina. Le gusta mucho su actividad pues le permite tener tiempo disponible para su familia al mismo tiempo que le genera ganancias. Por otro lado, es docente en una institución educativa cerca de su casa, por lo que siginifica más ingresos estables para su hogar. Espera seguir trabajando y lograr el progreso en su negocio. Este será el octavo préstamo con la institución MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio, por otro lado se compromete una vez mas de cumplir con sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal por que todos los integrantes son personas que son muy responsables y muy solidarias. Con el monto solicitado de 1500 soles, comprará abarrotes y mercadería para ampliar la variedad de artículos que ofrece en su tienda de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Bethsy, 35, is a kind, hard-working woman who is married to Emerson, 32.  They have two lovely children, Emerson, 6, and Renzo, 3, who are her reason to continue working hard every day to give them the best she can. She lives with her family in her own house, where Bethsy sells groceries out of a store she has set up.  Every day many customers come to her store to buy essential goods since she opens very early in the morning and keeps a stock of everything.  She has been business for five years and has the help of her niece.

She enjoys her work which allows her to spend time with the family while generating an income.  Also, she is a teacher at the school near her home, which provides extra income for the household.  She hopes to continue working and getting ahead in her business.  This is her eighth loan through MFP and she is grateful for the financial support as it will give her confidence to advance.  She is committed to paying back the loan on time as with her previous loans.  The 1,500 PEN will be used to buy groceries and merchandise to broaden the variety of products she offers in her grocery store.

loans.use: To buy essential products for her store.

loans.name: Dolores Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señora. Dolores es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Porvenir, vive por la parroquia de Cumbe, parroquia que se encuentra a 24 kilómetros al sur de la ciudad de Cuenca. En su entorno se encuentran grandes pastos de fincas ganaderas, haciendas viejas y modernas construcciones, su gente es amable, gentil y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
 
Doña Dolores tiene 48 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 26, 24, 22 y 17 años de edad, todos sus hijos trabajan, le  ayudan económicamente y también están estudiando. Su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo su propia unidad de taxi, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.

La Señora. Dolores se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de carnes, actividad que le realiza hace 16 años, trabaja los días de ferias sin un horario fijo. En su casa también se dedica a la cría de ganado, cerdos y cuyes.

En el banco comunal se encuentra hace 10 años y su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de carne para continuar con su negocio.
 
Su sueño es viajar por el mundo.
texts.en:
Dolores is a member of the communal bank "Nuevo Porvenir" and she lives in the Cumbe parish which is 24 kilometers south of the city of Cuenca.  Here there are many livestock farms with great pastures, old haciendas and modern buildings.  The people are kind and gentle, and maintain their local culture and traditions.

Dolores is 48, married and has four children, ages 26, 24, 22 and 17 who all work and help out at home.  They also study.  Her husband is a taxi driver with his own vehicle and they live in their own home.

Dolores sells all kinds of meat and has been in business for 16 years.  She works on market days and has no fixed schedule.  At home she raises cattle, pigs and guinea pigs.  She has been in the communal bank for ten years and plans to use the loan to buy meat to continue her business.

Her dream is to travel around the world.

loans.use: To buy meat.

loans.name: María Marlene

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Porvenir, vive por la parroquia de Cumbe, parroquia que se encuentra a 24 kilómetros al sur de la ciudad de Cuenca. En su entorno se encuentran grandes pastos de fincas ganaderas, haciendas viejas y modernas construcciones, su gente es amable, gentil y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
 
La Señora María tiene 45 años, es madre soltera de 4 hijos de 27, 23, 16 y 13 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, su tercer hijo tiene una discapacidad y su última hija está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá con quien comparte los gastos del hogar.

Doña María se dedica a la agricultura, labra terrenos ajenos  y su propio terreno, lo que cultiva en su terreno es para el consumo de su hogar. También cría ganado.

Este es su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de ganado para crecer en este trabajo.
 
Su meta es ampliar su negocio de cría de ganado.
texts.en:
María is a member of the communal bank "Nuevo Porvenir" and she lives in the Cumbe parish which is 24 kilometers south of the city of Cuenca.  Here there are livestock farms with great pastures, old haciendas and modern buildings.  The people are kind and gentle, and maintain the local culture and traditions.

Maria is 45, single, and has four children, ages 27, 23, 16 and 13.  The eldest two work and help out economically.  Her third child has a disability and her youngest daughter is in school in the city.  She does not have her own home and lives with her mother, sharing household expenses.

She works in agriculture and farms her own land and other people's land.  What she grows on her own land is for household consumption.  She also raises livestock.

This is her second loan through the communal bank and she plans to use it to buy livestock.  Her goal is to expand her livestock business.

loans.use: To buy livestock.

loans.name: Pedro Jose

texts.es: Pedro José, es un cliente activo de Fundación León 2000, el crédito solicitado anteriormente lo utilizo para invertir en el negocio en la compra de medicamentos que es a lo que se dedica el emprendedor. Pedro José es un emprendedor que ha buscado como salir adelante, nos cuenta que le va bien en el negocio sus clientes ya lo conoce y los productos que ofrece que son de calidad. Pedro José está solicitando nuevamente financiamiento para comprar variedad de medicamento y ofrecerle a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Pedro José is an active client of the Fundación León 2000. He invested his previous loan in his business, purchasing medicines for subsequent sale. He is an entrepreneur who has sought to move forward and succeed. He tells us that his business is doing well, as his clients already know him and the products that he offers are of high quality.

Pedro José is requesting this new loan to purchase a variety of medicines to offer to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of medicines for his business

loans.name: María Robertina

texts.es:
La Señora. María es socia del banco comunal Nuevo Porvenir, vive por la parroquia de Cumbe, parroquia que se encuentra a 24 kilómetros al sur de la ciudad de Cuenca. En su entorno se encuentra grandes pastos de fincas ganaderas, haciendas viejas y modernas construcciones, su gente es amable, gentil y mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.
 
La Señora. María tiene 65 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 8 hijos mayores de edad,  casados e independientes. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura, la casa en la que vive es de su propiedad.
 
Ella  se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y también cría cuyes, cerdos y borregos a los que los vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad económica.
 
Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos y borregos, se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal. 

Su meta es mejorar la cría de animales.
texts.en:
This lady, María is a member of 'Nuevo Porvenir' communal bank and lives in the parish of Cumbe, which lies 24 kilometers south of the city of Cuenca. The surrounding pastures are home to large ranches, old country estates and modern buildings. Its people are friendly and courteous, and they maintain their culture and traditions.
 
María is 65 years old, married and has 8 children who are now married and independent. Her husband works in agriculture, and the house in which they live is their own property. María carries out household chores and also raises guinea pigs, pigs and sheep to sell to meet their financial needs.
 
This is María's second loan with her communal bank, and she invest it in the purchase of pigs and sheep. María's goal is to improve the breeding of animals.

loans.use: to purchase pigs and sheep

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 68 years old and has 8 children.

Lilia is in the agricultural business, farming and selling vegetable in the Philippines.  Lilia requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Lilia has been farming and selling vegetable for 30 years now and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lilia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is 28 years old and married with 3 children.  With 2 children in school, Arlene works very hard to provide for them.

Arlene runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.  Arlene has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, spices, sugar, milk, noodles, etc.. 

In the future Arlene would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks to sell.

loans.name: Oscar Manuel

texts.es:
Oscar, es comerciante de ropa, vive con sus tíos, la casa es familiar y está soltero, desde hace un año comenzó a la venta de ropa, ha tenido una buena experiencia y por eso está solicitando un préstamo para surtirlo de nueva mercadería.
Este préstamo será invertido en Blusas, vestidos, faldas, ropa interior, camisas y camisetas, con esta mercadería espera mantener un buen nivel de inventario para ofrecerles a los clientes, dándole mayor fortaleza.
La aspiración de Oscar es tener un negocio estable, que sus clientes encuentren buenos productos en el negocio y forjarse un buen futuro como comerciante.
texts.en:
Oscar is a clothing merchant. He is single and lives with his uncles in the family house. He began selling clothes one year ago and the experience has been a success. Therefore, he is requesting a loan so that he can supply his business with an assortment of new merchandise. 

This loan will be invested in buying blouses, dresses, skirts, underwear, shirts and t-shirts. With this merchandise, Oscar expects to maintain a good level of stock to offer his customers, giving his business greater strength.

Oscar's aspiration is to have a stable business, where his clients can purchase high quality products, and he hopes to forge a bright future for himself as a trader.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, dresses, skirts, underwear, shirts and t-shirts

loans.name: Elvera

texts.en:
Elvera is 35 years old and married with 2 children.  With one child in school, Elvera works very hard to provide for them.

Elvera runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items for her sari-sari (variety)store.  Elvera has been in this business for 7 years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, shampoo, snack foods, etc.. 

In the future Elvera would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional itrems for her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Barcelyn

texts.en: This time Barcelyn is borrowing PHP 25,000 to fund her general store business.  She previously funded through NWTF and KIVA, which continues to provide Barcelyn and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: This time Marcelina is borrowing PHP 12,000 to fund her general store business.  She previously funded through NWTF and KIVA which continues to provide Marcelina and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: To buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries to sell in her sari sari store.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
This is 32 year-old Hawa.  She is married, and has 4 children age 16, 13, 11 and 4 years old.  She has 3 additional dependents who live with her because they are all in school.  

In 2007, Hawa established her food stuff business.  She began her business just to assist her mother and to enhance her independence.  Working 6 days a week and 9 hours a day, she earns about SLL 950,000 every month from this business.  She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000. 

Hawa has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan and now requires a new loan in order to buy bulgur, beans and pepper.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 300,000.  In the future, Hawa plans to own a house, open a bank account, and to give quality education to her children.   She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy bulgur, pepper, beans and oil

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 52 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.  She is married with 1 child.  Ruth used her last loan to purchase motorcycle tires and spare parts. 

Her business grown and become successful.  She's now involved in her other businesses.  She's taking a new loan to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.  She hopes to be able to grow more of her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: This time Carmelita is borrowing Php 18,000 to fund her curtains business.  The tailoring business that she previously funded through NWTF and KIVA continues to provide Carmelita and her family with income that is improving their quality of life.

loans.use: To buy more curtains to sell to customers.

loans.name: San Isidro - Huancan Group

texts.es: kattyusca Rocio requirio otro prestamo para compra de mas lanas e hilos y otros esto es su tercer prestamo, ya que le va muy bien en la fabricacion de peluches artezanales con el apoyo de su esposo e hijos, tuvieron las mejores oportunidades en las ventas, gracias a ello mejoraron sus ingresos economicos, frente a ello esta agradecida por el prestamo, ella cumplio con las dos primeros prestamos.
texts.en: Kattyusca Rocio needed another loan to buy more wool and thread and more. This is her third loan, since it is going very well for her making artisanal stuffed animals with her husband's and children's support. They had better sales opportunities and thanks to that they improved their income. THey are grateful for the loan. She paid off the two prior loans.

loans.use: to make stuffed toys.

loans.name: Armelita

texts.en:
Armelita is a married woman with 3 children age 13, 11 and 3 years old.  She is engaged in fishing.  Armelita hires a worker to operate her fishing boat. Armelita sells fresh fish at the market.  In addition to fishing, Armelita also runs a small sari-sari store business.  She sells items like canned goods, eggs and coffee.

Armelita has requested this loan to purchase gasoline and more items to sell such as canned goods and noodles.  Armelita hopes to have a stable business in the future.

loans.use: To purchase gasoline and more items to sell such as canned goods and noodles.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is from the Bangko, Pana-on,Misamis Occidental.  She is 51 years old.  Emily is married and has 2 adult-aged children.  To make a living, Emily owns and operates a gardening business venture.  

Emily has been in this business for 2 years and earns 3,000 PHP a month.  In 2008, Emily joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Emily is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which she will use to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise

loans.name: Alusine

texts.en:
This is 53-year-old Alusine.  He is married and has 6 children, aged 1, 3, 7, 12, 15 and 18 years. He has 1 additional dependent who lives him because she is her relative.  In 1999, Alusine established his building materials business. The business started as a small lumber store, which has now developed into a building materials business. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Alusine has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy more of his business stock. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Alusine plans to see that his children are well educated and have good health care. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for building materials.

loans.name: Mayra Alexandra

texts.es:
La Señora Mayra es socia del banco comunal Atenas, vive por un hermoso sector de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad que es reconocida como la "Atenas del Ecuador". Su centro histórico es el más grande y el mejor conservado del país, también es moderna y atractiva, goza de todos los conforts de la actualidad; su gastronomía local cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños. Su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Mayra es muy joven tiene 19 años de edad, vive en unión libre y ha concebido una hija de 11 meses de edad. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tienen casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su suegra con quien comparte los gastos del hogar.
 
Ella se encuentra en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal, anteriormente se encontraba trabajando como empleada privada pero ahora con su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una carreta para dedicarse a la venta comida rápida. 

Su meta es tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
Mayra is a member of the Atenas communal bank. She lives in a beautiful area of the city of Cuenca. This city is called "the Athens of Ecuador". It's historical center is the biggest and best preserved in the country. It is also modern and attractive, with all modern comforts. Its local cuisine captures the palate of its own people and of travelers. Its people maintain their culture and traditions. 

Mayra is a young 19 year old woman. She is in a common law marriage and has an 11 month old daughter. Her husband works as a private employee. They don't own their own home and live with her mother in law, with whom they share household expenses.  
 
She is on her third loan in her communal bank. Previously she was working as a private employee, but now she will invest her new loan in buying a cart to sell fast food.  

Her goal is to have a restaurant.

loans.use: to buy a cart.

loans.name: Bernadetha

texts.en: Bernadetha is married with 5 school-aged children. She is 45 years old and lives in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Bernadetha used her last loan to buy snack items to sell. Her business is successful, and she's taking a new loan to purchase additional products to sell. In the future she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Charito

texts.en: 38-year-old Charito is a married woman with 3 children, aged 14, 15 and 17. Her husband works as a fisherman. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store business and is also a food vendor. She cooks food dishes to sell to her community. She also helps her husband sell fresh fish at the market. Charito works hard to help provide for her family and send her children to school. She requested this loan to buy fishing nets, ingredients and more items to sell, such as canned goods. She hopes to earn better and be able to sustain her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, ingredients and more items to sell, such as canned goods.

loans.name: Dalmacia

texts.en:
Dalmacia is a married woman with 6 children. She runs a furniture shop with her husband, who is a carpenter. Her husband personally makes the furniture they sell to their community. Dalmacia does her best to help grow their business and take care of her family.

Dalmacia has requested this loan to buy bamboo, nails and varnish. She hopes for this loan to help improve their business.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, nails and varnish.

loans.name: Seray

texts.en:
This is 26-year-old Seray.  She is married and has 3 children, aged 9, 6 and 3. She has 1 additional dependent, who lives with her because he is schooling.  In 2004, Seray established her toiletries and cosmetics business. She began her business because she wants to provide livelihood for her family, and that is her only source of income. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 950,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Seray has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to buy foot brushes, air cleaners, toothpicks, Vaseline and Maxxam toothpaste. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, Seray plans to take a business trip to Dubai for her purchases, and to educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more foot brushes, air cleaners, toothpicks, Vaseline and Maxxam toothpaste for her business

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.en:
63-year-old Ernesto is a fisherman from Talibon, Bohol. He operates his own fishing boat to catch fish. He sells his catch at his town’s market. He also makes crab nets that he sells to his community. He works hard to earn better and support his family financially.

He has requested a loan to buy additional fishing nets and materials to improve his fishing boat. In the future, Ernesto hopes to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy additional fishing nets and materials to improve his fishing boat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy bulgur and beans.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is a 25-year-old married woman with 3 young children. The oldest child is 7 years old. Geraldine’s husband works as a construction worker.

Geraldine has been in the business of raising hogs for 4 years. She has a backyard piggery where she keeps her pigs in good shape. She also sells fish to her community. She said she buys directly from fishermen at her town. Geraldine works hard to support her family and improve their living situation. She plans to use her loan to buy feeds and more fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy feeds and more fish to sell.

loans.name: Hazel

texts.en:
Hazel is 30 years old and married. She has 2 children aged 10 and 5. Her husband works as a fisherman. Hazel has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for 12 years. She sells bread, canned goods, eggs and dried fish. She is able to provide for her family’s daily needs with her business.

She has requested a loan to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods, bread and soft drinks. Hazel said, “I hope to successfully expand my business to meet family commitments, like educating my children, and also to fulfill my social responsibility.”

loans.use: to buy more items to sell, such as canned goods, bread and soft drinks.

loans.name: Sillah

texts.en:
This is 31-year-old Sillah.  He is married and has 3 children, aged 3, 5 and 9. He has 2 additional dependents who live with him to assist one of his sisters with her children's education.  In 2001, Sillah established his spare parts business. The business started in the sale of bicycle spare parts with a brother, and now the business has grown to spare parts for autos and motorcycles. The business also makes him learn about engines. 

Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,995,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Sillah has already received and successfully repaid 1 loan, and now requires a new loan in order to improve his stock. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 545,020. In the future, Sillah plans to educate his children and to make more profit in the business.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts.

loans.name: Kitsao Charo

texts.en:
Kitsao Charo is a 31-year-old, retail shop proprietor in Kilifi.

He is married and he has been operating this business for the past five years.  His business is doing great.  Kitsao was introduced to KADET and this marks his third loan to finance his business.  With this loan, he plans to purchase more cooking oil, washing powders, baking flour and maize flour to sell to his customers. He will use the anticipated profit to add more stock. 

He hopes to have a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, washing powders, baking flour and maize flour.

loans.name: Tania Karina

texts.es:
La Señora Tania es socia del banco comunal Atenas, vive por un hermoso sector de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad que es reconocida como la "Atenas del Ecuador". Su centro histórico es el más grande y el mejor conservado del país, también es moderna y atractiva, goza de todos los conforts de la actualidad; su gastronomía local cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños. Su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Doña Tania tiene 23 años, es casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido una hija que s de un año y seis meses. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres pero independiente.

La Señora. Tania es profesional en la costura y tiene un taller propio en sociedad con una tía, tiene este negocio hace 4 años y trabaja de lunes a viernes sin un horario fijo.
 
Se encuentra en el banco comunal en su segundo crédito y lo va a invertir en la compra de materia prima para su negocio como es tela, hilos, botones, cierres, etc.

Su meta es terminar sus estudios del Colegio y continuar con sus estudios Universitarios.
texts.en:
Tania is a member of the Atenas communal bank. She lives in a beautiful area of the city of Cuenca. This city is known as the "Athens of Ecuador". Its historical center is the biggest and best preserved in the country. It is also modern and attractive and has all present day comforts. Its local cuisine captures the palate of its own people and visitors. Its people maintain their culture and traditions. 

Tania is 23 years old. She is married and has an eighteen month old daughter. Her husband works as a private employee. They don't own their own home but live in her parents home, independently.

Tania is a professional seamstress and she has her own shop in partnership with her aunt. She has had this business for 4 years and works Monday through Friday with no set schedule.   
 
She is on her second loan with the bank and she is going to invest it in buying raw materials for her business such as fabrics, thread, buttons, zippers, etc.

Her goal is to get her high school degree and continue studying at university.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons, zippers, etc.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora Teresa es socia del banco comunal Atenas, vive por un hermoso sector de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad que es reconocida como la "Atenas del Ecuador". Su centro histórico es el más grande y el mejor conservado del país, también es moderna y atractiva, goza de todos los conforts de la actualidad; su gastronomía local cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños. Su gente mantiene la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

La Señora. Teresa tiene 51 años, es viuda y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos, dos son casados e independientes, un hijo está trabajando y le ayuda económicamente y su último hijo está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad. No tienen casa propia por lo que vive arrendando. 

Doña Teresa se dedica a la fabricación de guaipe (trapos para limpiar), actividad que la realiza hace 10 años, por las noches se dedica a la venta chuzos (carne en palito), negocio que realiza hace un año. También se encuentra al cuidado de un adulto mayor hace dos años.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 15 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de tela para la realización de guaipe. 

Su sueño es tener un negocio como una cevicheria.
texts.en:
Teresa is a member of the Atenas communal bank. She lives in a beautiful area of the city of Cuenca. This city is known as the "Athens of Ecuador". Its historical center is the largest and best preserved in the country. It is also modern and attractive and has all the present day comforts. Its local cuisine captures the palate of its own people and visitors. Its people maintain their culture and traditions. 

Teresa is 51 years old. She is a widow and the mother of 4 children. Two of them are married and on their own. One son is working and helps her financially and her youngest son is going to high school in town. They don't own their own home and are renters.  

Teresa makes cleaning cloths. She has been doing this activity for 10 years. At night, she sells chuzos (meat on a stick). She has been doing this business for a year. She has also been taking care of an elderly adult for two years.   

She has been a member of the communal bank for 15 years. She will invest her loan in buying fabric to make the cleaning cloths. 

Her dream is to have a business selling ceviche.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Sak

texts.en:
Sak is a 34-year-old married woman.  She has four children, all of whom are in school. She has had a food stall business in Bor, South Sudan for two years.

Sak is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase sugar for resale.

loans.name: Sergelenbaatar

texts.en: Sergelenbaatar, 47, works as a repairman in an auto-repair service. He lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been doing his job for six years and his salary is about US $350 in a month, which does not usually cover his family's necessary expenses. Therefore he decided to start a second business driving a taxi around the city. Recently he bought an old car from his company at a low price. He will use it for his new business. But, first he needs to make some adjustments and repairs to his car, which will improve the service quality of his new business. The loan he is requesting will be dedicated to the purchase of spare parts for his car adjustments.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for his car adjustments.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 45 years old and is married to James. They have one daughter who is in high school. Mary has dairy cows.

Mary is requesting a loan from KADET LTD to buy another dairy cow. She is optimistic that her business will do well after her loan. Mary hopes to see her living standards improve with the profits from her business.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Batsaikhan

texts.en:
Batsaikhan is 49 years old. He lives with his wife and son in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. For the past 20 years, non-stop, he has been running an auto service in his backyard. Batsaikhan has gained much experience in his job and has many permanent customers. 

Batsaikhan is requesting a loan to purchase necessary equipment to renovate his business as his service equipment is old and broken. He believes that his loan will positively influence his business and notably increase the number of his customers.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to improve his business

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en:
Khalid is a 35-year-old married man and has two children. He lives in Ibb, Yemen. He studied up to a Bachelor's degree in Ibb university then he looked for a job but unfortunately, he didn`t get it. So he has worked very hard for many years to get his family ahead and give them everything they deserve. He has a grocery store and that is his main source of income.

He started his business five years ago. His business was initially begun with limited capital that didn`t allow it to run well to get more profit. Then he was planning to develop his business so, he sold his own land which was located in his village and thus he opened a grocery.

His business is located in a very strategic area. Many people prefer his store because he always has the basic staples at accessible prices, and he provides the best possible customer service. His dream is to see his store flourish.

Due to the current bad situation in Yemen, he has less profit from his enterprise. So, he took a loan of 100,000 YER to stock his business with more products so that his customers will always find what they need and keep coming back.

In the future, Khalid would like to study for a Master's degree in his field of specialization and hopes to be able to get his family ahead and give them better opportunities in life.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods which will increase his profit.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is 44 years old and is married and a good mother of six children. She lives in Puntod, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. For the past 21 years, Fe has been operating a retail shop where she sells different kinds of food such as canned goods, biscuits, candies, and chocolates. Fe earns 10,000 PHP doing this type of business. She joined GDMPC in 2009.

Fe is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan from GDMPC to purchase additional stock to sell. In the future, she hopes to gain more profit and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
This is Analiza, 40, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. Her husband is Cipriano, a watch technician.  Analiza has her three children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to provide income for their everyday expenses.                             

Analiza operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries, and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a small amount of cooking oil, or an egg. Analiza earns by buying supplies at wholesale prices and selling them by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 23,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages, and other products to add in her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Analiza hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams of giving her family a good future through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets every week with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and other products for resale in her business.

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura is married and has six children. She is 47 years old and lives in the Philippines. 

Maura operates a business, making and selling pots to tourists and local community members to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years and every month she earns PHP 2,000 from this work. She has requested a loan of PHP 4,000 to purchase more equipment needed in making pots.

Recently, Maura joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Maura hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment needed in making pots.

loans.name: Naranchimeg

texts.en:
Naranchimeg, 30, works as a janitor in the public theater. She lives with her husband in Darkhan, the second largest city in Mongolia. Her monthly salary usually does not cover her necessities and she wants to start saving for her family.

Recently Naranchimeg decided to start a retail clothing business in the bazaar. She believes that the new business she starts will increase her earnings considerably. The loan she is taking will be dedicated to the purchase of some clothes for resale.

loans.use: To purchase some clothes for resale.

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
Karla Patricia de 33 años de edad, casada desde hace 13 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos entre 9  y 12 años de edad, vive en buenos aires, Santa Cruz de Yojoa.
Karla, genera sus propios ingresos para aportar al hogar, hace un año que se ha dedicado a vender productos Avon, como ser cosméticos, lociones, cremas, termos para agua y plásticos. Le dedica todo el tiempo necesario ya que sus ventas son de acuerdo a los pedidos del catalogo y entrega a domicilio.
El préstamo que ha solicitado le ayudara a comprar el producto que le han pedido sus clientes. Con este negocio ella obtiene sus buenas ganancias. Y la meta es aumentar cada vez mas sus ventas para tener mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Karla Patricia, age 33, has been married for 13 years.  She has three children between the ages of 9 and 12.  She lives in Buenos Aires, Santa Cruz de Yojoa.

Karla generates her own income in order to support the household.  A year ago she started selling Avon products like cosmetics, lotions, creams, water bottles, and plastics.  She devotes all of the time needed because her sales are in accordance with the catalog sales, and she delivers to homes.

The requested loan will help her buy the products that her customers have ordered.  She gets good income with this business.  The goal is to increase her sales each time and to have improved income.

loans.use: to buy Avon products like cosmetics, lotions, creams, water bottles, and plastic bowls.

location.town: Buenos Aires, Santa Cruz de Yojoa

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
This is Rosario, 66, a resident of Manila, Philippines. She is married to Venirando, her business partner, and a mother to her two children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Rosario operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most of the families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings where all of the family members are at home to take part in the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend cooking gas and food for one to two persons when buying cooked rice and viands costs less than raw food. Rosario's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of Php800 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 35,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more products like meat, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Rosario dreams of being able to give both her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and  also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw ingredients and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is a 31-year-old married woman with three children. Her husband is a fisherman.

Jacqueline runs a fishing business with her husband. She helps sell her husband’s catch at their town market. Jacqueline works hard to improve their business and take care of her children. She plans to use her loan to buy fishing nets and a lamp and to repair their fishing boat. This will help Jacqueline’s family continue earning from their business.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and a lamp and to repair their fishing boat.

loans.name: Honesto

texts.en:
This is Honesto, 40, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite City, Philippines. He is married to Jocelyn, his business partner and mother to their children. Honesto, together with his wife, manages their own household while operating a business. He works hard to sustain himself and continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Honesto operates a mini drug store business. What he basically does is buy generic medicines from the company, sell them piecemeal with a little profit. Products can range from vitamins to pain relievers and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options he offers.  His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting Php 20,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities and varieties of medicine products to expand his product inventory. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Honesto hopes that his business will continue to be successful. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for medicine items and products needed in his business.

loans.name: Winangun Sari Group

texts.en: To continue to run the business, the Winangun Sari group have a new loan. Three of the members resigned because in the last loan they had enough profit to continue the business by themselves and they give opportunity to other breeders to have loan to increase their business. They each plan to use their share of the loan to purchase a pair of large rabbits, which will breed. They hope they can be successful like the three other members and they can run the business with their own capital.

loans.use: to purchase a pair of large rabbits.

loans.name: Baba

texts.fr:
Monsieur  BABA a plus 36 ans est polygame et père de  7 enfants. Il réside avec ses trois femmes et leurs enfants dans dans la commune de Niena, région de Sikasso.
 Monsieur BABA, après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès notamment l’agriculture, s’est initié aux activités de stockage et commercialisation des  céréales (mil, maïs, riz, niébé, etc.), il y a environ 7 ans. Avec une telle expérience dans ce domaine, il jouit d’une forte réputation et accueille beaucoup de commandes de l’extérieur, mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ces besoins fait défaut. C’est donc dans le souci de mieux satisfaire cette clientèle de plus en plus croissante, que  BABA décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant 5 ans.
Il compte acheter avec ce nouveau prêt,  25 sacs de mil, 1 tonne de maïs et 15 sacs de fonio. 
Il s’approvisionne dans les village de: Finkolo Ganadougou, Farakala et Lobougoula, des localités environnantes de Sikasso. Les céréales ainsi acheté sont stockées dans son  magasin et  ses ventes se font en détail  et en gros, au consommateurs et revendeurs.    
 Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA par mois. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre l’essentielle de ses dépenses, celles de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Baba is over 36 years old, polygamous and the father of 7 children. He lives with his 3 wives and their children in the commune of Niena, in the Sikasso region.

Having tried several types of work - most notably in the agriculture sector - without success, 7 years ago Baba familiarized himself with the business of storing and reselling cereals (millet, corn, rice, black-eyed peas, etc.). Having so much experience in this line of work enables him to enjoy a strong reputation and he gets many orders from outside his area, but lacks the necessary resources to be able to satisfy demand. 5 years ago, because of his wish to better satisfy his growing customer base, he decided to join Soro Yiriwaso.

Baba will use this new loan to buy 25 sacs of millet, 1 ton of corn and 15 sacs of fonio (the smallest of the millet species). He gets his supplies in the villages of Finkolo Ganadougou, Farakala and Lobougoula, neighbouring communities in the Sikasso region. He stores the cereals he buys in his warehouse and sells his merchandise, either wholesale or retail, to resellers and consumers.

Thanks to this loan, Baba anticipates earning a monthly profit of 100 000 francs. He plans to use those profits to cover his essential expenditure and pay his household expenses, pay the interest on his loan and reinvest in his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es:
María de Jesús, tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera con un hijo de un año de edad, vive en el barrio Suyapa de Santa Cruz de yojoa.
Doña María ha buscado un medio de vida, de donde generar sus propios ingresos para cubrir sus necesidades básicas. Ella vende productos alimenticios arroz, frijoles, churros, productos enlatados, jugos, pan, lácteos, refrescos y otros. Hace dos años que comenzó con sus propios esfuerzos ahora tiene mas surtido. Atiende todo el día a sus clientes. Para mantener más surtido el negocio solicito este préstamo de L.7500.00 del cual comprara lácteos, frijoles, arroz, churros y refrescos.
La idea es continuar trabajando, incrementar el inventario para vender más y obtener ingresos que le ayuden al sostenimiento familiar.
texts.en:
María de Jesús, age 36, is a single mother, and she has a one year old child.  She lives in the Suyapa neighborhood of Santa Cruz, Yojoa.

María has looked for a means to generate her own income in order to cover her basic needs.  She sells food products like rice, beans, churros, canned goods, juices, bread, dairy products, soft drinks, and others.  She started two years ago through her own efforts.  She now has her business better stocked.  She takes care of her customers all day.  

In order to keep her business better stocked she is requesting this loan for 7,500 lempiras.  She will use the loan to buy dairy products, beans, rice, churros, and soft drinks.

Her aim is to continue working, to increase inventory in order to sell more, and to get income to help her support the family.

loans.use: to stock the business with food products like dairy products, rice, beans and soft drinks.

location.town: Barrio Suyapa, Santa Cruz de Yojoa

loans.name: Karya Murni Abadi Group

texts.en:
The Karya Murni Abadi group continues to borrow a loan to increase their business. One of the members resigned because in the last period she had enough profit to continue her business by her own capital. On the settlement day, one of the member couldn’t attend because of being sick and is represented by his wife.

I Putu, the head of the group, will use the loan to purchase piglets and feed. He keep pigs for pigroll. In his daily life as a farmer, he plant chillis and corn behind his house. He hopes the pig business can improve his life.

loans.use: To purchase two piglets.

loans.name: Miluna

texts.en:
Miluna is 30 years old, married, and has two children. She lives in the Philippines. Miluna makes and sells pots to tourists and local community members to earn a living. She has been in this business for three years and earns 2,000 PHP a month. 

Miluna is requesting a loan for 4,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more equipment needed in making pots. Recently, Miluna  joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Miluna hopes to improve and expand the business.

loans.use: to purchase more equipment needed in making pots.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Yar

texts.en:
Yar is a 28-year-old married woman with no children. She has had a business selling charcoal in Bor. South Sudan for four years.

Yar is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to build a house in future.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Abbas

texts.en:
Abbas is a 37-year-old married Lebanese man living with his wife and one child. He’s the one responsible for his family and is always searching for new ways to fulfill their needs. 

He has been working as a car mechanic from 1993 to the present. His wife has been working in a local hospital for nine years. Today, he needs to borrow $2700 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new equipment for his garage, such as a hammer, and many other items. 

He notes that this loan will help him increase his productivity and thus enhance his way of life. In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans to enlarge his garage.

loans.use: to purchase new car repair equipment, such as a hammer

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 23-year-old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and one child. She and her husband work together to try and improve their standard of living. Her husband has been serving in the Lebanese army for the past six years, and Fatmeh has been running her own home business as a hairdresser since 2006. Fatmeh's clients believe in her style and trust her. In parallel, she has been working as a private teacher in a local school since 2006. 

Today, she’s requesting a youth loan of $1,600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new hair tools for her business. She notes that this will increase her productivity and allow her to attract additional customers. In the future, she plans to open her own hairdressing salon.

loans.use: to purchase new hair tools for her business.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 27-year-old Lebanese married man. He’s living with his wife and one school-aged child. He’s the main income provider for his family and he takes care of them. Hussein opened his paint shop in 2006 where he sells all types of paints in addition to some industrial equipment. 

Today, he has the intention of borrowing a youth loan of $2,600 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase a quantity of paints and other supplies for his shop. In that way, he will be able to respond rapidly to his customers' demands and therefore get higher returns. 

In the future, he plans to work as a wholesaler and sell paints to the neighboring shops.

loans.use: to purchase paints and other supplies for his shop.

loans.name: Akram

texts.en:
Akram is a 21-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his three siblings who one of whom is working. He cooperates with them to be able to satisfy their needs. He has been working in the construction field since 2006. He works on a free-lance basis, specializing in floor cleaning. He’s sure that the more projects he can take, the higher his revenues will be. 

Today, he’s looking to take out a youth loan of $1,100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a pick-up truck for his business. This Kiva loan will help him transport his equipment much more easily and therefore develop his business. In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans and open his own brick shop.

loans.use: to purchase a pick-up truck for his business.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 28-year-old, single, Lebanese man. He lives with his parents and two working siblings. 

His father is the main income provider in the family and their only support. For this reason, Youssef decided to start his own business, hoping to take some of the responsibility off of his father. 
So, after being involved in the barbering business for 10 years, Youssef opened his own salon in 2009. Now he’s looking to expand his business further. 

Today, he’s requesting a youth loan of $1300 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, in order to change his salon’s interior design. He notes that this may help him attract more customers and therefore increase his revenues. 

In the future, he plans to enlarge his salon and hire people to work with him.

loans.use: to change his salon’s interior design

loans.name: Douaa

texts.en:
Douaa is an 18-year-old Lebanese woman.  She’s engaged and living with her parents and three siblings, two of whom are working.  Her father is working really hard to offer a suitable life for his family.  

Douaa started her own home business in 2008, where she sells hand made products such as crochet, in addition to some gadgets and many other items. In parallel, she has been working as a farmer since 2005. Today, she’s in need for a youth loan of $600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase added materials for her business in order to diversify her items, boost her sales and gain a new range of customers, which will surely increase her profits.  In the future, she plans to open her own hand made products shop.

loans.use: To purchase added materials for her business.

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en:
Fouad is a 23-year-old Lebanese single man, living with his parents and two siblings. His father is the main income provider in the family and seeks to offer them a fair way of living. In 2008, Fouad started to work in a local restaurant.  He really wants to study and achieve higher positions, and this is why he strives to work hard in order to earn a superior income. 

Today, he’s in need of a youth loan of $3,000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to cover his university fees. This Kiva loan will cover his educational fees until graduation.  In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans and pursue his Master’s degree.

loans.use: to cover his university fees.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en:
Hussein is a 25-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and three siblings, two of whom are working. His father is the one taking care of the family and covering their living costs. Hussein decided to start his own business as a blacksmith in 2009, after fifteen years of experience in this field. Now he has a fair number of customers asking for his services. 

Today, he’s in need of borrowing a youth loan of $1,600 from the Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase added products for his business, such as metal. This will help him continue his work in a proper way and respond rapidly to his customers’ demands. In the future, he plans to expand his business in order to earn a higher income.

loans.use: to purchase added products for his business, such as metal.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 24-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife. Like every couple, Ali and his wife wish to have their own family of children. For this reason, they combine forces to be able to cover the heavy life expenses. 

Ali opened his own butchery in 2005. He’s a reputable person and always searches to deliver good and fresh products. Today, he’s asking for a youth loan of $2100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy new tools and equipment for his butchery. In that way, he will be able to develop his business and augment his sales. In the future, he plans to raise cattle and start his own dairy products trading business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for his butchery.

loans.name: Fatmeh

texts.en:
Fatmeh is a 21-year-old married Lebanese woman living with her husband.  They both cooperate together to be able to fulfill their needs and demands.  She opened her own mini market in 2008.  As for her husband, he has been working in a local company for the past five years. 

Today, she’s looking to borrow a youth loan of $1,300 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase more groceries and food provisions for her mini market in order to increase her sales. In the future, she plans to open her own supermarket.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and food provisions for her mini market

loans.name: Leila

texts.en: Leila is a 55-year-old Lebanese married woman. She lives with her husband and her two children, who are still studying. She has been working in a local hospital since 1980. As for her husband, he’s an employee at one of the local companies, and they both cooperate together to be able to enhance their way of living. Today, she’s seeking to borrow $2,600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay her children’s university fees. She notes that education is really important, especially to know how to deal with life's difficulties and problems. In the future, she plans to take more Kiva loans and help them continue their education.

loans.use: to pay her children’s university fees.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 30-year-old Lebanese single man. He lives with his parents and one sibling. His father strives to work really hard in order to satisfy his family's needs. After fifteen years of experience as a carpenter, Ali decided to open his own carpentry in 2008. He’s a reputable person who has gained a fair number of loyal customers so far. 

Today, he is asking for a youth loan of $1,600 from Kiva partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase an electric saw and a quantity of wood needed for his work. He notes that this will boost his productivity and thus improve his business. In the future, he plans to take on bigger projects outside the country.

loans.use: to purchase an electric saw and a quantity of wood needed for his work.

loans.name: Akaut

texts.en:
Akaut is a 36-year-old married woman with four children; three of them are in school. She has had a business selling charcoal in Bor, South Sudan for three years.

Akout is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase charcoal. She will use her extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal for sale.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 25-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and only child.  He strives to work really hard to support his family. 

Mohammad decided to start his own business in 2010.  He sells dairy products in his hometown and local area.  

Today, he’s asking to borrow $1600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a minivan for his business, which will facilitate his transportation and enhance the way he delivers his products. 

In the future, Mohammad plans to have his own farm where he can raise cattle and increase his productivity.

loans.use: to purchase a minivan for his business.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 28 years old and a married woman with two children living in Hioma, Uganda. She owns a produce business which she has been running for seven years. She started as a shop attendant and later saved to start her own business buying and selling produce.

She faces a challenge of customers not paying on time but she hopes to educate her children. She also hopes to expand her business to new markets. Jane intends to use the loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.name: Eduardus

texts.en:
Eduardus is a 40-year-old widower who lives with his parents and two children, they are: Christine, 14 years old and studying at Junior High School grade 3; Leon, 8 years old and studying at Primary School grade 2. 

Eduardus has been running a photocopy business since 2006. He uses a former kiosk building to operate the business. In a day, Eduardus works for 12 hours from 7.00 am up to 7.00 pm. The income that he generates is used to fulfill the family needs and the educational needs of Christine and Leon. 

The increasing schooling expenses and household needs lead Eduardus to work hard. Recently, his photocopy machine is broken so Eduardus cannot operate the business. This situation obviously affects his income. Therefore, he needs capital assistance to repair the machine and to purchase paper and ink. He is requesting loan of IDR 10,000,000 from TLM. He hopes that TLM will disburse the loan soon.

loans.use: to repair the photocopy machine and to purchase paper and ink.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 29-year old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two children. In order to fulfill his family's financial needs, Ali works hard. 

He has been a taxi driver since 2000.  His job consists of transporting people from town to town upon requests.
