Today, he’s facing problems with his car, so he needs to borrow $2900 from kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to replace it with a new one.  In the future, ali plans to serve a wider range of people.

loans.use: to replace his old taxi with a new one.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: L'emprunteuse est une femme mariée, mère de deux enfants. Elle exerce depuis deux ans le commerce d'ustensules de cuisine.Elle s'approvisionne chez les grands commerçants de la capitale et vend à domicile à ses clients à travers les quartiers de sa localité.Ce commerce lui rapporte des revenus assez importants qui lui assurent ses propres besoins mais également lui permettent d'assister son mari dans la prise en charge des besoins familiaux. Elle sollicite un pret de 150000f auprès de UIMCEC pour acheter 7 douzaine de plateaux. Son ambition est d'élargir et de diversifier ses produits.
texts.en:
The borrower is a married woman and mother of 2 children. She has been selling kitchen utensils for the past 2 years. She gets her merchandise from the large traders in the capital and resells it door to door to her local customers. Her business yields her a relatively considerable income and enables her to take care of her own needs and also support her husband with the household expenses.

She is requesting a loan of 150 000 francs from UIMCEC so that she can buy 7 dozen trays. Her ambition is to expand and diversify her product range.

loans.use: to buy 7 dozen trays.

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en:
Hussein is a forty-nine-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and three children. Two of them are still studying and the other one is working. He’s the one responsible for paying his children’s eduation fees and satisfying his family needs. He has been working as a driver in a local company since 2000. He’s brave and capable of improving himself. 

Since he was not able to pay all his children's education fees, he is asking today for a loan of $2100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to pay the remainder. This will allow them to carry on their studies in a proper way. In the future, he plans to open his own business and let his children work on his behalf.

loans.use: to pay the remainder of his children's education fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase yarn for her weaving business.

loans.name: Kalidou

texts.fr:
Né en Juin 1983 à Sikasso, Monsieur  Kalidou  est un célibataire résidant dans une grande famille traditionnelle à Médine, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Kalidou  s’est initié il y’a deux ans à cette activité d’achat et de vente de téléphones portables et leurs accessoires (façade, batterie, chargeur, écouteur, etc.). Son activité est menée dans sa boutique située sur une route très connue, avec une clientèle composée de toutes les couches sociales. 
 Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Il décide d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant trois mois.
 Ainsi, il sollicite son premier crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter à Bamako, 10 DVD, 5 téléviseurs, 40 téléphones portables de marques différentes, 3 cartons de façade, une quinzaine de chargeurs, 20 paquets de carte mémoire, 15 cartons de batterie et 10 douzaines d’écouteur de différentes sortes.  
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 250 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Mr. Kalidou was born in June 1983 in Sikasso. He is single and lives in large traditional family in Médine, a working-class neighborhood in Sikasso (Third Administrative Region of the Republic of Mali).

Two years ago, he became familiar with the business of buying and selling mobile phones and accessories (covers, batteries, charger, earphones, etc).

He runs his business in his shop located along a busy road. His clientele comprises people from all social classes.

About three months ago, eager to better satisfy his ever-increasing clientele, he decided to join Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso.

He is now seeking his first loan to buy, in Bamako, ten DVD players, five TV sets, forty mobile phones (various brands), three boxes of covers, about fifteen chargers, twenty packs of memory cards, fifteen boxes of batteries, and ten dozen earphones (various kinds).

Thanks to this loan, he intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 250'000 (ca US$ 485), to be used to increase his working capital, help with the family expenses, and pay the loan interests.

loans.use: to buy DVD players, TV sets, mobile phones, covers, chargers, memory cards, batteries, and earphones

loans.name: Abdramane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Abdramane  est âgé de 34 ans, marié, père de quatre enfants et domicilié avec sa femme et ses enfants dans une famille nucléaire à Sikasso
Abdramane après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès, s’est initié à cette activité de stockage et commercialisation des céréales (maïs, mil, sorgho, fonio, arachide etc ) il y a maintenant sept ans. Il dispose d’un magasin. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décide de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant plus d’une année et avec qui il est à son quatrième prêt et les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.
Il compte avec ce quatrième prêt  acheter, 25 sacs de Maïs et 25 sacs de Mil en provenance des localités environnantes de Sikasso. Ses marchandises sont d’abord stockées dans son magasin afin d’êtres revendues à une clientèle composée des détaillants et des chefs de famille.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Mr. Abdramane, age 34, is married and the father of four children. He lives with his wife and children in a nuclear family in Sikasso.

After trying many businesses without success, he became familiar with stocking and commercializing cereals (corn, millet, sorghum, fonio, peanuts, etc) seven years ago. He has a shop. 

More than one year ago, eager to better satisfy an ever-increasing clientele, he decided to join Kiva's partner, the MFI Soro Yiriwaso, from which he is now seeking his fourth loan. Previous loans were repaid without problems.

He intends to use this fourth loan to buy 25 sacks of corn and 25 sacks of millet from villages in the surroundings of Sikasso. At first, his products are stored in his shop in order to be resold to a clientele comprising retailers and heads of family.

With this loan, he intends to turn an average monthly profit of XOF 150'000 (ca US$ 290), to be used mainly to help with the family expenses and pay the loan interests. He will invest the remainder in his business.

loans.use: to buy 25 sacks of corn and 25 sacks of millet

loans.name: Sarpohi

texts.en: Sarpohi is a 43-year-old Lebanese married woman who lives with her husband and three children. Two of the children are still studying and the other is working. Sarpohi cooperates with her husband in order to fulfill their needs. They are unified, depending on each other and grateful for what God has given them. Sarpohi has owned a lingerie and children's clothing shop for the past nine years. As for her husband, he has been working in a local company since 1987. Today, she wants to borrow $800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to enlarge her shop and buy added lingerie in order to earn more income. In the future, she plans to open new branches in different areas.

loans.use: to enlarge her shop and buy additional lingerie

loans.name: Hasan

texts.en: Hasan is a 25-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and only child. As the main provider of income in his family, Hasan is doing the best he can to better support his family. He has owned a mini-market since 2001. He has succeeded at work because he is especially welcoming and sociable. Today, he’s looking to borrow a youth loan of $1800 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy supplementary products and to increase his inventory of goods and provisions. In that way, he will expand his mini-market and therefore increase his sales. In the future, he plans to open his own supermarket.

loans.use: to buy supplementary products and to increase his inventory of goods and provisions.

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en: Nidal is a 30-year-old Lebanese man. He lives with his wife and only child, who is still attending school. He’s the one taking care of his family, so he is doing his best to enhance their way of living and cover the heavy costs of life. Nidal began his own business as a furniture painter in 2006, and he has twelve years of work experience in this field. He has gained different clients from different areas because of his good and well-organized work. Today, he’s seeking to borrow a youth loan of $2100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase new painting tools and brushes for his business. The supplies will enable him to take on more projects, thus earning a superior income. In the future, he plans to open his own furniture gallery.

loans.use: to purchase new painting tools and brushes for his business.

loans.name: Nabih

texts.en:
Nabih is a 25-year-old single Lebanese man. He lives with his parents and has two siblings who work. Nabih’s family cooperates to be able to live a comfortable life. 
Nabih has owned a cellphone and internet shop since 2009 and has more than a few ideas to develop his business. Today, he’s looking for a loan of $1,100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to buy more cellphones and computers for his shop. This loan will help him attract more customers and therefore increase his productivity. In the future, he plans to open a bigger shop to include added supplies.

loans.use: to buy cellphones and computers for his shop.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 21-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and four working siblings. His father is considered the main income provider in the family. Despite his young age, Mohammad started his own work in 2009. He has been working as a car mechanic for the past three years and has gained a fair number of customers asking for his services. 

Today, he’s in need of taking out a youth loan of $2500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy new mechanic's tools for his business in order to respond rapidly to his clients’ problems. He’s sure that acting properly is really essential to building a good career. In the future, he plans to expand his garage and serve more customers.

loans.use: to buy new mechanic's tools for his business.

loans.name: Zein El Abedin

texts.en:
Zein El Abedin is a 50-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife and five children.  Two of the children are studying and the others are working. He works very hard in order to collect money and build a good future for his children. 

He opened his own minimarket in 2009, where he sells sugar candies, chocolate, sweets and many other items. He understands how to select his products and serve his customers as well as he can. Today, he’s requesting a loan of $2100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy the needed quantity of groceries for his business in order to increase his sales and thus his profits. In the future, he plans to open his own supermarket.

loans.use: to buy the needed quantity of groceries for his business

loans.name: Razak

texts.en: Razak has operated a fruit and vegetable cart in Harlem, New York for the past two years. Razak is hardworking and determined to build his business and help his family. He even works a second job on the weekends at a Brooklyn diner. Razak’s goal is to continue saving money so that he and his wife can eventually upgrade to an actual food truck of their own where they can cook their native Middle Eastern cuisine and share it with the rest of Harlem. For now, Razak needs to fix his current food cart because it is falling apart and is too old for repairs. Razak, as an immigrant entrepreneur, had never taken out credit in the United States and therefore was unable to secure financing from a traditional lender.  Receiving a loan will help Razak purchase a new fruit cart.

loans.use: to purchase a new fruit cart.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is one of the proud owners of Swoop Miami, a free electric-powered taxi service operating in South Beach, Miami. The business earns income from advertisements that are placed on the top and back of each golf cart and offers free rides to tourists and business-goers to get from one side of Miami Beach to the other. 

The community of South Beach has responded favorably to Swoop Miami, impressed by the novelty of the service and the lack of environmental impact. Daniel is looking for a loan to help him build a website, purchase a VOIP calling system to handle the large amount of calls they receive per month, and to purchase a quick charger (which reduces the vehicle charging time). 

This business loan will be crucial for Daniel in order to continue running this practical and creative business that has been so beneficial for the tourism of Miami. In the future, Daniel hopes to continue to run a similar operation up and down the west coast of Florida. For more information, visit www.swoopmiami.com.

loans.use: to build a website, purchase a VOIP calling system, and purchase a vehicle quick charger

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame FATOUMATA a environ 25 ans et mère de cinq enfants, elle vit avec son époux et leurs enfants à Niena région de Sikasso.
Madame Fatoumata, après avoir mené plusieurs activités sans succès,  s’est initiée aux activités de stockage et commercialisation des céréales (mil, maïs, riz, etc.), il y a environ 4 ans. Elle jouit d’une forte réputation et accueille beaucoup de commandes. C’est donc dans le souci de satisfaire cette clientèle en nette croissance, qu’elle intégra Soro Yiriwaso il y a maintenant 3 ans. Tous les  prêts antérieurs ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elle compte acheter avec son nouveau prêt,  30 sacs de mil, 100 sacs de maïs, 5 et sacs de sorgho. 
Elle s’approvisionne dans les village de : Finkolo Ganadougou, Farakala et Niena. Les  céréales ainsi achetées sont stockées dans son  magasin à Niena. Les ventes se font en gros et en détail.    
 Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 120 000 FCFA par mois. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre les dépenses de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Fatoumata is around 25 years old and mother to five children. She lives with her husband and children in Niena in the region of Sikasso. Having had several unsuccessful activities, Fatoumata launched herself into stocking and selling cereals (millet, corn, rice, etc.) around four years ago. She enjoys a good reputation and gets a lot of orders. It is thus with a view to satisfying this ever-growing customer demand that she joined Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. All her previous loans have been repaid in full. 

With her new loan she is planning to buy: 30 sacks of millet, 100 sacks of corn and 5 sacks of sorghum. She gets her supplies in the villages of Finkolo Ganadougou, Farakala and Niena. The cereals she buys are stocked in her shop in Niena and she sells them wholesale and retail.

With this loan, she is expecting to make a monthly profit of 120,000FCFA. With these profits, she is planning to cover her family expenses and pay the interest on her loan; the rest will be invested in her activity.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Elsy Del Carmen

texts.es:
Elsy, vive con su esposo y tres hijos de 15, 18 y 21 años de edad, ella administra un comedor y tienda, la venta la realiza todos los días de 5:00am hasta que termina, este negocio lo tiene en el hospital nacional de la localidad, ahí mismo esta la tienda de productos comestibles.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de tubos, laminas, que serán utilizados para reparar el techo del negocio, con este préstamo podrá realizar la inversión y darle mantenimiento al negocio. 
Su objetivo con el préstamo es poder mejorar el techo del negocio, haciéndolo más seguro, tambien para el futuro quiere comprarse un terreno donde construir su propia casa.
texts.en:
Elsy lives with her husband and three children, ages 15, 18, and 21.  She manages a dining room and store.  She makes sales every day from 5:00 a.m. until she finishes.  She has her business in the national hospital of the community; the grocery store is right there.

Currently she is requesting a loan to buy pipes and sheets of metal that will be used to repair the roof of her business.  With this loan she will be able to make the investment and do the maintenance on her business.

Her goal with the loan is to be able to improve the roof of her business, making it more secure.  Also, in the future she wants to buy herself a plot of land to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy pipes and sheets of metal.

loans.name: Sonia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Sonia, tiene 32 años de edad, vive con su madre y tres hijos de 7, 10 y 14 años de edad, Sonia administra una tienda de productos de primera necesidad, está ubicada en la casa, no tiene un horario para atender a los clientes, la tiene desde hace 4 años.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de productos como arroz, frijoles, aceite, huevos y embutidos, esta compra le ayudara a Sonia a darle mayor variedad al negocio, con la ayuda del préstamo lograra realizar una mejor inversión.
El objetivo de ella es permanecer en el negocio, por eso busca las alternativas como este préstamo que le ayuden a continuar y fortalecer fuente de ingreso.
texts.en:
Sonia is 32 years old. She lives with her mother and three children who are 7, 10, and 14 years old. Sonia runs a store selling staples which is located in her house. She does not have a set schedule to assist her clients, and she has been doing this for four years.

Currently she is asking for a loan in order to buy products such as rice, beans, oil, eggs and sausages. This purchase will help Sonia to offer a better variety in her business. With the help of the loan she can make higher earnings.

Her objective is to remain in business, and this is why she is looking for alternatives such as this loan that will help to continue and strengthen her source of income.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, oil, eggs and sausages.

loans.name: Dayana Andrea

texts.es:
Dayana tiene 25 años de edad y vive con su familia en la comunidad de Santa Teresita, en la provincia de Cartago. La Ciudad de Cartago fue fundada en 1563 por el conquistador español Juan Vázquez de Coronado, fungió como capital de Costa Rica hasta 1823 y fue sede de la primera corte internacional permanente de la historia mundial, la Corte de Cartago. Su relieve montañoso está formado por dos cordilleras: la Central y la cordillera de Talamanca.

Dayana es una estudiante con muchas ganas de superarse y hace unos meses se le vienen presentando muchas dificultades para poder continuar con sus estudios, ya que desea obtener lo antes posible su titulo para tener la oportunidad de ejercer su carrera profesional y poder formarse su propio futuro.

Actualmente Dayana desea obtener un microcrédito por ¢250.000 (doscientos cincuenta mil colones), para logar pagar la matrícula de la universidad, comprar algunos de los libros que necesita para este cuatrimestre y ayudarse a pagar el transporte hacia su lugar académico. Además espera llegar a ser una gran profesional, para sacar adelante a su familia mejorando sus condiciones de vida y esto es lo que la motiva día con día a esforzarse mucho más. 

Dayana forma parte de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de El Sauce de Santa Teresita Turrialba, una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Este será su segundo crédito y dice que con el espera poder seguir creciendo y sacar su carrera adelante. También destaca que gracias a este tipo de organizaciones y medios facilitadores de crédito puede dedicar más tiempo a las actividades productivas.
texts.en:
Dayana, 25, lives with her family in the community of Santa Teresita in Cartago Province.  The city of Cartago was founded in 1563 by the Spanish conquistador Juan Vázquez de Coronado and it was Costa Rica’s capital until 1823 and seat of the first international court in history: The Cartago Court.  Its mountainous profile is formed by two mountain ranges: Central and Talamanca.

Dayana is a student who very much wants to improve herself who for the last few months has been facing many difficulties in order to continue with her studies.  She’d like to graduate as soon as possible in order to start practicing her profession and building her own future.

At present, Dayana would like to get a ¢250.000 (two-hundred fifty thousand colones) loan to pay her university tuition, buy some of the textbooks she needs quarterly and help pay her transportation costs to school.  She expects to become a great professional to support her family improving their living conditions.  This is her motivation to try much harder every day.

Dayana is part of the “El Sauce de Santa Teresita Turrialba” communal bank one of EDESA’s 150 social organizations in Costa Rica.  This will be her second loan and she says that she hopes with it to continue growing and move her career forward.  She also points out that thanks to this type of organizations and means of facilitating credit she can spend more time in productive activities.

loans.use: to pay tuition, buy textbooks and pay transportation costs.

loans.name: Seyni Marème

texts.fr:
Seyni Marème est un  homme marié de 44 ans qui vit sur  le terroir sénégalais. Il est père  de 4 enfants dont l’âge  varie entre 2 et 13 ans.
 Il  est employé  dans une société publique de la place depuis 1992. Parallèlement  il évolue dans le secteur du transport et gère un taxi depuis plus de 4 ans. Après ses études  il a choisi son métier de percepteur par passion a cause de son aspect lucratif. Il est sociétaire du guichet de l’U-IMCEC de la localité ou il habite  depuis  octobre 2011. Il sollicite un crédit de  350 000 frs prévu pour le renouvellement   du  moteur  de  son véhicule  qui est tombé en panne. Son objectif est d’améliorer ses revenus pour mieux prendre en charge les besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Seyni Marème is 44 years old, married and lives in Senegal. He is the father 4 of children aged between 2 and 13. He has been working for a local public corporation since 1992. He also has a side job working in the transportation sector, and has driven a taxi for 4 years. After his studies he chose to become a tax inspector because he loved the work and it was lucrative.

Seyni has been a member of his local UMICEC branch since October 2011. He is requesting a loan of 350 000 francs so that he can renew the engine of his car which has broken down. He aims to increase his revenue so that he can better take care of his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy a car engine.

loans.name: Sameer

texts.en:
Sameer is a 29 year-old married man and a father of two children who lives in Taiz,Yemen. He has completed secondary school only. He has been running his own little business, a restaurant, since 2009. It is the only main source of his income.

In the beginning, he was a chef in several restaurants, cooking different kinds of food. After collecting enough money and also with his father supporting him, he opened this restaurant. His business was located in the middle of town and he is looking to increase the range of products he offers to his customers so that it becomes more pleasant for them to eat and drink in his business, but when the revolution came up between government and citizens, people immigrated to their villages,  and his clients became less.

So, he took out a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more products such as tables, chairs, foods and soft drinks for his business. In the future, he plans to expand his business and offer better services for his clients so that he can improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase more tables, chairs, foods and soft drinks for his business.

loans.name: Al Ouma Lib 4,5 Groupe 2

texts.fr: Al  OUMA liberté4, 5 groupe 2 est un sous groupe qui est composé  de 13 membres qui adhèrent tous dans la meme association  lequel est un groupement national de solidarité. C’est un groupe mixte de 10 femmes et  3 hommes  regroupés dans le meme secteur d’activité de commerce divers. Elles sont représentées par madame Sokhna   qui représente la personne en écharpe noire   sur la photo. Elle s’active depuis plusieurs années dans le secteur du commerce et de la couture. Elle capitalise une expérience d e plus de 15 ans dans ses activités. Elle commence sa journée  a partir de 10 heures le matin pour rentrer chez elle aux environ de 19 heures. Elle sollicite un crédit dans le but de diversifier son commerce d’habits en y ajoutant des produits alimentaires. Son objectif est d’ouvrir des succursales de part et d’autres dans le capitale ou elle vit et exerce son activité.
texts.en:
Al Ouma Liberté 4,5 Group 2 is a sub-group of 13 members who belong to the same national solidarity association. It is a mixed group of 8 women and 4 men who all practice the same activity of small trade. 

Their representative is Mrs. Sokhna, the lady dressed in red and wrapped in a white scarf. She has been working in trade and sewing for many years with over 15 years of experience to her credit. Her work day starts at 10:00 AM and she comes home around 7:00 PM. 

She is seeking a loan to diversify her activity by adding the sale of food products. Her goal is to open branches around the capital where she lives and works.

loans.use: to buy food products for resale.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 30-year-old married man and a father of three children living in Taiz, Yemen. He has completed secondary school only.

Mohammed`s business is a grocery store that started nine years ago with limited capital and income. He has known how to attract customers through the service that he provides and the prices that he offers. His main customers are homemakers living in his neighborhood and the local community. So, he is working hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses. 

Being an ambitious man, he would like to expand his business to provide for his clients' needs and get more profit.  So, he took a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase grocery goods for his business.

In the future, he hopes to buy land so that he can build a house for settlement with his family.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items that supply his customers needs.

loans.name: Al Ouma Liberé4,5 Groupe 1

texts.fr: Al Ouma liberé4,5 groupe 1est  est un sous groupe qui est composé  de 13 membres qui adhèrent tous dans la meme association  lequel est un groupement national de solidarité. C’est un groupe mixte de 12 femmes et un homme regroupés dans le meme secteur d’activité de commerce divers. Elles sont représentées par madame Oulimata    qui représente la personne habillée en jaune-orange sur la photo. Elle s’active depuis plusieurs années dans le secteur du commerce et de la couture. Elle capitalise une expérience d e plus de 10 ans dans ses activités. Elle commence sa journée  a partir de 10 heures le matin pour rentrer chez elle aux environ de 18 heures. Elle sollicite un crédit dans le but de diversifier les habits qu’elle commercialise. Son objectif est d’élargir son activité en  augmentant  son champ d’exposition.
texts.en: Al Ouma Liberé 4,5 group 1 is a subgroup which is made up of 13 members who have all joined the same national solidarity association. This is a mixed group, composed of twelve women and one man who are all involved in various trades.  Oulimata, the facilitator of the group, is the person dressed in yellow in the photo. She has been involved in trading and sewing for several years and has built up a ten-year experience in those fields.  She begins her day at 10 o'clock in the morning and returns home at around 6 o'clock in the evening.  She is requesting a loan in order to diversify the selection of clothes she sells.  Her goal is to expand her activity by being more visible on the market.

loans.use: to buy and make clothes for sale

loans.name: Pshtiwan

texts.en:
Pshtiwan is a 27-year-old Iraqi man. He is married and is a father of two children.

For the past two years, Pshtiwan has been supporting his family by running his own auto repair shop where he also works as the mechanic. His shop is performing smaller but highly demanded jobs such as oil changes, oil filter changes and assistance with managing the engine cooler systems during the cold winter months. 

Pshtiwan would like to renew his shop to be able to do larger jobs as well and meet the demands of his clients. He took a loan from Relief International - Iraq in the amount of $2100 to improve the shop. He hopes to generate a 10 to 12 percent increase in sales after the improvements and introduction of new services. 

Pshtiwan is under 30 and qualifies for a 'youth loan'

loans.use: to renovate his car repair shop

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 26-year-old single man and lives in Taiz,Yemen. He sells cell phones, accessories, compact discs, music players and cell phone chargers in a commercial center. He translated his experience into starting his own business in the town where he and his family live. 

He began by working in the business with a friend in Sana`a city and, once he gained experience, he started his own business in a location very close to his family using, as working capital, his savings from the earlier job. Initially he began by selling clock accessories and then gradually added other items as his customers requested them. Thus he has earned a profit and he hopes to continue expanding his working capital, which often is insufficient to meet the demand of his clients. This is exactly the reason he has come to AMB requesting a youth loan of 80,000 YER. He will use it to buy music players and computer accessories, among other items that customers have ordered. 

In the future, Mohammed hopes to rent another shop and make it an electronics shop.

loans.use: to buy music players and computer accessories, among other items that customers have ordered.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan  is a 23-year-old married man and is the father of one  child only. He lives in Ibb.  His business is tire repair and oil change and he has employed two persons in his shop. It is the only income source for his little family. 

He was a worker in a workshop   therefore he was able to save up money, and  then he rented a shop on a main road in the city where he sells tires and provides tire repair services. He says that his shop is the primary means he has to give his family everything they need for a dignified life without hardship.

Due to the bad situation in Yemen, his business is closed and he doesn`t have money to purchase oil and tires, etc. Hassan requests a youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB to purchase tires, tubes, oil and other items necessary to run the tire shop, as he is always busy with many orders and jobs.

In the future, he plans to rent another shop and open a car workshop.

loans.use: to purchase tires, tubes, oil and other items necessary for his business.

loans.name: Fousseny

texts.fr:
Monsieur Fousseny est né vers 1964 à Niena, polygame et père de huit enfants, il réside avec ses femmes et leurs enfants à Niena, village situé à environ 75 km de la ville de Sikasso (3eme  région de administrative de la république du Mali).
 Monsieur Fousseny fait le boucher il y’a plus de 20 ans. Grâce à son expérience, il jouit d’une forte réputation, mais les ressources nécessaires pour satisfaire ses besoins fait défaut. Ainsi, il intégra Soro Yiriwaso depuis 2 ans. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire cette clientèle de plus en plus croissante,  Fousseny a sollicité ce  nouveau prêt,  pour acheter, 1 bœuf   et 5 moutons, qui seront abattus et les chairs vendues. 
Il s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants de Niena ainsi qu’au marché même du village de Niena. Ses ventes se font en détail  et généralement au comptant.    
 Avec ce prêt, il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA par mois. Avec ces bénéfices réalisés, il compte résoudre les dépenses de sa famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Fousseny was born around 1964 in Niena. He is polygamous and is father to eight children. He lives with his wives and their children in Niena, a village which lies 75km from the town of Sikasso (the Republic of Mali's third administrative region).

Fousseny has been a butcher for more than 20 years. Thanks to his experience, he enjoys a good reputation but lacks the necessary resources to satisfy his needs. As a result he joined Soro Yiriwaso two years ago. With a view to satisfying his ever-increasing customer demand more readily, Fousseny has requested this new loan to buy one ox and five sheep, which will be slaughtered and the meat subsequently sold. He gets his supplies in Niena's surrounding villages and also at the market itself in Niena. He sells his meat on a retail basis and generally for cash..

With this loan, he is expecting to make a monthly profit of 75,000FCFA. With these profits, he is planning to cover his family expenses and pay the interest on his loan; the rest will be invested in his business.

loans.use: To buy oxen and sheep

loans.name: Harez

texts.en:
Harez is a 27-year-old Iraqi woman. She is married and has two children.

Harez has a beauty salon, and female customers are pleased to frequently return to her shop. In the past three years, Harez has been able to build a nice clientele and is able to contribute well to her family's income. 

She would now like to make some improvements to her shop by adding some more furniture, especially chairs, and replacing the washing basins and sinks used on a daily basis. 

Harez took a loan of $1800 from Relief International - Iraq for the improvement work.  

Since Harez is under 30, she qualifies for a "youth" loan.

loans.use: to buy furniture and also replace the washing basins and sinks in her beauty salon.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a special metal-cutter machine

loans.name: Nuñez Group

texts.es:
El Grupo solidario Núñez esta formados por 2 emprendedoras que se unieron para salir adelante con sus negocios ambas se apoyan motivándose para crecer en el negocio. 

Este grupo ya ha tenido crédito con Fundación León 2000, lo cual han demostrado ser responsable y con deseo de superación. 

Maria es una de las integrantes del grupo en el cual está solicitando crédito para invertir en el negocio en la compra de granos básicos, verduras, carnes, pollos, frutas para la elaboración de refrescos entre otros.
texts.en:
The Núñez Solidarity Group consists of two entrepreneurs who came together to get ahead with their businesses, both of them supporting and motivating each other to grow in the business.

This group has had a loan through Fundación Leon 2000 and they have demonstrated they are trustworthy and have the desire of self-improvement.

Maria is one of the members of the group that is asking for a loan in order to invest in her business in the purchase of basic grains, vegetables, meats, chickens, and fruits in order to make drinks and other items.

loans.use: to purchase basic grains, vegetables, meats, chicken, fruits, and other supplies.

loans.name: Jantetelco Group

texts.es:
Las nuevas integrantes del grupo son la señora Cliseria va a compra con su prestamo zapatos, la señora Angelina va a comprar Topperware, la señora Elia va a comprar tela, pinturas. 

La señora Cliseria tiene 75 años de edad,ella es soltera, ella tiene 1 hija mayor que trabja de secretaria, ella vende zapatos por catalogo, ella solicito su préstamo para comprar zapatos de dama, caballero y niños, botas, zapatillas para surtir sus pedidos, ella inicio su negocio hace 3 años su hija le enseño y le dio dinero para comprar los zapatos y surtir sus primeros pedidos, su negocio es ambulante sale a las colonias de su comunidad a ofrecer sus productos, su negocio es importante porque va obteniendo ganancias y le sirve de distracción, a ella le gusta cuando le hacen pedidos y se los pagan al contado, de la venta de zapatos se hizo unos cuartitos, ella utiliza las ganancias para volver a comprar los zapatos, ella está contenta con este préstamo porque va a recibir dinero para comprar zapatos y así crecer su negocio, sus sueños y esperanzas son arreglar sus cuartos ponerles piso y aplanarlos para sus nietos. 

Las integrantes del grupo le quieren decir a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “les damos las gracias por sus créditos ya que nos sirve para invertir en los negocios”.
texts.en:
The new group members are Cliseria who will use the loan to buy shoes; Angelina who will buy Tupperware; Elia who will buy fabric and paint.

Cliseria, 75, is single.  She has an adult daughter who works as a secretary.  She sells shoes via catalogue.  She requested the loan to buy women’s, men’s and children’s shoes, boots and sandals to fill her orders.  She started the business three years ago; her daughter taught her how and gave her money to buy shoes to fill her first orders.  Her business is itinerant.  She goes out to neighborhoods in her community to offer her products.  Her business is important because she earns profits and keeps her occupied.  She is happy when she gets orders and they are paid for in cash.  From the shoe sales she was able to build some rooms.  She uses the profits to buy more shoes.  She’s happy with this loan because she’s going to receive money to buy shoes and grow her business.  Her dreams and hopes are to fix up the rooms and install floors in them and flatten them out for her grandchildren.

The group members would like to say to Kiva and to Fundación Realidad: “We thank you for your loans because they make it possible for us to invest in our businesses.”

loans.use: to buy shoes.

loans.name: Ramiro

texts.es:
Ramiro tiene 32 años de edad, es casado, tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 4 años de edad los cuales estudian, el vive con su familia en el Milagro, Santa Cruz de Yojoa.
Ramiro se dedica  a su propio  negocio de pulpería, el cual pudo establecer con fondos propios hace 7 años, y vende frijoles, arroz, harina, manteca, papel, etc. De las ganancias que le genera el negocio las reinvierte surtiendo de mas producto.  Le dedica 4 horas diarias, en el resto del día le ayuda su esposa atender a sus clientes.
El esta solicitando un préstamo de 10, 000 lempiras para la compra de producto como ser, harina, manteca, arroz, frijoles, papel, etc., con esta inversión obtendrá mas ganancias y  podrá suplir las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Ramiro is 32 years old, married, and has two children (ages 13 and 4) who are studying. He lives with his family in Milagro, Santa Cruz de Yojoa.

Ramiro manages a grocery store that he established seven years ago with his own funds. He sells beans, rice, flour, lard, paper, and other products. With the income he generates from this business, he reinvests in more products for his inventory. He spends four hours a day at his business and his wife attends to the customers during the remainder of the day.

Ramiro is requesting a loan of 10,000 HNL in order to buy products such as flour, lard, rice, beans, paper, and other items. With this investment, he will obtain more income and be able to provide for the needs of his family.

loans.use: to buy flour, lard, rice, beans, paper, and other items.

location.town: El Milagro, Santa Cruz de Yojoa

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en: Jessie is a fifty-three-year-old married woman who lives in Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Jessie used her last loan to purchase additional ingredients for fruit salad. Her business expanded and become successful. Now she's taking a new loan to purchase additional ingredients she needs to make fruit salad. She hopes to be able to expand her business even more.

loans.use: to purchase the additional ingredients she needs to make fruit salad.

loans.name: Ludmir

texts.es: Ludmir, es un hombre trabajador, amable y emprendedor, esta casado con Liz de 34 años con quien tiene dos menores hijos, Perla de 8 y Yadira de 5 años. Ellos son su motor y motivo para seguir trabajando. Desde muy temprano, compra los productos, en este caso  verdurass, que sean frescas para luego ofrecerlos en su puesto a sus clientes. Su puesto de venta se encuetnra en un pequeño mercado cerda de su casa. Entre los productos que ofrece son el culantro, apio, zapallo ajíes, nabo y toda clase de verduras asimismo vende plátanos. Lleva realizando este trabajo por 10 años y lo hace solo, aunque a veces le resulta un poco agotador, pero sabe que es gratificante al ver sus ganancias. Espera seguir trabajando y crecer poco a poco ya que desea seguir brindando mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Este será el décimo préstamo con la institución MFP, siempre se caracterizó dentro de su grupo como una persona muy puntual, está feliz por la oportunidad que le darán para poder realizar una buena inversión, además esta seguro de poder seguir cancelando sus cuotas a tiempo como lo hizo hasta ahora. Con el monto solicitado de 3000 soles lo invertirá para ir a las chacras en busca de productos de manera directa y a un menor costo, además de pagar el transporte.
texts.en:
Ludmir is a hardworking, enterprising, and friendly man. He is married to 34-year old Liz and they have two young children, Perla aged 8 and Yadira aged 5. They are what motivate him to work hard.  Starting early in the morning Ludmir goes off to buy vegetables while they are fresh and then sells them to his customers from his stall which is located in a small market near his home. He sells cilantro, celery, pumpkin, chilies, turnips, as well as lots of other vegetables and bananas. 

Ludmir has been doing this work for ten years. He works alone although from time to time he gets somewhat tired; however he knows it is always good to see the income he brings in. He hopes to continue with this work and gradually grow the business as he wishes to provide a better standard of living for his family.

This will be Ludmir’s tenth loan with MFP. He has always been known in his group as a punctual person. He is happy to have this opportunity to be able to invest in his business and is sure that he will continue making the repayments on time, just as he has always done. 

Ludmir will use the S/.3,000 loan to travel out to farms in search of fresh produce at cheaper prices and to pay for transportation.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables direct from farmers

loans.name: Banyo

texts.en: Banyo is 42 years old and lives in the town of Barnesville. She is married and her husband works in construction. They have five children who range in age from 6 to 25 years old. All of her children are still in school and living at home. For the last four years, Banyo has earned a living by selling rice, oil, and other items in a local market. She is applying for this loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. Her goal is to increase her profits so that she can build a home for her family to live in.

loans.use: to buy more food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Jacqueline Lissette

texts.es:
Jacqueline, vive con su familia, su esposo, un hijo, una hermana, todos en una misma vivienda, ella administra un comedor, este inicio por el apoyo que una amiga le brindo, para que iniciara en el mercado municipal, ya posee varios clientes, tiene estable el negocio y cuenta con experiencia.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de material para elaborar la comida, como carnes, pollo, aceite, frijoles, gaseosas, condimentos, esta compra le ayudara para mejorar la disponibilidad en el negocio, para seguir produciendo los mejores platillos.
El objetivo de Jacquelin es tener un mejor apogeo con el negocio, crecer y mejorar los ingresos para la familia.
texts.en:
Jacqueline lives with her family--her husband, her son, and a sister--all in the same house. She manages a diner at the municipal market that she started with the help of a friend. Jacqueline already has several customers, a stable business, and experience.

She is requesting a loan to purchase the ingredients for preparing her dishes such as meat, chicken, oil, beans, sodas, and condiments. This purchase will improve the availability of supplies at her disposal so that she can continue producing better dishes.

Jacqueline’s goals are to take her business to a new level, grow, and improve the income of her family.

loans.use: to buy meat, chicken, oil, beans, sodas, and condiments.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es: El  señor Gregorio es una persona emprendedora  y  muy trabajadora,  nos  comenta  que   anteriormente  trabajaba  en  un  puesto  de  hot-dogs y  gracias  a su   empeño  y perseverancia  para   salir  adelante  día  con día   decidió  iniciar  su   propio  negocio ,  además   de  vender  su producto los fines  de  semanas,  el  se  dedica  a  brindar  sus  servicios en  fiestas y  esto  le  permite  generar  mayores  ingresos , en este  momento  requiere  realizar  la  compra  de materia   prima  para   su negocio ,  ve  en  el crédito la  posibilidad  de   hacerlo  crecer    por lo  que  se  encuentra  muy contento.
texts.en: Señor Gregorio is an enterprising and very hard-working person.  He tells us that he used to work at a hot dog stand and thanks to his determination and perseverance to get ahead every day, he decided to start his own business.  In addition to selling his products on the weekends, he works parties as this allows him to generate more income.  Right now he needs to buy raw materials for his business.  He sees the possibilities of growing his business with the loan and this makes him very happy.

loans.use: purchase raw materials for his hot dog stand.

loans.name: Nuevo Florecer (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Nuevo Florecer está formado por 5 socias y 3 socios, quienes se caracterizan por ser personas de un gran carisma, laboran en diferentes actividades económicas las mismas que le permiten aportar a la economía de sus hogares y salir adelante con sus familias. Viven en diferentes lugares de la ciudad de Cuenca, desde Diciembre de 1999 es Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, esta ciudad es una mezcla de lo colonial y lo moderno, su gente mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, esta ciudad tiene gente amable, gentil y carismáticas.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Martha, vive por el sector de Balzay en la ciudad de Cuenca, tiene 29 años, es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 14 y 12 años de edad que estudian en colegio y escuela. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.

La Señora. Martha labora como empleada privada actividad que la desempeña hace 3 años y trabaja de lunes a sábados, en su tiempo libre también se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa y su mercadería la vende recorriendo la ciudad. 

Es socia del banco comunal hace 2 años y su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de ropa para tener una mayor variedad para su clientela.
 
Su meta es tener un vehículo.
texts.en:
The communal bank Nuevo Florecer is made up of 5 women and 3 men who are known for being very charismatic.  They work at different activities that allow them to financially support their households and provide for their families.  They live in different places in the city of Cuenca.  This city is a mix of colonial and modern and has been a World Heritage Site since December of 1999.  Its people are friendly, courteous and charismatic and maintain their culture and traditions.  

One of the members of the group is Señora Martha.  She lives in the Balzay sector in the city of Cuenca.  She is 29 years old and a single mother of 2 children ages 14 and 12 who attend school.  She doesn't have her own house so she rents.  Señora Martha has been privately employed for 3 years and works Monday through Saturday.  In her free time she also sells all types of clothing as a street vendor.  She has been a member of the communal bank for 2 years.  With this new loan she will buy clothing so she can have greater variety for her customers.  He goal is to have a vehicle.

loans.use: purchase clothing.

loans.name: Tserenchimed

texts.en:
Mrs. Tserenchimed, 34, works as a janitor in a company. She has been doing her job for many years and lives with her family in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her husband Boldkhurel runs a taxi in the city and has many permanent customers. The family's main income comes from her husband’s business earnings. 

Lately her husband’s taxi has deteriorated and has damage to its core parts. Recently the car's engine broke and he has not been able to repair it. As a result, he has not been able to work in his taxi business for over a month. 

Mrs. Tserenchimed is taking out a loan to purchase the necessary spare parts for her husband's broken taxi car.

loans.use: To purchase the necessary spare parts for her husband’s broken taxi car.

loans.name: Reginah

texts.en:
Reginah is a forty-one-year-old woman. She is married and is the mother of four children. For the past four years, she has been running a clothes shop in Makueni, and earns a monthly income of fifteen thousand shillings.

This will be Reginah’s second loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to purchase more stock of clothes to sell in her shop. 

She wants to use the profit she will get to educate her children. In future she wants to expand her clothes shop into a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Blancia Julia

texts.es: Blanca Julia es una emprendedora que desde hace tiempo viene trabajando con Fundación León 2000, lo cual con el crédito otorgado anteriormente ella invirtió todo en el negocio en la compra de capital trabajo. Su negocio lo emprende desde hace mucho tiempo, este surge de la necesidad de generar ingresos a la familia. Actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para comprar capital trabajo leña, maiz, cal, entre otros productos.
texts.en: Blanca Julia is an entrepreneur who has been working with Fundación León 2000 for some time now. Her previous loan she invested entirely in the business by purchasing working capital. She took up her business a long time ago out of the necessity of generating income for the family. Currently she is seeking financing in order to purchase working capital for the business, such as firewood, corn, lime, etc.

loans.use: to purchase working capital for the business, such as firewood, corn, lime, etc.

loans.name: Valeriana

texts.es:
La socia se sigue dedicando al negocio de venta de leche y venta de queso,ella tiene vacas y tambien estas vacas los hace crecer y engordar y luego los vende en las distintas ferias,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender la leche y los quesos.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar leche y quesos y tambien alimentos para las vacas.
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member continues in her business of selling milk and cheese. She has cows, some of which are raised and fattened for eventual sale at different fairs. Through this business, the member is able to get ahead on behalf of her children. Her dream is to have a shop where she can sell milk and cheese.

The member is requesting a loan to buy milk and cheeses, as well as feed for her cows. She is happy with the loan and promises to complete the payments.

loans.use: to buy feed for her cows and milk and cheeses to sell.

loans.name: Lupita

texts.es:
Lupita, de 42 años, es una mujer dinámica y muy entusiasta. Convive con Edgardo de 43 años quien es su compañero durante mucho tiempo, ellos son padres de dos menores hijos, Edgardo de 14 y Rubí de 5, ella junto a su familia vive en su casa propia desde donde a diario trabaja mucho para poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Todos los días Lupita se dirige a la casa de sus amigos, vecinos y familiares en busca de colocar alguna de las diferentes prendas de vestir que tiene en venta. Cuando los clientes se ganan su confianza los deja en crédito y va a cobrar diario, semanal o en algunos casos quincenal. Lleva realizando su trabajo por siete años y lo realiza sola ya que no necesita de otra persona para poder realizarlo.
Le gusta mucho lo que hace ya que le permite tener tiempo para poder trabajar en una institución del estado en donde cumple una función muy importante, además la venta de ropa le significa una entrada adicional para su economía y así puede dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia. Desea seguir trabajando pues su fin es tener una boutique o un local comercial en donde ofrecer sus productos. Este será el crédito número 15 con MFP, esta muy contenta de saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero para poder continuar aumentando su capital de trabajo. Además está convencida que seguirá siendo la socia buena y responsable de los créditos obtenidos anteriormente. Le gusta pertenecer al banco comunal al que trabaja ya que todos son responsables y muy solidarios entre si. Con el monto solicitado 1000 soles, comprará ropa y algunas otras mercaderías para seguir ofreciendo nuevos diseños y modelos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
42-year old Lupita is a dynamic, very enthusiastic woman. She lives with 43-year old Edgardo who has been her partner for a long time. They have two children, Edgardo aged 14 and Rubi aged 5. They live in their own house. 

Lupita works hard every day to provide her family with a better quality of life. She goes to the houses of her friends, neighbours, and relatives to show them the different items of clothing she has for sale. When her customers have won her trust, she lets them buy the items on credit. They make the repayments either daily, weekly, or in some cases every two weeks. Lupita has been doing this work for seven years; she works alone as there is no need for another person to help her.

She really enjoys the work as it allows her enough time to be able to work in a state institution where she has a very important role. Selling clothing provides additional income so she can provide a better standard of living for her family.

Ludmila wishes to continue this work but her goal is to have a shop or small business from which to sell her products. This will be her 15th loan with MFP, and she is very happy to know that this financial assistance is available to enable her to expand her business. She is positive that she will continue to be a good and responsible member as she has been with her past loans. She enjoys being part of the community bank as all the members are responsible, committed people. With the S/. 1,000 loan, she will buy clothing and other merchandise so she can continue offering new designs and styles to her customers.

loans.use: to buy clothing and accessories to sell to her customers

loans.name: Yassah

texts.en: Yassah is 38 years old and lives in the town of Barnesville. She is married and her husband works for an NGO. They have four children who range in age from 6 to 16 years. All of her children are in school and live at home. For the last 20 years, she has earned a living by selling rice, oil, pepper, onions and other food items in a local market. She started this business with money earned by her husband and is applying for this loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. Her goal is to build a house for her family to live in.

loans.use: to buy more food items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en:
Elvira is 58 years old and lives in the town of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines with her three children. She earns a living by running a variety store where she sells items such as shampoo, cooking oil and various food items. She earns about PHP 500 a day and is applying for a loan for PHP 13,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. Her goal is to give her family a better future. She faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her work and study religion.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who study religion, build social capital and repay loans.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Munkh-Erdene

texts.en:
Mr. Munkh-Erdene, 32, owns a cow farm with his family. His farm has fifteen red cows which have a high milk-yield. He sells them at a high price to other farms or herders. He has been running his farm since 2009, and started working as a farmer in his childhood. 

He and his family want to expand their firm by setting up a new business based on dairy sales. He plans to sell milk to people who sell at the food market in the cities. In order to produce milk in his farm, he needs a cream-separator. This is quite expensive so he needs to take a loan of MNT 2,000,000 to cover the cost of purchasing the cream-separator machine.

loans.use: To cover the cost of purchasing a cream-separator machine.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
This is Marilyn, 41, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. Her husband is Bienvenido, her business partner, and father to her six children. Together with her husband, she manages the household while operating her business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.                             

Marilyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Marilyn hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and other products to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
This is Estelita, 36, resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. Her husband is Paquito, her business partner, and father to her three children. Together with her husband, she manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.                             

Estelita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She makes money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Estelita hopes to be able to expand soon, just as she dreams to be able to give her family a good future through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products to sell in her store.

loans.name: Jowelyn

texts.en:
Jowelyn is 24 years old and lives in Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines with her husband and their one child. She earns a living by running a convenience store where neighbors come to buy items they use every day such as food or shampoo. She earns about PHP 500 a day. She is applying for a loan for PHP 12,000 to buy more items to sell to her customers. Her goal is to improve her family's living standards. Jowelyn faithfully meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and study religion.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 partners who gather to study religion, build social capital and repay loans.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for timber.

loans.name: Takku Liguey 2 Kahone Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "Takku Liguey 2 Kahone" est un groupe de solidarité  qui se compose de cinq femmes, toutes mariées.Elles se cotisent chaque mois et remettent le montant à l'une d'elle après tirage au sort , pour la soutenir dans ses activités. Elles mènent un commerce de tissus et de produits de mercerie.Elles s'approvisionnent dans un pays limitrophe et vendent les produits à domicile et à crédit. Les revenus générés par leur commerce leur permettent de se prendre en charge et de soutenir leurs maris dans les dépenses d'entretien de leurs familles respectives.Le chef du groupe( en robe noir), est mère de trois enfants. Elle vend des tissus "wax" et "ganila" depusi près de trois ans. Elle prend en charge avec ses bénéfices les frais de scolarité ainsi que les dépenses de santé de ses deux filles qui sont à l'école primaire. Le groupe, pour renforcer son fonds de commerce, sollicite auprès de l'UIMCEC, un pret de 500000f afin d'acheter des tissus et des produits de mercerie.
texts.en:
Takku Liguey 2 Kahone Group is made up of five women, who are all married. Every month, they club together and give the money to one of them, determined by drawing of lots, in order to support her with her business.

Their businesses consist in selling fabrics and notions. They get their supplies from a neighboring country, and sells their products at home and on credit.

The income drawn from their businesses enables them to provide for themselves, and help their husbands with the daily expenses of their respective families.

The leader of the group, wearing a dark dress in the photograph, is the mother of three children. For almost three years, she's been selling "wax" and "ganila" fabrics.

With her profits, she takes care of the healthcare and school expenses of her two daughters, who attend elementary school.

In order to bolster their working capital, the members of the group are seeking a loan of XOF 500'000 from Kiva's partner, UIMCEC, in order to purchase fabrics and notions.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and notions

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: La socia continua con su negocio de compra y venta de “Churros”, los churros los hace a base de mantequilla harina y otros ingredientes los cuales lo rellena con manjar o miel; la socia le espolvorea azucar impalpable sobre el churro y listo. La socia en esta ocasión desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de insumos e ingredientes para la elaboracion de los churros y venderlos calientitos, ella desea continuar con su negocio y ahorrar para ampliar el negocio.
texts.en:
This member continues with her business of buying and selling “churros” (strips of fried pastry) that are made from butter, flour, and other ingredients. The churros are filled with caramel sauce or honey. She sprinkles powdered sugar on the churros when they are ready to be served.

On this occasion, the member wants to invest her loan in the purchase of supplies and ingredients for making churros and selling them hot. She wants to continue with her business and save toward expanding her venture.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and supplies.

loans.name: Odalis

texts.es: Odalis, de 31 años, es una mujer emprendedora y muy responsable. Convive con su pareja Richard de 39 años y con quien tiene dos menores hijos Yeni de 12 y Richard de 6 años. Juntos habitan en su casa propia. El trabajo de Odalis consiste en la compra y venta de vehículos, a diario abre su negocio que esta ubicado en su casa y ahí espera a que vengan los clientes o sale a buscarlos. Al momento de realizar la transacción de los vehículos siempre esta muy al pendiente que tenga todos los documentos en regla y puedan estar en buen funcionamiento ya que no quiere tener problemas mas adelante con sus compradores. Lleva realizando éste negocio por 4 años y lo hace a lado de su pareja. Le gusta lo que hace ya que le permite tener buenos ingresos, a veces saca un porcentaje alto de las ventas, pero algunas veces solo gana para solventarse durante el día. Espera seguir trabajando y crecer poco a poco, y mas adelante montar una tienda de venta de vehículos nuevos. Este será el crédito número 5 con la institución MFP, por tanto espera de su colaboración, para continuar con sus objetivos. Además esta muy decidida a cumplir con sus pagos como lo hizo hasta hora en sus créditos anteriores. Con el monto solicitado 2500 soles, comprará más vehículos para continuar con su negocio y tener mayor variedad de marcas y modelos que ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Odalis is 31 years old and is a very enterprising and responsible woman.  She lives with her partner, 39 year old Richard, with whom she has had two children, 12 year old Yeni and 6 year old Richard.  They live together in a home of their own.  Odalis buys and sells vehicles from her home and opens her business daily.  She either waits for her customers to visit her or goes out to seek them.  She always makes sure that she has all the necessary documents when making a vehicle transaction and that the vehicles are in good order so that she will not have problems with her buyers in the future.

She’s been running this business for four years, alongside her partner.  She likes the fact that it provides a good income.  Sometimes she makes a good profit from the sale, but sometimes she only makes enough to get her through the day.

She expects to continue working and growing little by little, and in the future open a new car dealership.  This will be her fifth loan through MFP and she’s hoping for your help so that she can continue her objectives.  She is very committed to making her payments, as she has with her previous loans.  With this amount of 2,500 PEN, she will buy more vehicles to continue her business and have a greater variety of makes and models to offer to her customers.

loans.use: Comprar más vehículos.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 36-year-old married man, the father of one child. Since 1998, Youssef has been working as a barber. His business is doing well-enough to cover his family and business expenses. Youssef is a hardworking man with a good reputation.

He is applying for his first loan with Kiva partner, Al Majmoua. He wants to please his customers by renovating his shop. He is optimistic that through this loan he will attract new customers and increase his income. Youssef works hard to provide his family a healthy living. He hopes to start special treatment department in the future.

loans.use: To do necessary renovations in his barber shop.

loans.name: Noriniso

texts.ru: Норинисо пожилая , но очень энергичная женщина, которая в неделю два раза ездит по районным базарам и продаёт мелкий товар( носки, нижние гамажи, хозяйственное мыло),и другие товары первой необходимости. Она закупает товар у городских оптовиков и фирм. У неё небольшой товарооборот, поэтому её кредиты небольшие. Сама Норинисо раньше работала в областной больнице техничкой.На сегодняшний день она пенсионерка и не работает, но т.к наша пенсия минимальная , она старается своим бизнесом везти жизненный цикл. Её муж инвалид второй группы , он занимается домашними делами, ухаживает за скотом и курами. Норинисо на полученный кредит хочет закупить партию хозяйственных средств домашнего быта, которые пользуются спросом у населения.
texts.en: Noriniso is an elderly, but very energetic woman, who travels to the district markets twice per week and sells small merchandise (socks, undergarments, household soap) and other essential goods.  She buys merchandise from city wholesalers and companies.  She has a small goods turnover, and this is why her loans are small.  Noriniso previously worked at the regional hospital as a janitor.  Today, she is a retiree and does not work, but because our pension is minimal, she tries to manage her living cycle with her business.  Her husband has a second-group disability and is involved in household work, such as taking care of livestock and chickens.  Noriniso wants to use this loan to purchase an inventory of essential household goods that are in demand among the residents.

loans.use: to buy an inventory of household goods

loans.name: Las Flores Del Jardín Group

texts.es:
Este Banco comunal se llama “Las Flores del Jardín” está conformado por 16 emprendedores, quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran venta de ropa usada, picadura de leña, mecánica, entre otros rubros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Rancagua.
Marta presidenta del Banco comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pié al costado derecho del grupo, ocupando el primer lugar, usa una polera sin mangas color blanco y pantalón color negro, su cabello lo usa tomado y es de color castaño oscuro.
Se dedica a la venta de ropa usada para varón, dama y niños de todas las edades, trabaja en éste rubro desde hace dos años.
Su horario es relativo, ya que vende puerta a puerta. Comenta que tiene muy buena clientela, quienes en su mayoría son dueñas de casa.
Su mercadería la compra por fardos y aprovecha oportunidades de ocasión.
Con el crédito comprará fardos de ropa usada, específicamente poleras, pantalones y chaquetas.
Una de sus metas es invertir en la compra de ropa nueva.
Marta vive junto a su hija de 2 años de edad, su madre y sus hermanos. Sus sueños son obtener su casa propia, ya ha averiguado el proceso de postulación para obtener el subsidio habitacional, por lo que comenzará a ahorrar.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad que le ha brindado Fondo esperanza, ya que le permitirá invertir en su negocio y generar mayores ingresos. Comenta además que se siente muy cómoda con el grupo del Banco comunal, ya que son comprometidos y responsables.
Rancagua pertenece a la región del Libertador Bernardo O´Higgins. Es una moderna ciudad que regula el principal proceso productivo y exportador agrofrutícola y vitivinícola de Chile. Es también una ciudad minera, debido a que en su cordillera se encuentra la mina subterránea más grande del mundo “El Teniente”, con 4.500 km. de túneles.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called “Las Flores del Jardin” (The Flowers of the Garden) and is composed of 16 entrepreneurs, dedicated to different specialties, among them selling used clothing, cutting fire wood, and repairing vehicles, among other specialties. They all live in the city of Rancagua.

Marta, president of the communal bank, is in the photo, standing on the right edge of the group in the first spot, wearing a sleeveless white t-shirt and black pants. Her dark brown hair is pulled back. She has sold used clothing for men, women, and children of all ages for the past 2 years. Her schedule is flexible, since she sells door to door. Marta comments that her clientèle are in the majority home owners. Her merchandise is purchased by the bundle and she seizes opportunities as they arise. With this loan she will buy bundles of used clothing; specifically, t-shirts, pants and jackets. One of her goals is to buy new clothing as well.
   
Marta lives with her 2-year-old daughter, her mother, and her brothers. Among her dreams is to obtain her own house. She has already submitted the paper work to obtain a housing subsidy, and she has begun to save. 

Marta is very content and grateful for the opportunity offered by Fondo Esperanza to invest and generate a larger income. She comments that she feels very comfortable with the group at her communal bank, who are committed and responsible. 

Rancagua belongs to the Libertador Bernardo O'Higgins region. It is a modern city, dominated mainly by the production and export of fruit and Chilean wine. It is also a mining city in whose mountain chain lies the world's largest subterranean mine, “El Teniente, with 4,500 klm of tunnels.

loans.use: buy bundles of used clothing, specifically T-shirts, pants, and jackets, to sell.

loans.name: Amazone-Nonvignon Group

texts.fr: Le groupe AMAZONE-NONVIGNON est composé de quatre personnes qui sont des amies. C'est la quatrième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Julienne est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Julienne est âgée de 48 ans et vit au Bénin. Julienne n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Julienne est mariée à un certain Sévérin. Le couple a quatre enfants dont certains scolarisés et tous à leur charge. Julienne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Afin d'assurer les diverses charges de la famille, Julienne vend des meules à écraser qu'elle fabrique elle même à base de ciment à son domicile. Julienne s’approvisionne dans une ville du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Julienne sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe AMAZONE-NONVIGNON, un quatrième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les trois premiers prêts ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
AMAZONE-NONVIGNON Group is made up of four women who are friends. This is the fourth time that the members of the group are seeking financial support from Kiva's partner, ALDé, in order to bolster their businesses.

The group's representative, named Julienne, is the one raising her hand in the photograph. She's 48 years old and never attended school. She lives in Benin and is married to one Séverin. The couple has four children to support, out of whom some attend school.

Julienne lives together with her husband and children. In order to cover the various expenses of the family, Julienne sells mill wheels at her home. She gets her supplies in one of Benin's towns.

Eager to satisfy her customers, and in order to increase her revenue and income, Julienne is seeking a fourth loan from ALIDé, together with the other members of the group. The first three loans were repaid without problems.

loans.use: to buy cement to make mill wheels

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor, de 55 años es un hombre responsable. Vive en compañía de Gliceria, su esposa desde hace 23 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo viven con Elvis, el menor al que cuidan en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Casacancha.  Se siente dichoso pues sus hijos, ya mayores le apoyan constantemente. Gracias a ellos puede seguir trabajando en la agricultura. Sembrando papa, olluco y habas en sus 4 parcelas de terrenos agrícolas, pero como siembra en gran cantidad también arrienda otros a terceras personas anualmente. De esa forma puede trabajar con más tranquilidad. Ya tiene 20 años de experiencia vendiendo sus cosechas al mercado mayorista de Huancayo, donde tiene compradores fijos que le otorgan buen dinero por sus alimentos. Asimismo cuenta con animales como toros y vacas, las cuales cría y a veces vende en cualquier apuro económico que tenga. Ahora está incursionando en una variedad de papa de buena calidad y de gran sabor, donde está seguro obtendrá buenas ganancias.  Este es el duodécimo crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para que pueda concretar sus planes. Por otro lado promete cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Además le agrada ser parte de su asociación porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y solidarias. Víctor de recibir su apoyo; invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de fertilizantes naturales para esparcir entre sus cultivos de papa de la variedad nativa.
texts.en: 55 year old Victor is a responsible man. He lives alongside Gilceria, his wife of 23 years. They have 4 children, but they only live with Elvis, the youngest, who they look after in their own house which is in Casacancha. They feel happy because their grown-up children help them constantly. Thanks to them, Victor can continue working in agriculture. He grows potatoes, a root vegetable called olluco, and beans in his 4 parcels of agricultural land. As he sows on a large scale, he also leases land from third parties every year. In this way he can work calmly. He already has 20 years of experience selling his crops in the main market in Huancayo where he has regular buyers who offer him good prices for his produce. He also raises animals such as bulls and cows. He raises these and sells them at times when he has economic need. At the moment, he is trying a type of potato that is high quality and very good to eat, and he is sure he will get good returns on this. This is his 12th loan from MFP and he is waiting for their collaboration so that he can realize his plans. He promises to complete his repayments. What is more, his is grateful to be part of the community bank because all the members are responsible and united. On receiving support, Victor will use the money to buy sacks of organic fertilizer to spread around his native potato plants.

loans.use: To buy sacks of organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 23 años es una mujer responsable. Vive en compañía de su hijo Cristopher a quien cuida en casa de sus padres ubicada en la localidad de Sicaya. A pesar de su corta edad, ella tiene muchas ambiciones una de ellas es abrir su tienda de lácteos en la ciudad de Huancayo, donde pueda vender yogurt, embutidos y huevos. En torno a esta premisa trabaja sin descanso, pues necesita ahorrar dinero para comenzar a concretar su idea. Su principal actividad económica es la siembra de maíz, papa y quinua los cuales realiza en sus 2 parcelas de terrenos agrícolas y si tiene necesidad alquila otros. En cada cosecha comercializa sus alimentos al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Huancayo.
